Summary Heading: Great location, outstanding food (catered event for business conference).
Summary: had outstanding time at this hotel for business conference. Great location and amazing views.  The parking is very tough and limited.  Would stay here again in the future for personal time so that I can explore more of the marina and water.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was put in a room on the first floor that anyone could have walked up to, so a Sk for a different room if they say you are on the first floor.  Not a secure hotel!  Staff was very nice, room comfortable.  Food in the restaurant was good.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wonderful view from the grounds, great service and great rooms! This property overlooks the Doheny State beach park. Check in was smooth as glass, parking attendants were on it the whole weekend (we in-out a lot). Couple of weddings over the weekend and they look like they do a great job for that. The only nit-pick I have for this place were that they have a strictly children's pool (this is the larger one with kid-friendly water attractions), the other pool should be strictly for 14 and up minimum. We visited the higher end resorts in the area and while those are great, they are 2x as expensive, so this is a great balance of value and quality.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beautiful view, wonderful rooms and balconies. Friendly staff, nice bar/restaurant with great views. Beds very comfortable, in room coffee and tea. Only complaint is no free bottled water in room,  $6 Fiji water for sale in room.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I've had better service at a Motel 6
Summary: I really expected a Marriott Resort to have much better service. Let me begin by saying that the staff is very friendly. But they don't deliver what is promised. Room wasn't ready on time, Valet wouldn't pull the car up for us when we needed our forgotten bag, Room had blood stains on the headboard,  We came to check into our room at 4:45 (check in is at 4) and our room was not ready. We were here for a wedding and they didn't have a room for us to get ready in. We had to get ready in the lobby bathroom since the wedding began at 6 pm and we only had a bit over an hour. I expressed the urgency of needing a room since we were late to a wedding but still nothing could be done and they told us they would call us when it was ready. They could only offer to hold our bags and place
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share feedback about your experience at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort and Spa over this past summer. We regret having fallen short of your expectations, as well as our own. Our team prides itself on addressing the needs of each guest we encounter to ensure they have a pleasant stay. Your comments will be shared with our team to help us improve upon any shortfalls or inconsistencies. Our Resort is synonymous with providing an exceptional experience for our guests, so we were happy to hear you felt the staff was friendly.  We do apologize your room was not ready upon check-in and that you were inconvenienced.  We sincerely apologize and regret that you had to retrieve something from your vehicle on your own without the assistance of our valet staff. , this is not indicative of the service levels at the Resort.  Please know that we will be addressing your comments with our team. Thank you again for sharing your experience with us.

Summary: Nice facilities. Close to the marina. Nice restaurants. Enjoyed the pool and got tin. Annoyed there's a resort fee. They should just include it in the room rate. Bikes were nice to go along the beach and bike path along the aquaduct. A bit tricky getting up and down the hill. No self parking with outrageously priced valet parking. Hint: there's free street parking on the side except for Monday morning street sweeping.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope you enjoyed the beach and the marina. We do hope to see you in the future, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: Great spot by Dana Point with great views. Hotel is nice and needs a little TLC to be a luxury hotel, but you can't beat the location and it does have a number of amenities.  Customer service is solid.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was the first time I had experienced a staff that is superior in their customer service efforts. Every single person working for this company went above and beyond. The rooms were clean, the resort area was clean, and the relationships between the staff and their guests were amazing! Great place to stay. I wish all other locations were this attentive to their customers! The location and the view were enjoyable, the food was good food as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We wanted to thank you for your kind compliments regarding our outstanding cutomer service. We are so delighted to hear that every one of our staff members left a lasting impression on you. We find out staff to be committed and extremely caring to all of our guests and we are happy to know that you witnessed this as well. We hope you visit us in the future, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: Love this resort. A beautiful get away with gorgeous views and an easy uber or trolley ride to night life in Laguna. My husband and I got married here 8 years ago. Great for couples, families or friends.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were upgraded to a pool view room. Room was spacious, recently re-decorated, amenities included were robes, in room safe, mini bar (we had staff deliver mini refrigerator), balcony overlooked the pool and the harbor .Linens were crisp, plenty of down pillows, On Demand TV. Sits on top of hill overlooking Dana Point Harbor. There is a huge city park in front of the resort with picnic tables, bbq's wide open green space that has magnificent views and was never crowded!  Hotel bar/restaraunts also have ocean views. Very relaxing. Hubby and I spent 1 late night with coctails and snacks out on their patio.  Spa services - Massage at a $100.00 (there was a coupon on the bed when we arrived) for 50 minutes was okay.  Hotel offers complimentary bikes, surfboards, boogie boards,
Manager Response: none

Summary: I arrived and being a Marriott Member was told I would be upgraded.  So, went to the supposed upgraded room and it "smelled".  Plus it was not attached to the hotel and when I walked into the lobby of this unit it had soiled carpeting and dim lighting.  Could not identify what the odor in the room was but it was a BAD odor.  I went over to turn on the A/C and it would not even turn on the fan...some upgrade?  Went to the front desk as asked to be placed in the main hotel and explained the circumstances...the room in the main hotel was decent.  I recommend that you ask to stay in the Main hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We want to start off by thanking you for being a loyal Marriott Member. We apologize that you were unhappy with your upgraded room and we do regret that your room has an odor. We can assure you that both our Housekeeping team and Engineering team are working to fix any problems with this room. All of our guest rooms are in fact attached to the hotel, we do not have any rooms that are not part of the main hotel. We are happy to hear that we were able to change your room and that the rest of your stay was more enjoyable. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. Your opinion is every important to us.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous Hotel and Property, Excellent Staff
Summary: We visited Laguna Cliffs 12 years ago and have fond memories of the beautiful hotel and surrounding area.  We arrived and received a room on the first level close to the entrance as we requested and it was also across the hall from the pool and kids area.  The pool is great with a kids area pool with a surf board, spray area and mini golf.  The pool overlooks the ocean and is just breathtaking.  Be sure to walk around on the hotel property as it is just stunning.  There are many activities including bocce ball, movie nights, free surf board and boogie board rentals, morning yoga, etc.  We only stayed here a few days and the next visit, we are staying here the entire time. The public beach Doheny is just 5-10 minutes walking distance from the hotel. Yes, the parking is $40,
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Laguna Cliffs for 2 nights to attend a friend's wedding. Despite it being a busy weekend with many wedding guests, the service was impeccable and we had no issues at all during our stay.  The room was a good size, clean and in good condition. The bed was comfortable. Otherwise, we didn't spend a lot of time in the room itself.  I liked the architecture and the design of the hotel, and there were great views overlooking the sea.  All in all, a very enjoyable stay. Next time we are in California we would definitely consider coming here again with more time to enjoy the hotel and its facilities.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is our third visit to this hotel and we would recommend it to everyone - great location for visiting the beaches and towns along the Pacific coast and rooms are clean and inviting. This is the first time that we chose a sea view and it was definetky worth it.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My wife's birthday is on the 4th of July
Summary: We have been coming to the hotel for more than 15 years.  The staff, the rooms, the food and the entire experience was and is excellent.  The GM of the hotel was interested in our well being and did everything in his power to make our stay the best we ever experienced in over 15 years.  We will always return.
Manager Response: Thank you for being such a loyal guest of ours for over 15 years. We enjoy celebrating your wife's birthday with you and we truly appreciate your wonderful compliments. We are delighted to hear that you always leave with a fond memory of Laguna Cliffs and we look forward to having you back again. See you soon!

Summary: Grounds and views are beautiful but the hotel is very shabby. Our upgraded room had a filthy carpet, stains on the duvet, bed sham and sofa. Exposed mattress with a cover that didn't fit, nor did the sheets. Showered in a pool of water daily since tub did not drain correctly. Toilet seat was broken and pillows were like pancakes and smelled. The room was also very musty and damp. We have been premium elite members for  many years and this was the worst hotel we every stayed. To make matters worse the hotel checked us out a day earlier and instead of apologizing, asked if we had edited our reservations. Service was sporadic, sometimes good other times horrible. I hate to have to ask for water twice and still not get it.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your constructive comments regarding your recent stay at our Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa and thank you for being a loyal Marriott Rewards Member.  Please allow us to extend our sincere apologies for the unacceptable maintenance of your guestroom.  Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this guestroom with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future.  As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality.  Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm.  It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.

Summary: Laguna Cliffs Marriott is conveniently located on a bluff near Doheny State Beach, and has terrific ocean & harbor views.  The rooms are typical Marriott quality, and the Vue restaurant & bar serve numerous tasty appetizers/entrees, making our visit relaxing as well as enjoyable.        The resort grounds are nice, as are the two pool/spa areas.  I would definitely stay at this property the next time I visit Dana Point.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I truly enjoyed my time here. the resort is beautiful and the staff is friendly. There are a lot of great activities to enjoy on and off the property. Location is key with hotels and this one is located in the heart of dana point
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your time with us. We are happy that you took advantage of the nearby activities and we hope you were able to walk down to the beach and enjoy the Pacific Ocean. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary Heading: We Left a day Early-Does That Give You a Clue?
Summary: Never have my wife and I left a vacation early‚Ä¶until now. We are very tolerant and flexible but being in customer service businesses we both know the value of taking care of our clients. We decided to take a quick 3-day vacation to one of the many local world class resorts. We chose the Laguna Cliffs having been there for many fun events plus as a 30+ year Marriott Elite Member this seemed like a perfect match. What we came away with was a lifetime of inside jokes like: ‚Ä¢	‚ÄúYou mean you want a bed without any sand in it?‚Äù Nice housekeeping. How did that happen? ‚Ä¢	‚ÄúExtra pillows? No problem? I know it‚Äôs in your profile and reservation but you don‚Äôt mind waiting 4 hours?‚Äù Management communicating with Housekeeping? ‚Ä¢	‚ÄúYou like the noise level of the music at the pool‚Äù What did you
Manager Response: We want to start off by thanking you for being a loyal Marriott Elite Member. Thank you for taking the time to share feedback about your experience at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa over this past summer. We regret having fallen short of your expectations, as well as our own. Our team prides itself on addressing the needs of each guest we encounter to ensure they have a pleasant stay. Your comments will be shared with our team to help us improve upon any shortfalls or inconsistencies. Our Resort is synonymous with providing an exceptional experience for our guests, so we were happy to hear you felt the location was excellent and we certainly hope you'll reconsider giving Laguna Cliffs another opportunity in the future to restore your faith.

Summary: Great location with fantastic coastal views (on a clear day, Catalina Island is clearly visable). Reliable, friendly service throughout the resort, but don't always count on amenities to be in proper working order (example: cardio equipment in the fitness center).
Manager Response: none

Summary: Love this place !! The room with partial ocean view was awesome! Food was good. My favorite of course the Spa! My facial lady was super friendly (sorry I'm not good remembering names üòû) my massage was outstanding the masseuse was great!! Best massage ever!! Even the lost in found people were great!! I lost my necklace and they found it and shipped it right away!!  Dana point is lovely, we went hiking, we took a ride on the trolley and had a blast. We will be back! Love this place!
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and had an amazing facial and massage. We hope you left feeling relaxed and rejuvenated. We are happy to hear that our Loss Prevention team were able to locate your necklace and ship it to you right away. Thank you for your compliments! We look forward to having you return.

Summary: I would have given it 5 stars if there would be service around the pool during the week which there wasn't .  This was my first stay at this beautiful resort.  Everyone was very friendly except for the old lady they have at concierge. Firstly she was rude and had no idea about anything . The rooms are very nice I had a pool view which was very relaxing. On the weekend there is service around the pool the attendants were very friendly.  They have a small Starbucks where we had breakfast .  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pleasant stay but not as family-friendly as anticipated
Summary: We were here for a few days and had a pleasant experience overall but were surprised by the lack of a few basic amenities and family-friendly services, particularly for the hotel class and price. Here's a breakdown along with some tips, especially if you're traveling with a toddler.  PROS: ‚Ä¢ location: situated atop a cliff and close to main streets and harbor/beach ‚Ä¢ service: excellent...literally every staff member we interacted with was friendly and helpful! ‚Ä¢ separate kids pool and splash zone ‚Ä¢ tiny park with single play structure (Lantern Bay Park) across the street/walking distance  CONS: ‚Ä¢ extremely limited (analog!) kids channels...the TVs are digital but not all the channels are which is ridiculous ‚Ä¢ Kids Activity Center not open yet and from what we were told, there
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the resort views and staff service. We appreciate your feedback and your opinion is very important to us. During the summer months, the resort has many children's activities including the Kid's Club. This service is provided to all resort guests at no cost,  we also have complimentary movie nights for children on Saturday nights which includes snacks, drinks and popcorn. We have many complimentary activity rentals as well, some including games. The resort also has a putting green, ping pong table and children's splash zone. We hope you are able to take advantage of all these activities during your next stay with us.

Summary: I was there for a conference and moved from 1 room to the next. The rooms need updating and they are not very clean. Several people at conference said the same thing. Took a shower in standing water which is disgusting. Looked at drain and it has not been cleaned in a really long time. Sink didn't drain well either and the sink plug didn't work correctly. The manager is worthless and did not even have the nerve to come out address the issue. Terrible customer service. Left early and so disappointed and highly upset with your poor customer service! Hopefully corporate will be able to address these issues at this property! I am considering moving to Hilton over this incident! I pay for good service and clean rooms. The only thing nice were the grounds.
Manager Response: Dear Ashley,  Thank you for your review. We regret to hear that you had a few maintenance issues in your guest room. Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future. As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality. It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.  Sincerely,  Ellie Apostolova

Summary Heading: Great drinks - so good food - beautiful
Summary: - pulled in - valet only- call ahead recommended !!  Great little area - bartenders At- phenomenal speciality Bloody Mary - and delicious blackberry mojito.  We're hungry - order grilled cheese and calamari steak - - props on that calamari.  Entree- mahi mahi tacos - husband had the carne asada burrito - no complaints -  everything was wonderful.  Service pretty cool and chill- but working their tails off !  Scenery top notch
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the food and drinks and the beautiful ocean views. We appreciate your compliments and hope you visit our restaurant again soon. We'd love to have you back.

Summary: We had a weekend getaway to the Marriott and the furnishings were a bit worn but the staff was first rate!  Nice pools and friendly pool service with complimentary snacks and good drinks.  Lots of weddings and conferences but we weren't bothered.  The ADA room was well equipped and the staff exceptionally helpful, which was much appreciated.  Many times, that is not the case.  Wish I could give five stars but a little room maintenance was needed.  Grounds were lovely.  Thanks for a very enjoyable stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I went here for a one day getaway with my wife and two kids (1 & 2 year olds) and though I must say the resort has friendly staff and service and awesome location in front of the beach, our room was super dirty.  I am used to going to resorts without having to worry about my little ones walking on dirty floors, couches, and picking up weird particles off the carpet in our room.  First thing we noticed upon check in and kids walking around were the dust particles and used Kleenex near the edge of the couch that our 1 year old almost picked up. There also was a dead bug that I picked up with tissue paper before my kids went near it.  I must say that our room which we booked with (80,000 Marriott points) was the most dirty room I have ever been in my life time. (40,000 points each
Manager Response: Dear Chunho C,  Thank you for your review. We regret to hear that you had a few maintenance issues in your guest room. Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this guestroom with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future. As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality. It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.  We hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Dana Point.

Summary: It has been about one year since we stayed here, and I am still so upset. This hotel left a dark mark on an otherwise wonderful trip touring the California coast. Because of this hotel, I refuse to stay in a Marriott ever again. My husband and I stayed one night at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott. When we checked it, it seemed nice - although dated. We got to our room and the view was beautiful. We went to the bar and enjoyed some drinks outdoors and walked the grounds - they are very pretty! But that's where the good ends. When we left for dinner, it turned out that the valet had misplaced our car key and never finished checking us in. Someone got yelled at in front of us, and it was overall a big ordeal. After a lengthy wait, we got our car, went to dinner, and came back. The valet
Manager Response: Dear SummerLove11,  Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We take matters such as this very seriously.  As a result, please allow us some time to look into this matter further.   Sincerely,  Ellie Apostolova

Summary Heading: Absolutely fantastic service, hospitality, location.... amazing experience and hotel!!
Summary: My first trip to the Laguna cliffs Marriott was in January of this year and I've since been back pretty much every month. This place is an absolute gem hidden amongst overpriced resorts that don't hold up to the standards advertised. This hotel is the complete opposite, they exceed every expectation and service standards are unparalleled. I've stayed at monarch, montage and the ritz nearby and none compare to the experience and overall hospitality that you would enjoy at this location. I love my visits and will continue to come back.... my favourite thing about their team is that no request is too small or minor and they react amazingly to any comments or suggestions.    I highly recommend staying with family, a significant other or just to get away for a weekend. The views are
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A nice Marriott, but it's still a Marriott!
Summary: Inside, a bit dated and not all kept up with. The rooms are in need of some TLC, but again it's a Marriott. Was here on business, nice location, great view from the deck for a drink or food. Gym is smaller than average for a Marriott.  Lots of great food in Laguna, 15 minute ride to the main row.  Pool was nice for kids/families.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Fantastic Hotel near the best wild dolphin watching experience (next to being on your own sailboat)
Summary: I stayed for business, but will return for a family vacation. This property had a very nice blend of modern and seaside decor.  It was surrounded by lands sprinkled with wild bunnies, which makes for entertaining morning runs.  A walk across the property and down some stairs takes you to nice restaurants, and a boardwalk where you can catch a dolphin/whale watching ride. Also, I am Canadian and lost my passport on the plane. The concierge was extremely helpful in assisting me with this problem.  I would stay here again with delight, and I rarely go back since I prefer new experiences, so that is a high compliment from me.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We hope that your business trip was a success and we are very excited to hear that you and your entire family will be visiting us in the future. We appreciate your compliments regarding our helpful staff and we are happy that our Concierge was able to assist you with your passport. We look forward to welcoming you back with your family.

Summary Heading: convenient car rental but otherwise inconvenient to get around
Summary: We were there 4 days for a conference and it was pleasant but had limitations. It is difficult to get lunch seating at the restaurants when there is a conference on site. Breakfast options were limited. We didn't see any breakfast buffet that has been mentioned in other reviews so I guess calling it a best kept secret is accurate. No mention of it in the room brochures about the amenities.There was a wedding as well so valet parking was slower than usual and it is pricey and if you rent a car you then have to pay for valet service. There is a Hertz rental on site which is extremely convenient and you need transportation because there is really nothing walkable unless you want to traipse back up this steep hill where the hotel sits. Doheny State Park is at the bottom of the hill
Manager Response: none

Summary: I recently stayed here for one night on business travel. The gym had plenty of equipment and a good amount of room. The drinks at the bar were a little pricey but standard prices for a resort hotel. I highly recommend the breakfast buffet! The food was very good and worth it.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were lucky enough to stay at the Marriott for the Duheney Blues Festival last weekend.  This property always gets high marks with their service starting at the door to the desk and to the dining outlets.  The only thing they could do better is remember me... we're there a lot.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you are a frequent guest of ours and we apologize that we did not remember you. We will be sure to share this information with our staff so that next time they can be sure thank you for your loyalty. We are happy that you experienced our attentive staff with each visit. We value your opinon and we will be sure to share your comments with our team.

Summary: It was an aweful experience. We booked the room for our wedding night and after our amazing wedding we tried to check in at the front desk. I was not carrying my wallet that evening since I did not want a bulky wallet in my tux but I had two credit cards and phone with me. The front desk refused to check us in while we were standing there in our wedding attire. They said they needed photo ID even though I had two credit cards with correct name on them and also my phone with email confirmation.
Manager Response: Please allow us to congratulate you on your recent wedding.  Thank you for taking the time to share your comments with us. As you can imagine, it is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable and memorable experience. The only thing more important is our guests‚Äô safety and security. To that extend we require a valid photo ID in order to ensure the protection of our guests‚Äô privacy and also to comply with the credit card issuers‚Äô security standards.  Once again, congratulations and thank you for your feedback.

Summary: Stayed here for a business meeting and what a location. The hotel was booked out by my company the entire week so I unfortunately did not get to experience all of the hotels amenities but you could not ask for a more beautiful location. The rooms were nice, the food albeit being catered and buffet style was well done. This is a great hotel for business conferences and I suspect it would be great for couples or families as well.
Manager Response: Thank you for your most recent review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the resort and we hope that your business meeting was a success. We hope you visit us again in the future for business or leisure. We'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: We stayed with several friends for a wedding which was offsite. We were greeted with a very nice young lady who also checked us out. She was extremely cheerful while informing me that the king size bed I had booked was unavailable! She gave us two beds and these beds were extremely short and narrow. We are small people not over 5'6" and our feet would hang off the end of the bed. If one of us turned over in the night to the other one would be uncovered. The mattress on one of the beds was worn on one side which caused you to almost fall out so we slept in the other one. The rooms are small so the beds had to be custom made to fit the room, not the guests. Suggest anyone staying there only accept a king bed.  The facility was extremely busy with weddings and a ball. The bar was
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We want to apologize for the inconvenience you experienced during your stay with us. We are happy to hear that our loss prevention team was able to quiet the disturbing guests near your room and we do appreciate your patience. Please allow us to extend our sincere apologies for the unacceptable maintenance of your guestroom.  Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this guestroom with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future.  As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality.  Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm.  It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.

Summary Heading: You can't beat the location and ambience
Summary: We spent last weekend at the Resort.  Room was spacious, patio had room for several chairs and was the perfect spot to relax before the weekend began.  Breakfast buffet was delicious (outstanding smoked salmon) and all staff were prompt, courteous and extraordinarily helpful.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I try to visit this hotel at least once a year. The location is great, sitting at the top of a hill, with a spectacular view of Dana Point Harbor. The property is just so pleasant, lovely landscaping, nice size rooms, and the staff go out of their way to accommodate you. I highly recommend Laguna Cliffs for a relaxing getaway!
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review and recommendation! We are delighted to hear that you visit us once a year and that your stays have always been memorable and our staff has always been able to accommodate your needs. We enjoy having you and your husband here and we look forward to your next visit.

Summary: Lets start with the good. The property is breathtaking. Beautiful and green and well taken care of. Its honestly one of the most beautiful hotel properties that i have even seen. Bar/lounge has spectacular views and overpriced drinks of course.   The rooms are ok. Average size. Average bedding. They are somewhat dark. We had a pool, ground level room. You have to valet park so you might as well add on another 40 bucks to your stay ( per night). Plus resort fees etc. There were two spiders that we had to kill in our room which freaked me out. But that is not their fault ( I think....).   Pool service was HORRIBLE. The pool itself is great. Comfy chairs and plenty of them.  The guy who was working the pool was not the best fit for the job. He didn't really come around and take
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your compliments regarding our beautiful resort and the spectacular views. However, we do regret that you had to wait a very long time to get your drinks and sandwich. We understand that we were very busy during the time you were requesting your order but our staff is usually very efficient in getting all orders delievered in a timely manner. We do apologize for this and we completely understand your frustration. We will share your comments with the team to ensure that this does not happen in the future. Your opinion is extremely important to us and we want you to know that this was definitely an exception and not the norm for the way we provide service.

Summary: We stayed here for our Annual Company Conference. Overall a beautiful place to have a conference, I mean come on eating ocean side all week? Who wouldn't love that? The rooms are a bit small, but well appointed & clean. Service was excellent and food was great! It is a bit cut up as far as a Resort goes for where things are, but space is limited due to it being so close to the cliffs/ocean. But if that can be your only complaint I think that is pretty good! Thanks Marriott!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great experience from start to finish
Summary: Room:  Clean and comfortable.  Turndown service was executed nicely.  Bottle of water and chocolates provided with Turdown service.  Room included two robes and plenty of towels.    Location: The hotel location is fantastic.  The hotel is on a cliff facing the ocean, so the views are wonderful.  A nicely maintained public park and walking trail are adjacent to the entrance to the hotel.  Service:  Excellent, from beginning to end.  A great staff.  My only concern is that I left a sport jacket in the closet after checking out.  I called and left a message with the Lost and Found department.  Unfortunately, the person who called me back stated that it was not discovered by housekeeping.  While this situation is nobody's fault other than my own, I am concerned that the jacket
Manager Response: none

Summary: Paying additional $67/day (for resort fees and valet parking) on top of their already inflated rates is just not acceptable for a property that may be considered as just slightly above average.  They claim to have the lowest fees in the area, but if you do your own research you know that's a lie.  I have stayed at the Ritz which is a lot more upscale and has direct access to the beach and they charge a resort fee that includes valet parking and is still 40% lower than theirs.  Maybe they have to hire a more competent research team.  Was trying to consider for Memorial Day weekend, until I found out about the fees...
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We appreciate your time to post your comments and we regret that you have chosen to not stay with us because of our resort and parking fees. We do offer packages that include both should you choose to stay here in the future. We do want to point out that the Ritz Carlton does charge $40 for resort fee and an additional $40 for parking. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: Room was perfect.  Clean, staff was beyond friendly.  Everyone was always saying "Hi" to me and willing to help with whatever my needs were.  Was there for two nights, work related.  Be advised:  This hotel is Valet only parking.  Getcha singles ready for gratuity!  (Really though, those bellhops were quick and efficient.)
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We are delighted to hear that you had a wonderful meeting and that our entire staff was kind and ready to help. We appreciate your compliments and we do hope that you visit us again for business or pleasure.

Summary: Pleasantly surprised at this picturesque destination. Reminds you of Hotel del Coronado iin San Diego, but 100 years younger. Very nice rooms with comfortable beds and very friendly staff.Attended big wedding and all was perfect.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was nice. Clean and pretty rooms. Restaurant on property with really good food and drinks. Walking distance to beach, harbor, restaurants, shopping etc. The hotel is a little odd to get around.  We had to walk through wedding parties several times to get to the elevator to our room. Which was sort of awkward. We didn't use the pool area but our room looked onto it. Very pretty.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and liked the food and drinks at the restaurant. We hope you were able to walk to the harbor and enjoy the shops and restaurants. We look forward to having you back in the near future.

Summary: Stayed here in July 2016. Fantastic hotel and lovely, helpful staff. Rooms decent and clean, nothing too flashy but spacious and everything you need. Had a room adjacent to the pool, but none of the 'pool noise' you can experience at other hotels. I can definitely recommend this hotel. Easy walk to the bars and restaurants at the beach too. Valet parking a bit too pricey for my taste though, I used street parking instead.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The view from the hill is beautiful and the lobby is nice.  We received great service from Hunter when he brought our bags to the room and explained the Dana Point highlights. The rooms are just ok...Marriott hasn't upgraded their beds to queen sized yet and the full sized are a bit small if you're traveling with family or friends.  A couple other things that make me crazy: only one luggage rack in the room and very poor water pressure.  I live in Southern California and am aware we were in a severe drought, but a decent shower head can compensate for a lack of pressure. They don't provide complimentary bottles of water in the room, but instead sell them from the mini bar, and although there is a refrigerator in the room they have it so full of things for sale there's no room
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the ocean views and the wonderful customer service our staff provided during your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback and your opinion is very important to us. We will be sure to share your comments with our team. We do provide refridgerators should you need one for your room. Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: En route from San Diego to LA, spent 1 night in this gorgeous hotel.  Lobby is beautiful and front desk staff very helpful.  Arrived at night so didn't see the view until morning. We used the huge hot tub but we all had trouble finding on switch, needs better directions.  It was unseasonably chilly that week so the tub was fantastic.  I used both heated pool & hot tub next day and laid on cushy chairs. We took bikes and rode around the property then down to the waterfront.  So cool and pretty.  Huge hill to get back up. Room for improvement was staff in coffee shop & bar could have been friendlier.  This is also a gorgeous room and sat outside in sun near water feature. Finally, notifying guest of non smoking policy upon check in would avoid an embarrassing situation as my
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your 1 night stay with us. We appreciate your feedback and will certainly share your comments with our team. We look forward to welcoming you back on your next trip to CA.

Summary: Love this hotel!  Everything about it is amazing! Great location! Great food! Beautiful patio for drinks while the sunsets.  Rooms are great.  Everything was clean.  Pool was inviting.  The meeting rooms were nice too.  And the wifi worked amazingly!  I would stay here again for business or pleasure as the staff is so nice and helpful!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was at the Laguna Cliffs resort for a work event... the hotel was so nice, I'm going to have to go back for a personal trip!  The conference rooms were nice and the service was excellent!  Looking forward to going back and laying by the pool!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We are delighted to hear that your work trip was a success and we are thrilled to hear that you want to visit us again for your personal trip. We look forward to having you back for some R&R.

Summary: We spent 6 nights here.  Although, this isn't exactly beachfront, we have zero complaints about the hotel.   Checking in and out was easy.  We ate at the breakfast buffet once for $24 a person.  It was convenient.  We did order room service and our club sandwich, hit the spot.  The pina colada poolside was delicious.    We took advantage of the gym and the bicycles available for use.  We rode about 10 minutes down to the beach for a gorgeous ride.  We walked the property down to many nearby restaurants for dinner.  The staff and valet were all top notch.  Wish the valet was a little cheaper, than $37 a night for parking.   Thanks for making our stay so great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A local weekend away from it all! This resort fits the bill! As expected in a Marriott, the people are fabulous. The room and beds are just wonderful. The in room safe, coffee maker and refrigerator are great features. Our pool view room had a lovely ocean view as well! In room selection, keep in mind that if you want a patio or balcony, stay off the top floor. Those rooms have lovely views but with bay windows instead. I can't give a five star review for two reasons: 1) The walls are really thin. Whisper if you don't want your neighbors to hear you; and 2) A $37 parking fee on top of a $25 + tax resort fee in Orange County is out of line, no matter how many times management claims otherwise. If you keep these fees in mind, and you and your neighbors speak quietly, you will love
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted that we were able to provide that perfect rest & relaxation you were looking for. Thank you for your compliments and feedback. We are delighted that we left you with great memories and we hope you visit us again soon. We'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: Friendly staff, great location, accommodations as expected for brand.  Everything a little pricey- as to be expected on a resort. Had a nice gift shop that had everything needed in a pinch. Wasn't blown away by the resort interior and rooms, but the views and grounds were gorgeous.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spent three nights with family.   Staff had great attitude, but couldn't get over having to pay mandatory costs of $64.50 per day for valet and resort fees.  A guest joined us for breakfast and his cost to park car for 1 hour was $20.00 plus tips.  No concierge floor and $15 breakfast voucher covered less than 1/2 cost of breakfast.  This property is great for conventions when extra fees are waived but not sure about individual travelers. Room was very comfortable although furnishings were nicked and scarred, etc.  There is only one printer in the business center and it was not working.
Manager Response: Dear Strick3,  We appreciate your feedback regarding our parking and resort fee rates and will certainly take your comments under review.  In recent parking and resort fee surveys we‚Äôve conducted with our fellow resorts located on the coastline, we have found our parking and resort fee rates to be in line and are actually the most economical.  I was sorry to hear that you have experienced problems with our business center. We have  addressed this with the appropriate department to ensure this does not happen again.  I was happy to hear that our staff had great attitude which we pride ourselves on. Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Dana Point.

Summary Heading: Worn out hotel, even more worn out staff
Summary: Ocean room king had partial view of ocean in distance. Hideaway was unmade, had urine and blood stains on it. Staff didn't seem to want to accommodate a new mattress or roll-away until I offered to bring the mattress to the lobby. Everything at this hotel includes an 18% gratuity PLUS a service fee. No self-parking. Pool is super small for a resort hotel. Pool staff walked around to everyone and asked if the food they were holding was theirs. I'd recommend staying up the street at the Ritz or Montage and paying a few dollars more.
Manager Response: Dear Daniel G,  Thank you for your review. We regret to hear that you had a few housekeeping issues in your guest room. Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this guestroom with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future.   As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality. Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm. It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.

Summary: The staff at this hotel have to collectively be the nicest group of people I have interacted with at a hotel.  The resort was booked solid, yet everyone went above and beyond to make us feel welcome.  The quality and conditions of this resort were perfect, coupled with the natural beauty of the setting.  I wish we could have stayed longer.  Will definitely be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We earned a "free" night through Hotels.com and decided to spend the night in Dana Point.  However, this "free" night did not include the mandatory valet parking at $37 per night or the mandatory $25 daily resort fee.  It is a big resort with a nice view but is not comparable to most of the Marriotts we have stayed in before.  There are better options in Dana Point for less money.  Not a bad place but definitely over priced.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We are delighted to hear that you chose our resort to stay at during your visit to Dana Point. We value your opinion and will certainly share your feedback with our team. Thank you for your review and we do hope you visit us again in the future.

Summary Heading: Lovely, but loose the parking fee
Summary: Seriously, if the only option is valet, do not charge for it. I really loath when expensive, fancy 'resort' hotels charge for the stupidest stuff...like $35 to park PER DAY, $8 bottled water in the room, and the most ridiculous...the resort fee.   The bed was clean, comfortable and I liked that the windows open.   It had in-room coffee (which is a must) but no empty mini fridge.   This hotel is useless to business travelers like me
Manager Response: none

Summary: I loved the location of this hotel within Dana Point. It's conveniently close to the harbor, restaurants, and places to walk that are amazing. We also visited the on-site bar and restaurant for tasty drinks. We were first given a room that didn't have a nice view overlooking a construction site, but we were given an ocean view when we asked for a room change. Although it was a bit inconvenient to have to change rooms, the request was fulfilled as quickly as possible. The pool and jacuzzi were a dream to use, and we enjoyed our time at this hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful setting, but wouldn't do it again
Summary: It does offer a great view.  Two pools, but neither are that larger so you are always very near others.  Rooms are nice, but room fridge is packed full of items so you cannot use it for your own leftovers or drinks.  Beds and shower great, but if you are only concerned with that you could get the same for half the price.  I guess you are paying for the location.  We did walk around downtown and at the harbor, but I did not find it to be anything that amazing.  I guess it is an okay thing to do once, but wouldn't do it again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the resort views and guest rooms. We are happy to hear that you found the beds to be comfortable. We appreciate your feedback as your opinion is very important to us.

Summary: Utter Disappointment.   I was told that this property is rated an 8 of 9 on a scale of 1-9, by the reservations agent.  This is absolutely not the truth. It is a worn,  dirty hotel with outdated bathrooms and filthy carpet in common areas.  I was also told at check-in that my room was being upgraded to an ocean view.   The ocean view was, of the road and hotel restaurant.   The door to my room had a 1 inch crack between the door and door frame.  The drain plug in the tiny bath/shower was rusted and sink was permanently chipped and stained.  Traveling on business,  I often work in my room.   Housekeeping starting knocking on my door at 8 am.   After 4 interruptions between 8 and 9:30, I finally gave up and checked out of this overpriced, outdated, filthy hotel.   There are far
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We apologize for the inconvenience you experienced. Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this guestroom with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future.  As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality.  Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm.  It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.

Summary: Ok, this is a little pricier than the mid-range hotels I usually stay at, but this was a bit of a splurge getaway anyhow, so why not? Rather large, well kept up property overlooking Lantern Bay Park and the ocean. You take a winding road up the hill, go between a couple of the resort's buildings, then pull up to the valet stand, next to which sites a restored 1940 Ford Woodie. Spacious front desk area connects to a bar with the nice view listed above. I did not ask for it,  so was very pleasantly surprised when they upgraded my room during the check-in process. Very nice! Room was great: big, comfortable bed, good sized TV, desk with lots of outlets (always a plus), and a balcony overlooking the pool area, and out toward the park and ocean views again. What a great place to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing, Honestly can't think of anything bad
Summary: Well this place was amazing, gym, meals, yoga, it had everything. I don't really think much more could be done. The service is great with fast valet, good service, and overall nice staff. I dropped a few things and three or four staff members came and helped me out. It was actually kind of embarrassing. Another time I was carrying bags and it was difficult for me to open the car door and trunk, and consequently, three staff members rush over and open the doors. It's those little things that make your stay go from average to fantastic.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful facility, but super thin walls
Summary: Went there for a conference, facility and grounds are great.  Pools, hot tubs, spacious lawns and yoga were on-site.     It was chilly in March with the winds and the conference was set up for mostly outdoor dining so be prepared for cool weather, especially with the sun down.  The Vue restaurant was good and bar/dinner entrees were reasonably priced  considering  (not cheap)  Wifi is expensive and the service is not really reliable considering a $15 per day charge  Rooms had very comfortable beds, but the walls were SO thin, heard everything the neighbors said.  Shower was fair, low water pressure.   The parking is restricted to expensive valet service only.  Airport transportation is high $65+  They do have a Hertz onsite as well so this is handy to get a rental for a day.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review..we are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. We hope that your conference was a success. We appreciate your feedback and we hope you visit us again in the future, for business or pleasure.

Summary Heading: Incredible venue for a business conference!
Summary: My company recently hosted its annual user conference at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa. The property was gorgeous and meticulous, the scenery was beautiful, overlooking the Dana Point Harbor and Pacific Ocean. The staff were right on top of things at all time. The meals were delicious even for such a large crowd of people. The rooms were cleared of trash during each break and water was replenished. And even the water had either lemons, limes, or cucumbers in it for a little added flavor. The only complaint I had was that the temperature of the main conference room always seemed to be too cold. But each time we complained, they adjusted it to be warmer. I would definitely recommend this hotel for another business meeting!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Laguna Cliffs Marriott has amazing hospitality. Each staff person from the front desk, housekeeping to the fantastic valet guys who must run 20k steps a day, are friendly, caring and helpful. My college aged daughter and I stayed for week from March 12-18 (2017) and even extended our stay. But the most surprising and wonderful extension of hospitality came the day we were leaving. After driving to LA to drop my daughter at USC, I realized I had left my passport in the hotel safe. My flight back to the Netherlands was leaving in 3 hours- no time to drive back to Dana Point and make my flight. I contacted the hotel that swiftly transferred me to Charlie Wright in Loss Prevention who retrieved my passport from the safe and assured me he was going to help get it to me in time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you not only enjoyed your stay with us but that our staff made your experience one that you will not soon forget. Our staff is truly dedicated to our guests and we are delighted to hear that one of our staff members was able to retrieve your passport and drive it to LAX in a timely manner so that you don't miss your flight. We couldn't be more proud of our staff and we appreciate your review. We hope you and your daughter visit us again in the future, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary Heading: Poor service in a lovely location
Summary: The hotel grounds over look the beautiful Dana Point coastline.  The service in this hotel was poor from start to finish.  It took multiple calls to get housekeeping to attend to our room.  On the last day our room was never serviced.  The room are adequate but nothing special and could use updating.  Waitstaff in the restaurant do an adequate job but nothing special.  We will not return.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We regret to hear that you had a few service issues in your guest room. Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future. As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality. Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm. It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.  Upholding our commitment to provide a memorable experience with exceptional service, we hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Dana Point

Summary: We stayed here in January 2017 for a wedding with my mother, husband and 3-year old daughter. Although this hotel is used for events, it does not have basic conveniences or cater to families. There is also a lack of customer service that you would expect from this type of resort.  My mother arrived before us and even though we had specified the room type and number of guests in advance, they put her in a King room. She didn't want to say anything but when she sent us a picture of the room that obviously only had one bed, we told her to go back and ask for two queens. Instead they gave us a handicap-accessible room, which I wouldn't mind but with a 3-year old was unfortunate to not have a bathtub. At this point, we decided just to deal for a few nights.  The mandatory valet
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Your opinion is extremely important to us and we do regret that you felt inconvenienced during your stay with us. We want to inform you that we do provide 24 hour room service for the guests convenience and we also provide many family activities both at the resort and nearby. We provide complimentary bike rentals, surfboards, game boards, bocce balls, etc. for the entire family. We also have wonderful water activities down in the harbor and nearby. We also have two heated pools, one which features a children's splash zone. We hope you were able to take advantage of these activities during your stay. Our intention is to make your stay as comfortable and pleasurable as we can. We will address your concerns with our staff and we do hope that you give Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa another chance to restore your faith.

Summary Heading: Nice property- Not sure whether it is the best for a wedding
Summary: Went to a wedding at Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa. The hotel has a nice view of the ocean, although it is not an ocean front property. The valet staff was friendly and knowledgeable. Cole assisted us with luggage and answered all of our questions. The front desk clerks were efficient, and the concierge staff was friendly and helpful.  As for the wedding venue... it was a little unusual. The ceremony setting was on the ocean view lawn in front of the hotel. Large tents were erected, and the view was very pretty. What was unusual, was the lack of privacy. Although the hotel is uphill from the lawn, we noticed hotel guests standing on the front balcony to watch the ceremony. They were behind the guests, and fairly quiet, so that was not too disruptive. To the left of the
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: A typical Marriott in an atypically nice locale
Summary: The Marriott Laguna Nigel is a typical Marriott hotel in decor and ambiance. The rooms are average in size and have the older Marriott decor rather than the newer, more chic style to which many Marriott hotels have been retrofitted. The pools and sauna are nice but not remarkable. The hotel restaurant is quite small and unimposing but the food is decent. The key attraction of the hotel is the spectacular location and stunning vistas. These are worth the stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback and will certainly share your comments with our team. Your opinion is very important to us. We hope you visit us again during your next travels to Dana Point.

Summary Heading: Rude and Clueless Front Desk Staff
Summary: I usually love Marriotts but I have to say, I have never been treated so badly at any hotel, Marriott or otherwise, as I was at this one. I booked my stay directly on the resort's website, even though I had found a lower rate on another site, because but the Marriott reservationist on the phone told me about the "Look no Further" direct booking program. She said all I had to do was fill out a form when I got to the hotel and they would match the rate, jus 25%, as it states on the site. Great! When I arrived at the hotel, however, the front desk manager said he had no idea what I was talking about and made me show him the program on the Marriott site. He then insisted that they do not match rates, that's their property "policy" and that they do not have follow Marriott's rules
Manager Response: We want to start off by thanking you for being a loyal Marriott vacationer. We do apologize for the inconvenience you experienced upon arrival. Our intention is to make your stay as comfortable and pleasurable as we can. After speaking with our staff we were notified that both of our Front Desk Agents did explain the "Look no Further" policy and all are aware of this program. We do understand your frustration and we hope that you give Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa another chance in the future to restore your faith.

Summary Heading: no regrets choosing to stay here
Summary: it is perfect if you do not wish to be within walking distance of the "downtown" area.  beautiful views and it is a full service resort (including spa.) within walking distance to a beach, marina with shops and good coffee/bagels spot.  if you are looking to "get away" it is a great choice.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa for a one night get away.  Everything was great from the check-in to our check-out.  The room was very nice as well as the grounds.  The staff that checked us in were excellent and made a great recommendation for dinner.  The Concierge made our reservations and we had a wonderful meal overlooking the bay.  We also relaxed at the pool which was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: This was the disappointment of the last few years
Summary: I am and always will be a big Marriott fan but today, they did me wrong at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott; I booked my room weeks before & upon checking in, I was told my room was not ready but they will rush the cleaning of it; they took my cell # & after a 2 hours wait no call no update but in the meantime guests are waltzing in & getting their rooms; after a 2.5 hrs wait I walk over & ask again & to my surprise the room is ready  - get to room - average at best; no privacy kids screaming from pool area & other rooms - found a worm on the floor - Kleenex box is empty - for the price of $1500 for 3 nights, I would expect a sort of suite - I have to say my stay here so far is a disaster of enormous proportions - their only restaurant is under construction valet is $37 a night &
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for being a loyal Marriott traveler. We do apologize that you had to wait for your guest room to be ready. It is our intent to make sure that your room is ready upon arrival. Please allow us to extend our sincere apologies for the unacceptable maintenance of your guestroom.  Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this guestroom with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future.  As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality.  Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm.  It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.

Summary: Really nice property with spectacular views.   good rooms, good service, good staff.  up above the ocean .  nice parks around the property.   was only there for one night but would love to go back and spend some more time.   is simply a really nice area to knock around
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Standards having dropped dramatically from one year ago.
Summary: We didn't get the same standard of service that we did a year ago at this hotel. We added a 3 night stay here at the end of a 12 day holiday in southern California. We didn't get the requested adjoining room with our sons as we had requested in an email 2 weeks prior to arrival even though both our rooms did have an adjoining door just not to each other. So the first night we lived out our suitcases.  The second day we moved our suitcases down a floor to rooms that were adjoining. We spent the day at the pool and on arriving back to our rooms at 15.45hrs our rooms had not been serviced. (do not expect to have to call housekeeping at that time to have rooms serviced) We ate out that night but on our return sat in sofa seats near reception and wall fire and I approached the bar to
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We want to start off by thanking you for your loyalty to the resort and we are delighted to hear that you returned to stay with us. Unfortunately, due to high occupancy we don't guarantee adjoining rooms. You can request them but they are not guaranteed. We are happy to hear that we were able to provide adjoining rooms on your second night. We appreciate your feedback and we understand that someone has already contacted you regarding your concerns. Usually we receive many fine compliments regarding the resorts service. Thank you again for your review.

Summary Heading: Loved it so much we came back after 2 weeks
Summary: I have the opportunity to visit Southern California quite often and have stayed at many different resorts.  The Laguna Cliffs Marriott was one of the nicest experiences we have had. My initial check-in was with Erin and Samantha. They could not have nicer or more helpful. This was a trip with my daughters, both of my girls enjoyed talking with them and learning about the area. They were also very accommodating to our room needs. Because of their hospitality my husband and I returned 2 weeks later. I had called ahead and asked for the same room. Tiffany, a front desk manager, went above and beyond getting our room assigned. After we arrived I was able to meet her and Mike, also a front desk manager.  We are considering a move to the area and both of them were very helpful in
Manager Response: none

Summary: Dana point is arguably the most beautiful spot in California and the Laguna Cliffs Marriott has the best piece of the view. But, if you are looking for comfort, relaxation, or service you are wasting your money. There is a reason why even the local  Best Western gets higher ratings despite being a "lesser quality" brand than Marriott. Please spend a bit more and truly enjoy your stay in this gorgeous town.  We had many issues during our stay: fire drills falsely going off SIX times keeping us awake, beds so creaky and saggy they seemed unsafe, chipped and peeling furniture, jacuzzi badly in need of resurfacing, LOUD pool equipment running all night, and incredibly poor acoustics from neighbors in above and adjacent rooms.   However, what made it unbearable was the way the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We apologize for the unsatisfactory service you received. Our job is not only to meet the guest‚Äôs expectations but to exceed them. We value your opinion and comments greatly and we take every review seriously. I want you to know that we will be addressing your concerns with our team.

Summary: Stayed the week of February 12th for work.  Very nice location right on the beach at Dana Point.  Quiet room with a porch and two chairs outside facing the pool.  Nice fitness center with plenty of equipment.  The hotel is up the hill from restaurants and quick access to the highway.  There is good food options on the grounds but the prices can be steep.  The only difficulty I had was parking.  There is only valet parking and some of the valets can be a bit rude at times.  I brushed it off, and did not allow a couple kids to take away from an otherwise stellar week.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed staying with us during your business trip. We do appreciate your compliments and we apologize for the unsatisfactory service you received from our valet team. We usually receive many fine compliments from our valet staff and we will be sure to address your comments with our team. We hope you visit us again for another fabulous time at the resort whether it be for business or pleasure.

Summary Heading: Great place for a business related get away
Summary: Very nice hotel in a uniquely picturesque location.  The business/conference rooms and related facilities were top notch and were just right for the manger's retreat we held here.  The main lobby and restaurant/bar was very inviting and the rooms were well appointed and had great views of the marina and ocean.  Thanks for a great stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband, kids and I spent the weekend here for my birthday.  It was great from the time we checked in until we left.  The staff was very friendly and efficient.  Erin at the front desk was very kind and offered us breakfast for two as a treat for my birthday and gave us a lovely pool view.  She suggested things to do in the hotel for kids.  Also, our server, Miguel in the Vue Restaurant, was fantastic.  He was super attentive and made our breakfast experience very enjoyable.  Brooke went out of his way to give our children hot chocolate and cookies while we were playing in the game room.  I can not say enough great things about the great staff at this hotel.  Beautiful hotel with an amazing staff!! Thank you for making my birthday weekend a wonderful one.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Feels more of a business hotel
Summary: My fianc√© and I stayed here as he was attending a conference within the hotel. He was astounded by the conference facilities and thought they were the best he had experienced. Regards the hotel itself, it was in a beautiful situation with great views and a good (but busy) fitness centre. The room was nice, and good size and we had booked one with a sea view which again was lovely. The chef in the bar area was amazing and went above and beyond for me creating a Vegan dish that was delicious and wasn't even on the menu, the staff really are one of the best things about this hotel. A couple of things weren't 100% though, the shower was luke warm at best, the tap water in the bathroom sink smelt so strongly of sulphur I didn't want to even clean my teeth with it, and there was an
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear that your husband was very pleased with the ballroom and that you found the resort guest room, culinary options, staff and views to be great. We appreciate your feedback and will be sure to share your comments with our team. Your opinion is very valuable to us and hope you both visit us soon for business or pleasure, we would love to welcome you back.

Summary: This hotel is not worth it. Does all of the little things wrong. Stayed here for 3 days. Shower was cold and would not heat up and the tub was clogged. Our room was changed due to bites on myself and my wife. The mandatory $37 valet parking (with free parking on street that conveniently does not allow parking from 11pm to 5am) was super slow. Valet would take 15-20 minutes to retrieve my car and made me late to dinner twice. Towels were old and rough. Add $60 to the listed price per night in resort fee and parking. Overvalued. Does have great views and conveniently located on marina.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your recent stay at our Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa. We will be sure to share your comments with our team.  As you can imagine, it is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and upon your report we requested for Ecolab (an independent pest control company) to assess this situation.  Ecolab informed us that no activity was detected. Your opinion is extremely important to us and we so apologize for the wait time for valet to retrieve your vehicle. We understand that this was frustrating for you.

Summary: Fabulous rooms, great ocean views, wonderful water front restaurant, great Staff. The food was superb and they had a wheelchair for one family member who was handicapped. Our reservations were on time, the food was the best we've had at a hotel in a long time and all six of us gave it an excellent review. We even introduced our friends who live in Dana Point to it and now they go for dinner or cocktails.
Manager Response: none

Summary: From the minute we checked into this hotel we felt as if our comfort and enjoyment was top priority. When checking in the friendly and efficient staff noticed we would only be there for the night and waived the facility fee (for the use of bikes etc). It was fast, professional and friendly. The room was comfortable and lovely and while it was not a room with an ocean view we could still see the ocean and the moon rising over the town. The little touches such as chocolate on the bed were appreciated and our room had a sleeper sofa and a balcony. Had we had more time there was plenty to do both at the resort and the Dana Point park which was literally just down the hill.I will definitely return should I find myself in the area- a really nice resort with top notch staff.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Enjoyed our stay at Laguna Cliffs. Got a great rate on Travelzoo, glad we took advantage of it. Waved 25 dollar resort fee, which seems a little pricey given amenities included. Kudos to Maclean at front desk for acknowledging my Marriott status and upgrading us to partial ocean view room. Suite was large, comfortable, and quiet. Great view from patio of hotel restaurant and lounge. Only downside is 37 dollar daily charge for valet parking. Added 25% to basic room cost which is exorbitant, even at the discounted price.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that our Front Desk Agent was able to upgrade you to an ocean-view suite. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and we hope you visit us again in the future, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary Heading: Spectacular place to wind down for Spring Break with the kids
Summary: Great view overlooking the pool and the Ocean.  Concierge handled much of our daily planning. Couldn't have managed without her.  They provided hotel car to our favorite restaurant at the Chart House.  The pool is immaculate with superb service by the pool. Also, great terrace dining available with a great view as well.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: When things go wrong, Management is no where to be found and makes you feel bad
Summary: I took my wife here on a romantic getaway for the night.  We decided to take a dip in their Del Mar jacuzzi.  The water was warm but had a very strong odor of chlorine. We didn't think too much of it until later the next day when we noticed upon our return home that our bathing suits had been drained of their color and a very expensive gold ring I had given my wife was tarnished to a black color.    The very next day, per the front desk's suggestion, I sent a email to the Hotel Manager as well as left him a voicemail message to a) inform him of the ridiculously high levels of chlorine in the jacuzzi and b) let him know of our damages including our ruined bathing suits and my wife's discolored ring.  I never received a single call or response from the Manager which shows already
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.  Please be assured we take these situations very seriously and we understand that you spoke with the Resort's Insurance company to state your claim. This is proper protocol in order to open a claim.  This is for your protection as well as ours and we apologize if this made you feel uncomfortable.  We empathize with the circumstances you‚Äôve described; however, we‚Äôve received confirmation that a thorough investigation was conducted and due to their analysis we regret this claim has been denied and no compensation will be offered.  We truly value your patronage and trust you understand our position with this matter.  Thank you again for your review.

Summary Heading: Very pretty but few food options
Summary: Very nice accommodation with lovely view.  However, being on a very high hill/cliff, one would hope for a few food options without having to literally mountain climb, drive, or uber.  There is a bar/restaurant that has a very limited and very expensive menu.  $18.00 for a simple burger before taxes, resort fees, tips, etc.  There is a very expensive downstairs restaurant that is open only for breakfast except on the weekend.  Menu is similar to bar menu.  I got a hamburger and tea and it came to $30.00 before tip.  I made the trek down the mountain and back up again twice by foot.  We ended up taking an uber to go to a decent and more reasonable restaurant for dinner.
Manager Response: Thank your for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your guest room during your stay with us. We do regret that you were not happy with the choice of menu items at our restaurants. We are happy to hear that you were able to dine at a restaurant of your liking that was near the Resort. We appreciate your feedback and we hope that you visit us again in the future, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: My lady had said, for three years running, that she'd never been to California and never seen the Pacific before. So, as an add-on to our Vegas trip for grandkids birthdays, I reserved a short stay at this Marriott to show her both.   Given that late January is a very slow time for resorts along the coast, I was prepared to find staff only exerting the minimum of effort to accommodate us. Big mistake. HUGE!    From the valet who guided us in to the entrance, to the front desk staff who went far above expectations, and to the concierge who arranged for a birthday dinner at THE local upscale restaurant, we were both surprised and completely satisfied with such attentive, focused efforts.
