Our room? A king bed with famous Marriott bedding and French doors opening to a small
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have been here a few times for work and pleasure.  The rooms are comfortable.  The staff are great.  Everyone provides great service from the bell desk, valet and front desk.  The meeting rooms are all in the same area.  The food at the restaurant is good.  There are plenty of outside tables to enjoy the California sun!!  The location is walking distance to the harbor where there are more restaurants to pick from.  If you want to avoid the valet cost of $35/night, there are street parking if you get lucky.  It is a easy walk up to the hotel.  The one thing that is a bummer, the bar closes at 12:00 or 12:30 am on the weekdays.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were disappointed with this property.  The outside grounds, entry and common areas were all very nice.  But the rooms were a disappointment.  They could really be redone.  Not up to Marriott standards.  We had a king size bed which could probably have been replaced.  There was also a $25 resort fee and a mandatory $37 parking fee(valet service only).  I think we would hesitate to stay there again.
Manager Response: Thank you for all of that wonderful feedback. We listen to every piece of feedback our guests provide us. Our highest mission is to provide the exact service and facilities that our guests want, deserve, and expect. We regret that we fell short of your expectations. We appreciate your feedback regarding our parking and resort fee rates and will certainly take your comments under review.  In recent parking and resort fee surveys we‚Äôve conducted with our fellow resorts located on the coastline, we have found our parking and resort fee rates to be in line and are actually the most economical.  Thank you again for your review and we do hope you visit us again in the future.

Summary: We came out bc my brother lives in Torrance and I was told by a client to stay in Dana point next time I came to California. This resort is great! Very relaxing and beautiful. Great attention to detail with everything the hotel has to offer. Great Vue restaurant and Starbucks coffee in the morning with spectacular views of the pacific. The only thing I would be aware of is that there is lots of walking to get to the ocean and boardwalk. You have lots of hills and stairs to get through so I wouldn't recommend for people with foot/knee problems. Also the beds could be a little more comfy but overall it was a great experience and will definitely recommend and hopefully come back again! The spa was wonderful too and I am writing a separate review on that!
Manager Response: none

Summary: They Marriott Laguna Cliffs Resort in Dana Point, offers spectacular views of the Southern California coastline. The resort is situated above the Dana Point Harbor / Marina on extensive and well manicured grounds. Beautiful pools and public areas, along with a very fine Spa and fitness center. Nice restaurant and cocktail lounge with available outdoor seating to enjoy the California sun. Rooms are above average in size with all the usual Marriott Resort amenities. The beds are comfortable and The View from the room balcony is always delightful. Everyone that we encountered from management, concierge, front desk and housekeeping we're all very helpful, friendly, and accommodating. Public areas are all very attractive, but the rooms are beginning to show some wear, hence the
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was one of the most low tech rooms I have ever stayed - for a Marriott Resort property charging in excess of $250 a night, it is inexcusable.  There was no refrigerator in our suite, although for an additional $20 they would provide one for you.  There is not one USB connection in the room - not on the TV, the iPod radio, or the desk. Please add a Bose sound system.  The iPod connection on the radio is not a lightning connection, so unless you have an iPhone 4, it won't plug in  Limited TV stations, with most being analog - who watches analog broadcasts anymore.  There is a nice workout room, but they charge $20 a day resort fee which includes the pools and gym. Our 5 night stay was $100 in resort fees, about 5 months of membership in my much nicer gym.  Because of the cool
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We regret to hear that you were unsatisfied with the technology in the rooms. We appreciate your feedback and will certainly share your comments with our team. We value your loyalty to the Marriott brand and your opinion is extremely important to us. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: We reserved 2nd highest cost room, partial ocean, advertised as 425 sq ft.  Though most rooms on floor empty, gave us small, cramped end room that was worn and missing basic amenities in bathroom, like hook for shower towels, cotton balls, etc. Closet was virtually unusable.  For nearly $400 with tax, resort, and parking fee, they could have done better.  When I indicated on Marriott review, they gave bureaucratic response and essentially denied it was half size of other rooms at same price.  Doesn't appear that the responder had even been in room in question (3014).  Overall property not bad, but staff needs to learn about their property. I suppose i could have trudged back to desk to get a new room, but i travel 75+ nights per year and don't think it should be up to the guest
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and your loyalty to the Marriott brand.  We regret that the guestroom did not meet your expectations. Our goal is to not only meet your expectations but to exceed them. We wanted to inform you that there is a hook behind the door for your towels and we are not sure why the closet was unusable as they are a decent size with ample amount of hangers. We do regret that it was not to your liking. Your opinion is extremely important to us and we will be sure to address your concerns with our team. Thank you again.

Summary: This property is very lovely. The setting is beautiful.  Holiday time with all the lights is like a fairy tale setting.  Food is great and service exceptional. The concierge Linda was beyond helpful and friendly.  Enjoyed our chats and her right on point restaurant recommendations.  She made my husband's birthday very very special. Thank you Linda and all the staff.  We will be back.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a great overnight stay at this Marriot property. Being loyal Marriot guests we were given a wonderful ocean view room, even with an early check in time. Although we had a few minor issues with the room, overall this is a quality resort. Management took care of us to make up for the small problems so we were very appreciative of the great customer service here. The lobby area is nicely done, with pretty bar/dining room that offers great sea views. The resort has a spa, bikes available for guests and even a free yoga class. The weather was cold so we did not enjoy the pool or any outdoor areas but the hotel atmosphere is upscale yet casual. I highly recommend. Only down side is the parking option. Valet only and the price is steep.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Although I have given this property a poor review let me say first the hotel and amenities are good, clean - exactly what you would expect of a Marriott resort hotel. However their hotel services and customer service left a bad taste in my mouth. And it might be just me but I really resent it when I book a room in a hotel with amenities but the charges per day almost exceed the cost you have paid for your stay. Let me explain... I was there for a business conference which ran from 8am - 8pm - despite that I was still forced to pay a resort fee of $25 per day even though there was no time to use anything. This resort fee was for a strange list of items like boogie boards and surf boards and didn't actually include the spa facilities although I was told it did at check in. The
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your recent visit to our Laguna Cliffs Resort & Spa.  We appreciate your feedback regarding our Resort Fee and parking fees  and will certainly take your comments under review.  In recent surveys we‚Äôve conducted with our fellow resorts located on the coastline, we have found our Resort Fee ($25 plus tax) and parking rates ($37 per vehicle per night) to be in line and are actually the most economical.  The high-speed internet fees are included in the Resort Fee and as such do not appear as an additional charge.  I was happy to hear that you had discussed the matter with our Front Office Supervisor who was able to offer a resolution. Thank you again for your review. We hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: Beautiful hotel, spectacular view, great indoor and outdoor dining - brunch can't be beat. Immaculate rooms. The entire staff couldn't have been more polite, respectful or willing to assist in any matter. Herman in particular was most helpful getting me a cab at 5 AM. Easy walk to the Dana Point Harbor. A great place to stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel was so clean. From the lobby to the room every detail is taken care of and clean! The staff and valet/bell hop were very friendly and helpful. I enjoyed my time there! I was a little disappointed that the room was a little small. But still so nice! I will definitely be staying there again in the future.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you found the hotel to be clean and the staff to be friendly and helpful. We look forward to having you return. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: This hotel is a great place to bring the family and have a nice getaway near great attractions, also has great pools and activities. You definitely pay for it with rates and the dreaded resort fee but it is well worth it. Front desk service is exceptional and the views are amazing.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are happy that your family enjoyed the getaway and that you were to utilize the amenities of the resort. We hope you visit us again soon. We'd love to welcome you all back.

Summary: The Laguna Cliffs Marriott main attraction is its location to The Dana Point Marina and its great views overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  We also found the staff to be attentive and eager to meet our needs and requests.  At check in we were pleasantly offered an upgraded room without prompting from us.  However the excessive resort and parking fees charged daily on top of the already expensive room charges left us feeling a little fleeced given the lack of resort amenities and services.   On balance for us, this was a great two day visit but with expectations not quite met.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago and loved it so we returned with our family. This time we had several issues. We had asked for 2 balcony rooms when we reserved, but when we arrived, there were no balconies available  even though we checked in early and were willing to wait.  We went to the beautiful pool area both days, there was no drink or food service which seemed odd at a resort property. The first day, there wasn't even wAter available.  The hotel said it had a shuttle, but the night we were there they said they had no one to staff it.  Although it is a beautiful property, it really needs some fine tuning for me to return.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We regret that your experience here was not the same as your first. It is very important to us to make every experience you have at Laguna Cliffs pleasurable and pleasant.  We appreciate your feedback and would like to inform you that unfortuanately, do to occupancy levels we cannot guarantee you a room with a balcony. We do take requests but these are not guaranteed. We also wanted to let you know that we do offer food and beverage service at our pools through our in-room dining. We do apologize if you were not aware of that. We value your opinion and comments greatly and we take every review seriously. We want you to know that we will be addressing your concerns with our team.  We thank you for your loyalty to our property and we recognize that this resort held a special place in your heart. We want to continue to create those beautiful memories for you.

Summary: Stayed at this hotel during company event (seminar).  The hotel had very nice views of the Pacific Ocean and the surrounding grounds are also well maintained.  The room was big and spacious with clean bathroom.  Pros: - very nice location with stunning views - meeting rooms/conference rooms for company event was very big and well organized for such an event - food provided was good (lunch and dinner) - room was nice and big and clean - view from room was towards the mountains behind the hotel (away from the ocean).  Cons: - very big hotel. It took a while to walk from the room towards the conference center and lobby. - parking was valet only.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family spent the week driving down the California coast with this being our last stop. We stayed in other resort hotels and this by far was the worst. We are Elite members and paid extra for a coastal view. We got to our room and had a slight corner view of the ocean. We checked at the desk and were told that is considered a coastal view. When we checked in we had to urge the valet to come over and take our bags and our car. Each time we called for our car we received it quickly, but than had to chase the attendant down to get out key. When we left no one came to help us with our bags. The room was acceptable, but nothing special. Our bed made a horrible sound every time you moved. If I had to say something positive, the breakfast was good and the location was central to
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and for your loyalty to the Marriott brand. We want to apologize for the inconvenience you experienced during your stay with us. We regret having fallen short of your expectations, as well as our own. Our team prides itself on addressing the needs of each guest we encounter to ensure they have a pleasant stay. Your comments will be shared with our team to help us improve upon any shortfalls or inconsistencies. Our Resort is synonymous with providing an exceptional experience for our guests, so we were happy to hear you felt the location was excellent and we certainly hope you'll reconsider giving Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa another opportunity in the future to restore your faith.

Summary: 1 bag attitude to take it to my room for 38.00 a night parking never said there was not a tip and there was 10.00 tip for the one bag - room only had 2 thru 9 tv stations with good reception other stations needed digital that was not available. Asked for ice.... again attitude took 1 1/2 hours called to ck yes we have requested that with tone and attitude still 10.00 tip once it finally arrived. Doing me a favor to stay here for 400.00 a night to bring ice and my bag. Not up to par for Marriott. Staff clearly hates their jobs and show it. Hope you  find a better choice nearby there are many options with a better experience.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments about your recent stay. As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. Please accept our sincere apology for the maintenance issue with the TV and the delay in receiving service. We have shared your feedback with our team to ensure that this was an isolated issue that is corrected moving forward.

Summary Heading: Superb view and service! Great stay
Summary: The location is beautiful, the room was quiet and large. Staff is very welcoming and helpful. The pools are nice and the hotpool very comfy.  We had a really good time, we left the car for 2 days and just walked to the beach and marina. We enjoyed everything!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was in the area visiting friends and stayed here. The front desk agent was awesome and very welcoming. I think her name was Samantha? The room was beautiful and had a great view of the pool and ocean. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. Probably my favorite Marriott I have ever stayed in!
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that our warm staff made your stay pleasurable and memorable. Thank you for your recommendation and we hope that you stay at your favorite Marriott again. We'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: Room clean but dated, mattress is not up to Marriott standards. And wow, talk about overpriced bar prices. 10 bucks for a draft beer? Seriously?  I didn't eat on property except for breakfast, and the "plated" breakfast we were served was below average.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We appreciate your feedback and will certainly share your comments with our team. Your review is very important to us. Thank you again for sharing your feedback.

Summary: The location is very impressive and overlooks Dana Point Harbor, with great sunsets. There are two main parts with two wings each and a pool area in each as well.  Rooms are very good and we had a ground floor one with great access through to the pool, if you want a view then specifically ask for one when booking or ensure that you get that and request it or book the right room. There is a large conference part of the hotel. There is a bar/restaurant with a great view and a limited menu, this is upstairs at the lobby level and then the main restaurant downstairs. Had breakfast here and it was a la Carter and buffet and it was very good. Had a burger at the bar upstairs and this was excellent. The gym is great, plenty of equipment and is next to the Spa.  Parking....be careful,
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your compliments and we are happy that we not only met your expectations but we exceeded them. We hope you visit us again in the future, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary Heading: Great service accompanying best location in Dana Point, Recommend highly
Summary: The staff is very courteous and helpful.  Property is clean and nice even little old. THe location is best with harbor view.  Very convienent to beach and restaurants. Recommend highly to family or friend group.   Parking staff at valet is very energetic and prompt.  Banquet facilities are great too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Primarily we went for the spa services is excellent.  We've been there several times and each has been better than the last. The rooms are comfortable with good bedding.  We had a balcony with two chairs and a table.  That was convenient. Sat in the outside lounge for appetizers and drinks with a nice view of the ocean. One downside is that the only parking on the premises is valet parking.  Each time you go out you need to get the car from the valet attendants.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you had a relaxing time with us and that you enjoyed your spa treatment. We appreciate your loyalty and we cannot wait to welcome you back.

Summary: I was attending a conference nearby and this was the overflow hotel for the late bookers. I was a little apprehensive given the TA reviews.  I was pleasantly surprised to not experience any of the negative comments other guests had written about.  The front desk, Emily, was extremely nice and thorough in explaining my benefits and gave me 3 options for rooms. I went to the room I chose first but realized after I went there I wanted the second choice with the balcony instead of the bay window room in the higher floor (4 vs 2). Both rooms had nice ocean views and the 2 floor difference didn't make a material difference in the view.  Emily was very accommodating and quickly changed rooms after I went back to front desk within 5 minutes of checking in.   The hotel grounds are
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Overpriced ocean view room. Noisy neighbors. Small uncomfortable beds.
Summary: My husband and I stayed here to get seriously great sleep after leaving our baby overnight with the grandparents for the first time ever.  That was the primary reason.  First, instead of one king bed there were 2 double beds.  It was smaller than our Queen sized bed at home and shorter too.  I am not tall and my feet were hanging off the bed.  It was also very soft and uncomfortable, as well as horribly cheap and flimsy pillows.  All 8 pillows were terrible.  The room felt narrow and our tiny patio was wedged between 2 other patios with very noisy guests.  My husband called the front desk to switch our room, and he told us that they had no more ocean views available and that we would not be refunded the extra cost of the ocean view room, for the available inland view room.  The
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We apologize for the noise you experienced while staying with us. We are happy to hear that our security team was able to quiet the children that were disrupting your sleep, however, we do understand the inconvenience and frustration you must have felt. Our goal is not to not only meet your expectations but to exceed them. We apologize for our shortfalls and will be sure to share your comments with our team. Your opinion is extremely important to us and we take every review very seriously.

Summary Heading: Rooms not up to par for a Marriott Hotel
Summary: Upon checking in late Thanksgiving evening we were assigned a room on the third floor.  There was a very noisy fan sound coming from the bathroom, I think.  After trying to get to sleep for about an hour and a half, I dressed and went to the front desk.  Maintenance was called and a gentleman arrived but could not fix the noise problem.  When we asked for another room we were told they were fully booked.  After we insisted, they found a room for us on the first floor, room 1034.  Had to unplug the small frig which was making a terrible racket.  Room had an unpleasant odor and the bedding smelled musty.  Will not return to this hotel.  We have enjoyed it in the past.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We deeply regret that you were unsatisfied with both of your guest rooms. Our priority is to make your stay as pleasant and comfortable as possible. Due to occupancy levels we were limited in the number of rooms we could move you too and although our staff was able to move you to a second room, we understand that this room was not to your liking. We apologize for that and we hope that you give Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa another chance in the future, to restore your faith.

Summary Heading: Perfect Location Overlooking Dana Point Marina!
Summary: The staff here is commendable, extremely personable and friendly at every level. Beautiful grounds and walking paths,  check-in staff gave me a handy guide to the paths and surrounding area.  I love this location!  Fifteen minutes to Laguna Beach, and a minute to the Dana Harbor for whale watching tour. I thought the bed was too soft for me, other than that the ocean view room was so wonderful!  Overlooking the grass area and the Harbor and Pacific beyond was outstanding. (Room 308) I would give this resort a five, but I am just not happy with the $37 valet parking fee.  I am reaching the tipping point with hotels doing this.  Just have all fees included so my brain doesn't feel so taxed with fees.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Wonderful Marriott Resort in beautiful Dana Point!
Summary: This property offers exceptional service from the time your arrive to departure!  Our experience started by being warmly greeted at check in.  I appreciated my Marriott loyalty being recognized, and also being offered a Executive Suite upgrade. It was apparent from our check in that all hotel staff aim to please, and provide warm hospitality to all. Our Suite provided a separate bed room, living room and larger bathroom.  It was tastefully decorated and was very comfortable.  Our view offered a sweeping view of Dana Point Marina and the Pacific Ocean.  I also want to point out that the housekeeping staff provided exceptional care of the suite providing cleaning each day!  We were on vacation , hence rest and relaxation were key.  The Spa and Gym provided a great opportunity to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Coming here since 15 years but might reconsider going there anymore
Summary: We are coming to this hotel for 15 years, coming several times a year. So far I loved it - or should I say loved it once? They have changed a lot- free handicapped parking like everywhere else is gone- I always got a very nice room but this time- I think the hotel should not rent out such a room at all. Or maybe to somebody who is blind. The 3rd floor next to elevator- it has had hardly something you could call a window- If you did make some efforts you could see a bit of roof. Sure the hotel was booked- but we checked in 24 hours before and then you did  not expect that you just get the answer we are full - this is the last room and it is very nice.- you see the ocean and it is far away from the elevator???  We liked to have the superb food at the Bar.. all gone. Not nearly as
Manager Response: Thank you for your most recent review. We want to take a moment to apologize for your unsatisfactory stay with us. As we pride ourselves on delivering a memorable hotel experience during your travels, we have unfortunately fallen short of our goal during your recent stay. While we are unable to verify which room you stayed in during your last visit, please accept our sincere apologies that the room location did not meet your expectations. I have also shared your feedback with the Director of Food and Beverage. We hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Dana Point.

Summary Heading: Stay for the View: or enjoy a meal here at least.
Summary: I was invited to a meeting at this property- needed to come in the night before. I am not a frequent guest of Marriott, so I was pleasantly surprised at the stunning water front views, friendly staff and good food at the meeting. I stayed in room 209 which faced the water, and the lawn. Very quiet. Rooms were negotiated to around $206/night.  I flew into John Wayne airport. I will say, it was easy to get an Uber ride to the property, but a nail biter to get one on the return. The Uber ride was about $37.00 one way. I cannot imagine the cost of a cab. Dana Point has nice restaurants and is worth renting a car if you plan a visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: First time staying at this wonderful Dana Point Resort/Hotel for my wife & I. Lovely location on top of the hill with 180 degree views of the coast. The room was nice with a cute small balcony. In particular the staff are very nice . Kyle in room service & Tayla front desk staff & valet were all very welcoming & accommodating . We enjoyed our stay & will be back one day . Thank you to All
Manager Response: none

Summary: Gorgeous beach views, on top of a hill, away from all sounds and noise of the streets around, great atmosphere, two awesome restaurants with delicious menus, complimentary bikes, surfboards, boogie board, tennis courts, bocce ball, and a Yoga class every morning at 10 am in the front overlooking the beaches. This hotel is AWESOME. I shouldn't say hotel but in fact a resort. Two heated pools, food service by the pools, full spa service and to top it all, the level of staff's professionalism is quite exquisite. Valet team always fast and friendly. The front desk team always on point and ready to provide excellent service. Aldo in particular. That man made our stay 10 times better than what it could be. Fast and friendly check in process, wealth of knowledge and an expert agent.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice hotel although a bit pricey.  Parking is $30 per day on top of a daily resort fee!  Makes the price per night of the room pretty crazy!  Large hotel with many weddings going on during the weekend.  Room was comfortable but did not have a balcony.  Very spacious bathroom and huge shower.  Fire alarm went off in the middle of the night, not so great.  The property is beautiful and its a short walk to the marina and shopping and dining.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Prime location with a relaxed feeling
Summary: My husband and I stayed the weekend here and absolutely loved it.  The room was wonderful.  The grounds are so pretty.  You can walk to the beach as well as the harbor - right from the resort.  We had the buffet breakfast at the hotel 1 day and a room service breakfast on check out day.  Both were wonderful.  We ate appetizers in the bar for dinner one night (while watching the World Series).  The food was tasty but the service was a tad slow.  There are also restaurants within walking distance should you decide to venture off resort.  It was cool when we were there but the pool looked lovely.  The resort is nicely appointed and we'd stay there again for sure!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your compliments and are happy to hear that you enjoyed your dining experience at Vue and in your guest room. We look forward to having you and your husband return. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: My husband and I were very dissatisfied with our stay at this resort. Upon arrival, I was told we were getting a room with two double beds, I had booked way in advance and expected.a King bed.The woman behind the desk said she would see what she could do. She said she found us a King bed but failed to mention it was an accessible room which had a sink with no counter space.They told us there was nothing they could do until the next day. The next day we were switched to another room.That evening we had to call maintenence to fix the air conditioning because it wasn't working.Instead of going to sleep when we wanted to,we had to sit there while he was fixing it. Every morning our toilet wouldn't flush and we would tell the cleaning people as we were walking out of the room. As for
Manager Response: Thank you for your most recent review. We want to take a moment to apologize with for your unsatisfactory stay with us. We regret that you were not informed correctly about room types. Unfortunately, upon booking a king or double bed we state that you can request these rooms but that they are not in fact guaranteed. We understand your frustration with the issues you experienced in your guest room and we are happy to hear that our engineering team was able to fix your requests. Your review is extremely important to us and we will be sure to share your dining experience with our team to correct any shortfalls that you experienced.

Summary: The hotel is situated at the top of a hill with panoramic views. The hotel grounds are also lovely and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was rather average and the level of service at the hotel could use a little work. The nice thing was that it was walking distance to the harbor. In general it was a fine stay, however not extraordinary.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Was here for a business trip, early November for a few days.  Room view was amazing on the second floor with a small balcony and an awesome view of the Pacific Ocean.  A little dated and worn with some torn upholstery by the beds and worn carpet.  Bathroom was so so...was expecting more form a high end property.  They charge a stupid "resort" fee that should be included in the rate....it was a business trip but still..lame by hotels that do this...include it in the rate and be done.  Service and checkin was fast.  Room I don't think got made up during our visit...maybe that is to "save time"?  Make my bed and replace my towels...stock the room with new toiletries...act like the first class resort you are!  I would return because the price wasn't too bad at all and the view was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great ocean views, family friendly luxury
Summary: We were at this location for a wedding, stayed 3 nights. The location in Dana Point is close to the beach, but it is a STEEP hill to get back up to the property (and, which subsequently makes the views so great.) The surrounding area is a little more residential, but the marina has several restaurants and the neighboring shopping area has a lot of cute cafes and shops.  The property is beautiful. There is a "family" pool and an adult pool, which is great to get away from the splashing and noise. There is also a hike/bike path at the edge of the property, and the hotel has free loaner bikes. I'm a runner and explored the area on foot; you can cover the more tourist-related areas easily in one day. I also took a half day drive  up the coast to Long Beach.  The only parking is
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review Carrie. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the resort and were able to explore Dana Point. We appreciate your compliments and hope you visit us again in the future, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: Just returned from spending a wonderful weekend here in a partial ocean view room with my two adult sons and husband. Cannot say enough about the welcoming and caring staff from management to the housekeepers. It was a very busy weekend with a wedding and conventions and the staff were extremely busy, but always accommodating!1We so enjoyed the views, biking, and the general ambiance.The only minor complaint  would be the noise in the early{6am} am outside on the lawn of the staff setting up tables or removing tables from the previous event. We enjoy keeping our door open at night and needed to close it due to this.  Overall, the experience was great...The setting,views,and staff were great! We will return
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great location with a wonderful view/ little high in price and if you self park, be prepared for a hike.  They have free yoga in the park and the Grand-mariner cream souffle is to die for.  Enjoy every moment.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Linda. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us. We couldn't be happier to hear that you enjoyed the food at OverVue. We hope you visit us again in the future. We'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: We were recently recommended to stay at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott resort and spa.  Our reservation was made the same day as our stay and we were  told we could come and check in anytime we would like.  We requested two beds as there were three adults.  However when we arrived we were told our room wasn't ready     And they showed that we were supposed to check in  on Sunday instead of Friday 2 days later.    Once again they apologized  And for our inconvenience they were going to upgrade us to an executive suite at no additional charge also they offered a complimentary appetizer while we waited and we graciously excepted their offer.    Sensing something wasn't right I asked if we could inspect the room.   As it turned out  the executive suite they were upgrading us to  only
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review. We want to first start off by apologizing for the inconvenience you experienced during your stay with us. We were delighted to hear your chose our resort to visit your Marine; however, please allow us to extend our sincere apologies for the unacceptable maintenance of your guestroom.  Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this guestroom with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future.  As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality. It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.

Summary: We didn't stay at the hotel,  just visited the spa and had lunch!  The location and ambiance was awesome, the spa was glorious and the food was delicious!   One of the nicest spa's that I have ever been and cannot wait to go back again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent 5 star review Janet. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your spa treatment and lunch at the resort. We are happy that your experience exceeded your expectations. We cannot wait to have you return. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Pretty hotel with spectacular views and a splendid Lobby. The gardens and the room are elegant. The huge problem was the Salon.  The prices are extraordinary high. In my life I have paid as much for a service as I have paid there. It's an attack to the intelligence and logic. The staff is amable but don't go before asking the price!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Doris. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the resort's ocean and garden views.  Thank you for your compliments regarding the your guest room. We do regret that you found the salon prices to be high. The Salon is not owned by the resort but is operated by a third party. We will share your comments with them and give them your feedback. We appreciate your review.

Summary: This Marriott is special for so many reasons from location, views, service and gym/spa too. We arrived later than anticipated and took a quick stroll to see the property before cocktails outside as the sun started to set.  Room service menu was typical but good with prompt delivery. Crab cakes were outstanding as was the creme br√ªl√©e too. The room was comfortable but TV was very small -the only complaint we had. The gym is large with views outside and bright.  We didn't have time to visit the spa even though resort fee covers use.  Pool was nice with lots of comfortable lounging too. We will definitely be back for votes and superb service here too.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Donna. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you were able to take advantage of the resort's amenities. We look forward to having you back and we appreciate your compliments. See you soon!

Summary: Beautifully situated on the cliff overlooking the ocean and downtown, this Marriott property gets it right in so many ways.    The staff was amazingly friendly and accommodating. The grounds were immaculate, and the amenities were fantastic.  While my rating of the room is based on the Presidential Suite, it was nothing short of specular.  We did glance in a traditional room while poolside, and it looked very nice.  Although convenient, the food at the poolside restaurant left much to be desired. The main restaurant however, surpassed our expectations. The menu offered something for adults and children and the food was tasty.  More amazing was the view from the restaurant deck where we ate.    The family pool has a splash zone and is full of stuff for the kids to do.  While we
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place sits up on the hillside by itself, the view is amazing and hotel is very very nice. The bar outside has an incredible view of the ocean and grounds and there are several pools to choose from.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Richard. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the panoramic ocean views of the resort. We hope you visit us again in the future. We'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: I stayed here in September 2016 for a Fitness Retreat.  The property is absolutely stunning.  The room was nice and clean.  The hotel's gym was the best I have seen at any hotel in the States.  The pools were gorgeous.  The employees were friendly.  I did not have any issues and would highly recommend people stay here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Becky. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us while at your fitness retreat. Thank you for your recommendation. We hope you visit us again soon, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary Heading: Good overall site for business meetings.
Summary: Attended a mini-trade show here.  Found the site to be ok.  Conveniently located next to a public park making it a good choice for bringing along family.  Rooms were ok, a bit old- mattress didn't sit well on the frame causing pillows to fall in back when sleeping; older bathroom, single sink, with inconsistent water pressure.  Pleasant pool area only partially staffed on week days and again older chase cushions.  On check in, there as a lot of confusion leading us to load our own luggage on a cart and later being chased by a bellman to bring our bags to the room-which was expected but where was he when we were unloading our car. Also on check in, rate was not verified which led to confusion that has yet to be resolved (didn't get group rate for meeting dates and double charged
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We hope you had a successful trade show. We apologize for the inconsistencies you experienced during your stay with us. We want to assure you that we definitely do not operate this way. We usually receive many fine compliments from out guests and we hope you look upon this incident as an exception and not the rule. We value your opinion and comments greatly and we take every review seriously. We want you to know that we will be addressing your concerns with our team.

Summary Heading: Beautiful ocean setting at reasonable price
Summary: An expensive area to visit. This resort with spa isn't cheap but a good value. Check in staff courteous and very helpful with upgrades and discounts for services. Nice deck off the room. Awesome breakfast that was free with voucher. Full service spa and salon. Personnel awesome at both. Close proximity to Laguna which was fabulous to visit. Would definitely come back. Great dining and bar with outside deck overlooking the ocean.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review Carol. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that we met your expectations. We look forward to having you back.

Summary Heading: Peaceful and Perfect with Plentiful Parking
Summary: Husband was staying here for a conference and I decided to come along with my one year old. We had the most relaxing and fun time. Oh my heck, COMFY BEDS. We slept so well. Lots of kid friendly activities nearby: beach about 10 minutes walk down the hill, fun playground on neighboring park, picnic areas, splash pad on the premises with a 1 1/2 foot pool for the littles, as well as the nearby harbor with fun eateries and shops.   Biggest tip: I was initially deterred by the huge $37/day parking charge that I saw online before the trip, but we found we could park for free on Golden Lantern just below the resort. we parked there the whole time, even overnight, and there were always plenty of spots available. (We stayed here in October on weekdays so this may have figured into
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Dana Point is SoCal's Little Secret
Summary: As a long-term resident of Southern California, I've been up and down the coast a million times to stay at beach resorts and hotels - and I've always driven right through Dana Point without stopping. On the way to Laguna Beach or Newport, it was always been the pass-through from the freeway to the PCH (Pacific Coast Highway). Not any more.  The Laguna Cliffs Marriott is perched on the hill overlooking Doheny Beach and the Dana Point Harbor, and is pretty amazingly situated for a true SoCal experience. Want to walk down to the harbor and take a boat ride? Sure! Day trip to Catalina Island on the ferry? It docks right down below the resort. How about a quick surf or paddle board lesson? Why not! Or maybe just an easy lounge on the sand, while families play in the water and collect
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I stay at the Laguna Cliff's Marriott at least twice a year, having stayed at this property before it was managed by Marriott. This trip was about 3 days and we were absolutely delighted with the property, food service, and the attitude and service of the staff. I would rate this staff as good or better than the staff at the Montage or the nearby Ritz Carlton. The location is excellent with easy access to PCH (Pacific Coast Highway) and the newly renovated Dana Point shopping area. The restaurant serves a great breakfast buffet or you can have a light breakfast at the Overvue Lounge. There is a morning yoga class at the park in front of the property which my wife loves to join. The Marriott has yoga mats for use of the guests. Lastly, the Overvue Lounge is a great
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We couldn't be happier to hear that you and your wife are frequent guests of ours and travel to our resort twice a year. Thank you for your wonderful compliments regarding our guest service and resort amenities. We truly appreciate your loyalty and cannot wait to welcome you both back.

Summary: Attended conference here this week! Food, rooms and conference rooms were great! Service staff also very courteous and helpful. Would recommend to anyone traveling. Wish I could of enjoyed more if surrounding area - beautiful views!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us during your conference. We hope that your conference was a success and we hope you visit us again soon to experience the surrounding areas and the resort's amenities.

Summary: Just stayed for a few days on business and had a fantastic executive suite room overlooking the pool area. Hotel is very clean and tidy throughout and has lots of outdoor space.  Bar and restaurants are good quality and there's a great terrace area.  Only one downside is that when sat on the terrace it took an age to get waiter service so ended up going into the bar to order.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your business stay with us. We hope your meeting was a success. Thank you for your wonderful compliments regarding the cleanliness and quality of the resort's outlets. We do regret that you did not receive the service that we always provide our guests at OverVue deck. We will be sure to address these concerns with our team, to ensure that this does not happen again. Thank you again for your review. We do hope you visit us again for business or pleasure.

Summary: Well maintained, very clean nice rooms. Well kept grounds. Service and staff is moderately friendly and not overly nice, but efficient still. Food is just ok. But the location and views are what makes this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Alex. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the views of the resort and your room. We appreciate your feedback and we hope you visit us again soon, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: I recently stayed for three nights for a fitness retreat. Beautiful property overlooking the ocean, very clean and picturesque landscaping. Easy access to the water, and Dana Point. Onsite gym is very nice and above your average hotel gym. Pools were well kept, with plenty of comfortable seating, and onsite bar/food menu. Starbucks on premise is very convenient.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great views if you don't mind sleeping on the couch
Summary: I had reservations but when I checked in I was told the hotel was over booked. The only room they had left had a sofa with a pull out bed.  I was stuck on a sofa for 3 nights. The sofa bed was very uneven and small. I'm 6'2" and my legs hung off the bottom.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review. We regret we were not able to offer you the room you requested due to the occupancy of the hotel.  We apologize for the inconvenience you had to experience and we completely understand your disappointment. We were fully committed due to our resort‚Äôs sold out position; however, we did place you in the best room type available.  As I‚Äôm sure you are aware, we take great pride in providing a high level of service and quality to our guests Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this incident you experienced as an exception and not the rule.

Summary: I am writing this review with a conflicting rating.  Overall, there was nothing inherently wrong with this hotel.  It upheld all the values of a Marriot-clean and comfortable, coupled with friendly service.  While there was nothing wrong with my stay, I was just disappointed with the cost/benefit of my visit.  As many reviewers noted, there is a $25 resort fee and a $37 valet-parking only per night.  Unfortunately, I stayed at several Marriots in the Laguna Beach area (with no resort fees and cheaper parking fees) and felt just as (or more) satisfied with my stay.  Overall, the luxury price just wasn't worth the overall experience.  While the Marina and views were picturesque, it was definitely a long haul and STEEP climb getting to the beaches and surrounding attractions (and
Manager Response: none

Summary: The best way to describe this hotel is a holdiay inn that believes it's the Ritz Carlton.  They had an elaborate bracelet system and a pool area bouncer to regulate who could enter the pool area and apparently my wife, son and I did not make the standard.   They had a regular generic rectangular pool with regular lounge chairs. Like the hotel, very ordinary.    The entire staff was rude and abrasive and behaved like a 80's Hollywood caricature of a snooty hotel.    This hotel is basic, pretentious, and easily the worst valued lodging of my life.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us regarding your recent visit to our Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa.  Please allow me to extend my sincere apologies for the issues you, your wife and son encountered.  I understand some of my associates inquired if you were a registered guest at our resort and while this is a normal practice.  As a resort property located next to a public park, we are often proactive in controlling our environment by ensuring unregistered guests don't use our pools and other amenities.  Please be assured our associates are trained to provide professional customer service at all times. It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable and comfortable. We again apologize if this caused any inconvenience to you and your family.

Summary: The Laguna Cliffs Resort has beautiful grounds and an outstanding view of the harbor and the ocean. It is not on the water,  but it still has a convenient location within walking distance to the restaurants, stores, and harbor. The on site restaurant, called 'The Vue' was amazing. We went there for dinner during one night and our dishes were not only nicely presented but tasted fabulous! It's a very romantic location and room feels very intimate with wonderful ocean view and Cape Cod architecture and decor . To me, they deserve to be a 5 star hotel as their service , design, and dining compared well to many 5 star resorts that we have visited. Personally, this charming coastal resort is in the top 5 of my favorite hotels where we had stayed before!
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and had a romantic evening in our Vue Restaurant. We appreciate your fine compliments and we do hope you visit us again soon, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: Wonderful  4 night stay with my teenage daughter!  Enjoyed pool, hot tub, Starbucks breakfast, beautiful harbor views from terrace, Sat morning yoga on the lawn, great hiking and restaurant advice from valet!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice Views and Superb Customer Service
Summary: The firm where I work chose the Laguna Cliffs Marriott for a firm retreat and we enjoyed our stay there. The views are nice of the ocean and we enjoyed sitting out on the outdoor patio. The ocean views are partially blocked by trees, but the trees are nice to look at also.   The grounds are well-maintained and our firm had two outdoor dinners and three outdoor breakfasts that had good food and the atmosphere was excellent. The hotel has heaters that we used when it was cooler in the morning and the evening. The weather was nice for outdoor events and the full moon was spectacular in the evening. The hotel had a "moonlight" blow up balloon that gave out good light and provided a point of interest at the dinners.  My wife and I sat by the pool one day and enjoyed sitting under a
Manager Response: Thank you for you review. It was our pleasure having you with us and we are so glad you took advantage of our incredible surroundings. Our team is outstanding and they look forward to welcoming you back to enjoy another memorable stay. We enjoyed creating memories for you and look forward to creating more for you in the near future. We hope you visit us again soon for business or pleasure.

Summary Heading: First Impression Dazzles, But Your Actual Stay?  Can We Talk?
Summary: Majestically sited on the hills of Dana Point overlooking the ocean, when you drive up to this hotel it will take your breath away!  It's lovely to look at!    It's charming to a fault!  And it's in a great location to get to the beach and shops.  But getting to a beach is a workout.  There are stairs, a steep climb, and a long haul walk.  And if you have kids and gear, then you'll be a hot mess by the time you get to the ocean!  The rooms have great views.  But they are TINY!  Bathrooms are small and outdated.  Balconies are small and not really conducive to quality time.  so if you're staying for a week say, you will be very disappointed.  The restaurant has a schedule and does not accommodate dropping in when you are hungry.  The grounds are beautiful and the staff is
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the resort views and the proximity of this hotel to the beach and marina. We apologize that our guest rooms did not meet your expectations. Our job is not only to meet the guest‚Äôs expectations but to exceed them. We value your opinion and comments greatly and we take every review seriously. Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this incident as an exception and not the rule.

Summary: Laguna Cliffs is really a hotel, not a resort.  The hotel rooms feel like any other hotel, nothing special.  The pools are nice but again, nothing special.  The tennis court is a disaster - the net is too low with torn sections. Access to large equipment is on the tennis courts so, our match was interrupted twice by workers.  Valet parking is the only option and it is pricey!  There are lots of restaurants nearby which was great for dinner.  I would like to return if the hotel gets a face-lift to become a resort.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We deeply regret that we fell short of your expectations. Our job is not only to meet the guest‚Äôs expectations but to exceed them. We value your opinion and comments greatly and we take every review seriously. I want you to know that we will be addressing your concerns with our team.

Summary: Let me start by saying this place was a hidden gem. My friend had her wedding here & it was amazing! The hotel it tucked away on top of a hill that over looks the ocean. If you are looking for a wedding venue this is the place. The hotel looks inconspicuous from the outside, more like a quaint little apartment instead of a Marriott. The hotel boasted valet only parking, $40/day, steep but worth it. There is parking down the hill but trekking up a hill in heels is not fun. The hotel was beautiful & perfect for an outdoor wedding overlooking the ocean as the sun was setting. The staff was professional & helpful. Hope this helps someone find a nice wedding venue!
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We couldn't be more pleased to hear that it was your first time visiting Laguna Cliffs and you left with wonderful memories. We hope you had a beautiful time at your friend's wedding and we truly appreciate you recommending the resort. We hope you find it in your travels to visit us again. We'd love to have you back.

Summary Heading: Labor day weekend trip with family
Summary: ThIs hotel and Resort is a wonderful place to stay anytime of thr year. Thr rooms are clean and big enough for few people. Thr beds r very comfortable. The view of pacific ocean and harbor is spectacular. The bar has the view too. We would go there again for sure and I highly recommend it to everyone. Very romantic and fair price.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Sima. Thank you for your wonderful compliments! We are delighted to hear that you and your family enjoyed their stay with us. Thank you for recommending Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa. We hope to see you all again soon.

Summary Heading: Nice place to stay near Laguna Beach
Summary: Very pleasant stay but parking$$$ Concierge very good,  Dining facilities are weak.  Scenic location near harbor. Very friendly staff ad presented a bottle of wine to me for my birthday which actually did occur during our stay.  Saw the Pageant of the Masters which was unbelievably great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice stay, but costly for other reasons
Summary: I did enjoy my stay at this resort/spa, though I wish I had taken more advantage of the views.  There is a beautiful view of the Ocean, but you're actually not close to the ocean (at least not enough to walk there quickly). I should have visited the park nearby.  The front desk staff was friendly, the room was comfortable and clean, though the television did not work.  I did enjoy the patio area adjacent to my room, as I was able to go out at night with a comforter and just sit outside on one of the chairs.  My only gripe is with additional fees.  It isn't a wildly inexpensive stay, but you'll also be paying a resort fee and a valet parking fee (unless you somehow show up without a car?).  If you're prepared for those fees, then enjoy!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with great views & near Dana Point Harbor!
Summary: My husband & I stayed in this Marriott for 1 night prior to our trip to Catalina Island. The hotel is in a great location near the ferry terminal if you're planning a Catalina trip. This Marriott isn't beachfront but has some great views. We have stayed in many Marriott hotels over the years, & this one met our expectations. We slept well, & the hotel was clean & overall very well-maintained.   Near the lobby is a bar which converts to a cafe in the AM that serves Starbucks coffee & pastries (great for a quick breakfast the AM we departed for Catalina). We didn't dine at the hotel for dinner but instead enjoyed a scenic walk to downtown Dana Point where there are various dining options.   The hotel's gym is open 24 hours with your room key & is well-equipped (better than many
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed here off and on in years past (even before I made Marriott Platinum status) and really enjoyed the property.  I finally had the opportunity to bring my hubby on a SoCal vacation and this property was number one on my list as I have talked about it frequently.  First of all, in ALL of my experiences (this trip and over the years), the service of the staff has been outstanding.  Aldo at the front desk and all of the valet guys get a thumbs up on this trip.  The beach town of Dana Point and the location of the resort are very nice and there are tons of restaurants near by (a good thing as the prices at the hotel are on the high side).  We were upgraded to a King Suite (2016 in the San Clemente Wing), but the property needs maintenance and updating.  Tiles on the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We truly appreciate your loyalty to the Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa and we thank you for your compliments regarding our outstanding level of service from our valet team to our front desk. Please allow us to extend our sincere apologies for the unacceptable maintenance of your guestroom.   As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality.  Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm.  It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.

Summary Heading: Walks like a duck.... Not a duck
Summary: At first glance, this seems like a great hotel but there are some problems.  Like most Marriott aficionados, we choose them for their consistency, particularly for sleeping comfort.  Unfortunately, I am fairly certain this is not a corporate property because they do not have the Marriott beds.  Worst of all were the pillows, which were so bad that after 3 nights my husband was in severe pain with a stiff neck and muscle spasms that sent us to an urgent care where he was given muscle relaxers and a neck brace.  These pillows are rather unusual.  The filling has a knobby texture that breaks down such that the pillows go flat to the point that they can be twisted like a towel and stay in that form.  We insisted on brand new pillows and they accommodated but these had the same odd
Manager Response: Thank you so much for all of that wonderful feedback. We listen to every piece of feedback our guests provide us. Our highest mission is to provide the exact service and facilities that our guests want, deserve, and expect. We apologize for the sleepless  nights your husband endured during his stay with us. We can assure you that we use bedding and pillows that standard for Marriott properties. We usually receive fine compliments regarding our beds and we do apologize for any inconvenience this caused you and your husband. Thank you for bringing it up to our management team during your stay with us. We understand that they addressed the issue with you.

Summary Heading: Wedding and Visit - One to Remember
Summary: We recently had our wedding at Laguna Cliffs (08.25.16) and felt the need to write a review to express just how amazed and happy we were with our day and the great standard of the resort during our time here.  I know a lot of people (me being one) will book a holiday/event based upon reviews of a location so really must stress the attention to detail that the resort paid to us, even considering our small wedding.   From the moment of booking, our event manager Nicole Whittam was spectacular in ensuring everything was taken care of. Booking our wedding from the UK was a challenge but we needn't have worried, Email communication was fantastic and a number of family members booked into the resort during their stay here too and loved it.   The set up, execution and delivery of our
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, average service, great views.
Summary: The location of this property is great.  Without being beachfront, the walk is quick and easy and the views back over the coastline are great.  Great place for families as the property is large enough that you can spread out.  We were there with a wedding party so that made the experience special.  I wasn't super impressed with the services but I think mainly because it is just such a busy hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Fabulously located and beautiful hotel overlooking Dana Point positioned above and between the boat / yacht harbour and the beach. We chose it for the Ohana festival,and it was perfectly located.   The service is first rate, and the rooms and facilities absolutely excellent - we wished we had stayed longer than the two nights. The pool area and facilities were very good.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review Ed. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the resort and it's proximity to the Ohana Festival. Thank you for your compliments regarding our staff's exceptional service. We hope you visit us again soon for a longer stay, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: Beautiful hotel and setting.  We went there for my daughters wedding and they were fantastic, everything was as we had planned and hoped for.  Only downside is that drinks are quite expensive but then again what can you expect from a top-class hotel.  Would love to stay there again and enjoy all the facilities. Excellent spa, beauty salon, hairdressers on site as well as two pools for guest use.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Don't stay here. This  is the room that they  put there Platinum members in . 1-AC doesn't work 2- ceiling has cracks in it. And this is a category 8 with MARRIOTT more like 1 . category.  Thank you for the great stay ... PS for the trouble they will wave your valet and resort fee. We gave up the Ritz Carton for these never again . Wasted 40,000 points a night here.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We apologize for the unsatisfactory esthetics of your guest room. We have a 24 hour At Your Service Department ready to assist with any and all of your guest room concerns including AC issues. We understand that this was an inconvenience to you and we do apologize for that.  Our job is not only to meet the guest‚Äôs expectations but to exceed them. We value your opinion and comments greatly and we take every review seriously. I want you to know that we will be addressing your concerns with our team. We appreciate your loyalty to the Marriott brand.

Summary Heading: Go to place to stay in Dana Point
Summary: We have stayed here past few years with kids. Pool is fun, great breakfasts for everyone and walking distance to Dana Point harbor. Beds are super comfortable and room is newly renovated. Fun to see set up for summer weddings, but very busy. We stayed Thursday to Sunday with breakfast rate ( 2 adults). There is resort fee for bikes etc. and we used boogie boards for beach which was nice. Starbucks coffee, great bar and nice places to walk around. Kids love the room service... Close to San Clemente/ Laguna Beach for great dinners. Walking distance to Catalina ferry.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had a team outing at this resort for 3 days and it was great.  The resort is beautiful and the views are stunning.  The rooms were big and clean and the staff was really helpful.  Quite a few of us had spa appointments and everyone raved about the experience.  I had a mani/pedi and the woman was absolutely lovely.  the main restaurant food was really good.  I'd happily return.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Everything about the hotel was top-notch: incredibly friendly, helpful, and personal service. The room and view from our room was excellent. If you go for one of the packages, there are so many amenities to take advantage of. We had bike rental included, and we spent a couple of hours riding around Dana Point, following the San Juan Creek trail, and then heading the other way to the marine biology building. Dana Point has great bike trails, so this was utterly perfect. We did yoga in the mornings in the park. Food choices for the breakfast buffet were beyond compare. And it's a couple minute walk to great beaches. The bed was so perfect we didn't want to get out. My only very minor quibble was the shower head in the bath tub. I know there's a drought going on, but the shower
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Steve. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and you left with fond memories. We couldn't be happier to hear that you were well taken care of by all of our staff and that you were able to use the amenities the resort provides during your stay. We hope to see you again in a couple of months. We'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: We visited at least 2 times year the hotel since 10 years ago.  Half of the staffs are so kind and they remember our family, so we feel like to stay in our second house.      Facilities are so beautiful and good enough for all family.  For example, the hotel had 2 pool area.  One of them is for kids and adults.  Another one for adults.  Your all family may enjoy to stay there.      Driving 30-60 minutes, you can visit huge shopping center, Zoo, Lego land and so on.        Takes 1 hour driving from LAX or San Diego air port on weekend, you can make memorable time with your family.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Ayako. We are so delighted to hear that you have been a loyal guest of ours for the past 10 years. We are happy that you join us twice a year. We look forward to having you and your family return for another visit soon. It is our pleasure to make Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa your second home.

Summary: All is ideal-only exception is that the hike up and down the nill to the beach and Dana Point Harbor is a little strenuous for senior citizens.  Can take Dana Point fdree tram to get around. With 2 pools bocee ball ewtc family can stay very entertained staying within the resort extensive grounds.  Only have valet parking-they are fast at getting uyour car when you want to adventure outside the compond.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful hotel - feels like a 5 star resort.
Summary: Spent two nights in Dana Point.  The hotel was terrific from start to finish.  Beautiful views of the ocean and harbor.  For the price paid for a standard room ($200-220/night), this hotel was a bargain (not that I'm suggesting they raise prices!).  The food at the restaurant was very good, and the breakfast buffet was way above average.  The service at the restaurant and breakfast was always excellent, and the waiters gave us some great tips on places to visit in nearby Laguna.    Nice that they have two separate pools - neither ever felt too crowded, and the service by the pool was shockingly fast.  We did walk down to the harbor one evening for dinner.  Be forewarned - the walk back up the steps (I think there were like 118 of them) will give you quite a workout!  The gym was
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Lyle. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We love hearing about our guests adventures and we are happy that you were able to utilize the resort's amenities and walk down to the harbor for dinner. It sounds like you had a lovely time. We appreciate your recommendation and we hope you and your family visit us again soon. We'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: In all our visits to Laguna Beach, somehow we have missed staying the Marriott Laguna Cliffs Hotel until July of 2016. What a great hotel! Beautiful hotel and awesome views, nice pool, fantastic staff, and very nice guest rooms. We had an issue with a broken bed and a great staff member appeared immediately to attempt to resolve the issue. We had a few bleeps like that but the staff was so accommodating and the hotel so nice, we would definitely stay here again. Great getaway!
Manager Response: none

Summary: One night stay for Pageant of Masters. Nice room with view of beach but not on it. Nice pool and Max provided excellent service. Lots of gym equipment in good condition. Titled a resort but it is your typical Marriott. Needs some small paint touch up but overall nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We hope you enjoyed the Pageant of the Masters. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the resort and the views of the beach. Thank you for your compliments regarding our attentive staff. We appreciate your feedback and will be sure to share it with our team. We hope you visit us again soon.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, a little pricey for what you get.
Summary: This is a good hotel if you want to be near harbor.  A lot of rooms with view.  Nice pool if you have kids.  Lots of water activities for them to run around and play in.  Rooms are typical but nice.  They sprayed with a chemical that is obviously supposed to smell good.  I couldn't stand the smell of the chemical.  Had to air it out each day by opening windows/sliders.  Breakfast is super expensive. Yogurt was $9, resort fee and parking are all expensive.  Staff lost my car and I had to wait almost 40 minutes to have them find it.  That was aggravating and made me late to an event that I was supposed to attend on time.  The mattresses were super cheap and uncomfortable. I can't believe they don't have higher quality mattresses.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel sits above Dana Point Harbor. It has sweeping views of the ocean down to San Clemente and of the Harbor. I put many out of town guests there as it is clean, beautiful and comfortable. Restaurants are good, happy hour is ok and staff is great. Many families use it as their launch point for Disneyland, San Diego or just goi g to the beach. The Harbor is a great place to learn how to Stand Up Paddle... SUP.  I run by there every day as people come from all over to exercise on the hotel lawn or go down by the harbor.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm too tired and annoyed to write a narrative review. My pro/con list will probably tell you why...  Pro: Convenient location for our needs.  Con:  - Reservation at the hotel different from that on my confirmation and app (Monday check out instead of Wednesday). Employee very confrontational about it. - Safe battery dead as we were leaving to go out first night so we had to wait for engineering - Housekeeping left no coffee supplies - Rug worn and frayed badly by wall -Hairs on bathroom floor upon check in -No e-folio sent after check out (waited 48 hours) -When one was requested, I received one from a guest with the same last name. I now have a bit of their personal info. Not ok. -Person in accounting seemed irritated that I didn't want to wait 2 more days to see if one
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share feedback about your experience at the resort over this past summer. We regret having fallen short of your expectations, as well as our own. Our team prides itself on addressing the needs of each guest we encounter to ensure they have a pleasant stay. Your comments will be shared with our team to help us improve upon any shortfalls or inconsistencies. Our Resort is synonymous with providing an exceptional experience for our guests, so we were happy to hear you felt the location was excellent and we certainly hope you'll reconsider giving Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa another opportunity in the future to restore your faith.

Summary: Absolutely loved this property! The service was great and I think the nightly rate was good for the value! I didn't have any room service so can't comment on food but the drinks were great! The property is also great for kids! My niece is a little baby but as a new parent my sister did appreciate seeing other families around the pool. They hotel also provides complimentary swimmer diapers (is that what they're called?) which I think is solid. The location is great, just a few mins away from restaurant and the beach! Speaking of beach, you have to go to salt creak beach while you're in the are. It's breathtaking!!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Not clean at all. Bathroom tile is loose this is more like a motel. Was place in a small room and had to switch rooms in the middle of stay. Will never stay at this dump again. The door for cabinet hanging on the air. Pool was not clean. People next door was smoking next to us.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. Please allow us to extend our sincere apologies for the unacceptable maintenance of your guestroom.  Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this guestroom with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future.  As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality.  Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm.  It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.

Summary: Hotel is very pretty from outside and in great location.  Rooms where decorated nicely but a little worn. Cleanliness is another story. Room had left over bar soap in shower from previous guest, coffee pot had left over used grinds in it, carpet needed vacuuming and rooms are small. We had a room with double beds. I requested higher floor but got ground level next to service entrances.  Went to front desk, they gave us a voucher for breakfast. Big fee to park a car overnight. Pool area was nice. There is a resort fee also. So all in all it was nice but wouldn't come back for the price after all fees and taxes, etc.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location and venue for families
Summary: We stayed at the hotel as a family for a week over Christmas holiday, where we met up with other relatives. The staff and facilities of the hotel are very good.  We didn't get a chance to try out the restaurant but on the few occasions we tried out the room service, we found the food ok, not spectacular.  The swimming pool was a big hit with the children and the kids had plenty of place to run around without it feeling like they were bothering other guests.  The only gripe I have is that everyone is forced to use the valet parking service, which is a frustrating waste of time.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We gave our Grandson & his new wife a wedding night stay as part of their wedding present in June. Everyone was wonderful to deal with! they went out of their way to accomodate our requests and help us give the new married couple a perfect stay. Katelyn on the front desk was especially helpful and accomodating. She let me visit a couple of rooms to pick out the perfect one for our couple, she responded personally to every call and because they were a very late night checkin she assisted us with items we left to be available for them when they finally checked in. The kids loved their stay and said it was a perfect wedding night accomodation & hope to stay again when possible. Katelyn went over and above what you could ask for in providing great service & help.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review!  We are delighted to hear that you chose our resort as a wedding gift for your grandson and his wife and that they had a truly memorable stay at our resort!  We also appreciate your thoughtful feedback about Katelyn and will be sure to recognize her accordingly...she is a gem!  We look forward to welcoming them back and will do our best to create more special memories during their future stays!

Summary Heading: Beautiful location... Service could be better
Summary: I was visiting with friends and we were attending a wedding in Dana Point. The location is brilliant and in a beautiful spot and we had a very pleasant walk every morning with a coffee delivered to our rooms every day.
