I was slightly disappointed in the size of the bedrooms - considering it was a group of four, I expected slightly bigger rooms - we could barely fit our suitcases in. We had a few issues one evening which led to one of our group being quite upset with the staff as they had threatened to escort her out, later finally apologising. The location, pool and size of the general hotel is great and I would not fault it - but I was expecting a little more from a Marriott standard type hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your kind feedback regarding our resort's "beautiful" location.  We are very fortunate to have great walking paths around our resort as well as throughout Dana Point Harbor!  Please accept our apologies for our guestroom's size not meeting your expectations.  Most of our guestrooms are approximately 400 square feet.  Once again we appreciate your constructive feedback and hope to have an opportunity to better your experience with us whenever your travels bring you back to Dana Point

Summary: We stayed in a pool view room and got a small balcony and a partial ocean view with it. The hotel is beautiful and everyone was super nice. The room was nice and clean. The hotel is at the top of a fairly large hill. There is a free trolley available during summer months that picks up and drops off right in front of the hotel drive. The pool and hot tub wa great after a long day of walking and sight seeing. The view from the hotel into the harbor is amazing. There are the fees that everyone else mentions, but if you're expecting it, it's not too bad.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A nice property and great location right on Dana Point, but I stay at a LOT of Marriott Hotels and this property is just average. The staff was great - from the housekeeping to the restaurant. But MANAGEMENT at this property has a great deal to learn about how to treat their best customers, because THIS Lifetime Platinum Elite member has gone 24 hours without a call back to our complaint made to Marriott Platinum Customer Service. Front desk staff outright LIED to me on the phone, and were rude to boot. That type of service, at $ 300 per night, is just not excusable.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay at our Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa.  As a Platinum Rewards member you are one of our most valued guests and we appreciate you choosing our resort for your getaway.  I will be sure to share your kind feedback with our Housekeeping and Restaurant staff.  As you can imagine, we take great pride in providing a high level of attentive service to our guests and I apologize for the delay in responding back to you today.   Thank you again for your constructive feedback and we hope to welcome you back to our resort in the future so we may have another opportunity to show you true hospitality in the Marriott tradition.

Summary: The setting, views, ambience were all superb. The checkin process was relatively easy despite the large number of people all arriving at the same time. The rooms were nicely appointed and very clean as were the hallways and everything else. The facility is older, however, and so the gadgetry amenities are relatively few (USB ports, networking, etc.) and the bathrooms are really dated. Room service is spotty at best. There was no ice bucket in the room, I had to call twice to get someone to bring one. The minibar was not fully stocked, I called and they never showed up. But still, I'd go back. The poolside service was excellent although I wish they stayed open later than 5.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice grounds but terrible customer service. Absolutely terrible. I booked a room on line for a one night family getaway. The website clearly states (I checked it again after this debacle) that the room had either a patio or a balcony. this was important because we are four adult-sized people. We checked in around 4:30pm and were assigned a teeny tiny room -- no outside space. I called and spoke to Michael who claimed to be the front desk manager and who was about as unhelpful as he could have been. He told me that outdoor space was not guaranteed. I referred him to the website which lists "outdoor space" as an amenity of the "resort view room" and even states the size; 50 sq feet of outdoor space. Michael told me I was wrong. Silly me, I forgot the customer is always wrong.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your recent visit to our Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa.  We appreciate you once again choosing our resort for your family getaway; however, we apologize your guestroom's layout did not meet your expectations.  Due to the architecture of our resort we have many different room configurations.  We also have guestrooms with balconies and guestrooms with bay windows and while we unfortunately cannot guarantee a balcony, we are always happy to take the request.  We regret we did not have the request for a balcony noted on your reservation and due to the resort's sold out status we were unable to accommodate.  As I‚Äôm sure you‚Äôre aware, we take great pride in providing a high level of customer service to our guests and I hope you will look upon this incident as the exception and not the norm.  It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is memorable and I regret this mishap put a damper on your visit.

Summary: This is a beautiful spot, with ocean views and across the street from the gorgeous Lantern Bay Park.  It's very close to the Dana Point Harbor and Doheny State Beach (although getting back to the hotel is a long hike uphill).  The restaurants are pretty good, with nice views.  Overall, this is a very nice hotel.  I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Unfortunately, we were only staying here overnight.  We had to fly out the next day.  This is one place I will definitely put on my places to return to.  It is located of top of a hill over Dana Point harbor. There is not a bad view in the place.  The staff are very friendly and accommodating.  Again, It was only an overnight so I did not get to enjoy the property as much as I wanted.  I will definitely go back when I can stay longer.  If you are staying in the Dana Point area, you will not go wrong here.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your  stay and appreciate your nice compliments regarding our friendly staff and great views! We were happy to hear that you enjoyed your short visit and will look forward to welcoming you back for a longer stay soon!

Summary: We stayed with our two sons on a brief summer getaway.  This is on the higher price side of the Marriott properties but there's much to warrant the cost.  The hotel and grounds are gorgeous, the staff extremely helpful and friendly, pools just the right size with very attentive pool bar staff. The resort sits above Dana Point Harbor and is close to dining and activities.  Although it's a relatively large hotel, it feels rather beachy and intimate.  There are close to a billion stairs to get down to the harbor level - so this isn't likely a good choice if you're not able to walk/climb easily.  We ate at the restaurant for breakfasts and it was a nice buffet set up with the ability to order off the menu.  Rooms were nice, but I wish they would offer 2 queen beds in a room vs.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is warm and inviting and only steps to the beach.  The beach area feels very private and there is a great place to eat right on the beach!  The pool is very relaxing and the property has a very big lawn to play games, toss the football around...
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just returned from a few days at this resort with the family and we were really impressed with the views, the pools, and the restaurant on site.  We enjoyed the close proximity to the pier and all of the things that are available to do. The service out by the pool was very good, and the restaurant onsite has great food and wonderful views.  We will definitely return next time in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful feedback!  We are delighted that our ocean views, pools and Vue Restaurant made such a great impression during your recent stay at our Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa . We appreciate your kind compliments regarding  the pool service as well as the great food and wonderful views at Vue...we'll be sure to let the Chef know!  We are truly delighted you chose our resort for your travels and will look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.

Summary Heading: Beautiful spot, great night with dinner and comfortable befs
Summary: My teen and I are visiting colleges and decided to splurge and stay along the beach for a night. The setting of this grand resort is beautiful. Atop a bluff overlooking the ocean and town below. Our room was spacious with two double beds that had pillow tops and soft fresh sheets. Slept so well! Food was very nice at the grill. Several pools to enjoy and the hot tub felt great after all the driving.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Neither resort nor relaxing. A conference center with a spa nearby with a great view.
Summary: In a land full of too many Marriott properties other than the view this place is nothing special. Hardly a 3 star room on a five star piece of land with a spa on property. That's it. The view of the beach is fantastic. It stops there.  This place is simply a marriott with a view.  It's hardly relaxing and rather busy. I can suggest any number of places nearby where you will find far more serenity then here.  On the upside the amenities include bikes and boards which are great as it's a great place to explore by bike.  It's in Dana point across the street from the water. Overall a nice place to walk with a couple of restaurants nearby.  Beware the fees for parking which is $37 a day extra plus a $25 resort fee.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay.  We appreciate your nice comments regarding our view and are glad you could take advantage of our bikes and surf boards which are included with our resort fee.  As you mentioned, Dana Point is a wonderful city to explore!  However, we regret if our resort seemed too busy during your stay.  Our peak summer months of June-September are quite busy and hope you might consider visiting us in the Fall or Spring.

Summary: Our first visit to the property and we were not disappointed. The grounds were beautiful as well as the entire facility. Initially upon check-in were were assigned to an upgraded executive suite. However there was no balcony or view of the ocean. We contacted the front desk and requested a balcony room. The staff were quite helpful and assigned us a beautiful room overlooking the grounds and ocean in the distance, with of course a balcony. Our room had all the amenities and a very comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was equipped with a shower and bathtub. We enjoyed a fine cocktail in the OverVue Lounge as well a lunch in the Vue restaurant. Service in each venue was excellent. Although we did not utilize the resort activities there were several available in the resort fee
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here for a quick 2 night getaway in the beginning of July. It was a well needed respite from the chaos of life in the city. Upon entering this magnificent property, you are transported into another world. The property overlooks the ocean & the grounds are well-maintained and are tailored to meet every vacationer's needs. From the valet staff to the front desk to the restaurant staff to the pool staff, everyone was determined to make sure you were having a great time. When the front desk saw that I was slightly frustrated by their not being able to pull up my reservation right away ( I had to log in to my account & email the confirmation to them), I was given a nice credit towards a meal in the restaurant. (Of course, this could have also been a ploy to get me to try
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your wonderful compliments. As you mentioned, our resort is in a beautiful location, high on the bluffs overlooking the Pacific Ocean. It truly is a perfect destination for a short getaway. Thank you for your positive comments about our staff, restaurant, valet and pool staff.  We'll be sure to share your kind feedback with our team!  We will look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: My husband and I stayed at this resort for 5 nights in July. The property itself and the grounds are beautiful. The location on a cliff in Dana Point cannot be beat. The location alone is worth the price.  All the staff were friendly and helpful. The front desk staff arranged for late checkout on our last day due to our home bound flight being delayed. The concierge arranged for a limo to take us to the airport.   The two restaurants at the resort, Vue and Overvue, have beautiful ocean views as their names imply and good food, though the menus are somewhat limited. The prices were reasonable for a resort.  The spa is beautiful and I enjoyed a fantastic massage. The prices are in line with resort spas.  The resort has two pools, one of which is billed as the adult pool and one as
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed for two nights. The room was clean and comfortable. The pool and hot tub were wonderful. Even a kiddie pool and areas that spray water for the younger kids. We were able to walk around town and find restaurants and shops. Would LOVE to stay again!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel itself is dated, but the location is worth the 3 hour drive from LAX down the 405. Only 62 miles from LAX it was a bumper bumper commute at 2 in the afternoon.  The rooms were adequate, but who wants to be inside when the beautiful beach is right across the street.  The shops and attractions of Laguna Beach are just a 15 minute drive up  Highway 1.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful review regarding our location!  We appreciate you making the drive to Dana Point and are happy to hear you enjoyed your stay at our seaside resort!  We hope to welcome you back again soon!

Summary: Located in the "Beach" adjacent town of Dana Point, the Marriott at Laguna Cliffs is a great "get away" resort.  Overlooking the Pacific Ocean, this is a clean, modern and relaxing resort offering poolside relaxation, available restaurants and close to the Lantern Bay Marina with its shops and restaurants.  Easy drive along Pacific Coast Highway to Laguna Beach to the North and San Clemente to the South, there is plenty to do and all goods and services are available.  The staff at the Resort was very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Jeffrey. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed a getaway with us. We appreciate your compliments regarding our helpful and friendly staff. We are happy to hear that you were able to enjoy the area activities around the resort. We hope you visit us again soon.

Summary: DON"T STAY HERE!  It all looks nice, but my stay was ruined by the valet staff. They put us in a room overlooking the beautiful parking garage.  You can't leave the door open at night to get fresh air or read on the deck because these rude valet people use the fobs to honk the horns to find the cars. I complained to the valet manager, but his even ruder response was that his drivers usually forget to record the parking space number.  "I'm sorry sir, but that's the way it is." And I loved having housekeeping come into my room on the last day at 8 am telling me in broken English that they needed to clean the room.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Gustavio. We apologize for the disruption you experienced during your stay with us. We understand how important a quiet room is for our guests and we do regret that the noise level from the parking garage was a distraction to you. We will be sure to address your concerns immediately with our staff. Your comfort is of great importance to us and we are very sorry that you left disappointed.

Summary: Well appointed room with an awesome view of the ocean.  Bed was very comfortable.  Staff went above and beyond our expectations.  Rate was higher than I would have liked, but comparable to other properties in the area.  Highly recommend the pina coladas!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Two nights in Dana Point. What a treat. We walked all around the property and enjoyed the gorgeous weather. Room was very nice. Large balcony. Would definitely return to enjoy Orange County at its best.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Barbara. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and were able to rest and relax. We look forward to having you return. We'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: I'm currently here on a moms son getaway. Was were just approached by the general manager Jim [--] who made us extremely uncomfortable unwelcome as if he singled us out from other hotel guests.  The staff here is absolutely amazing but his interaction with us would make me choose not to stay here again or recommend to friends.  Along with my travel partner getting a needle stuck in her foot that was in the carpet is also concerning in regards to staying here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for one night only in March 2015, arrived late and left early due to work commitments so didn't see much outside of the room and foyer.   I stayed in a resort view guest room with King bed which had a nice outlook over the gardens and out to the ocean. It was one of the closest rooms to the main building so the views further out would have been much better. The bed was very comfortable and the room was large with a good additional lounge and table. The room service food was excellent and restaurant-quality.  There was a large wedding event on so the valet parking was slightly delayed due to all the cars coming in and out but otherwise a very nice stay and I'd love to come back with family.  I would have loved to stay longer and explore the resort which looked very
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Loud! Don't stay here if you're looking to relocate! Annoying kid resort.
Summary: This is the LOUDEST hotel, it's ridiculous. We came here for a relaxing getaway and we have booming club-like music and screaming kids right outside coming from the pool. I thought we were booking a nice resort, not a freaking Disneyland party kids hotel. Then the housekeeping staff make a huge racket hollering down the halls at each other all day. It's almost 5 pm and they're still at it. There is NO sound proofing between rooms, you can hear every word in the next room. The neighbors have woken us up every morning when we were hoping to sleep in. Kids loudly singing  the same song over and over. Plus, people screaming and laughing down the halls at 11:00 pm at night waking us up. I need to go home to relax now, when the whole point of coming here was supposed to be to relax.
Manager Response: Thank you for your recent review. We apologize for the loud noise you experienced during your stay with us. We know how important it is to get a good night's sleep when you are away from home and we regret that you woke up early in the morning. Please know that our team is here to provide a pleasurable and comfortable stay for you and if occupancy permits, we would be more than happy to switch your room. We appreciate your feedback.

Summary: great location steps from Doheny Beach. Standard rooms are small. I felt the $37 mandatory valet fee and "resort fee" of $25 per day was excessive. Nothing about the property wowed us. Upon our 8:30pm arrival Sunday night we went to the on site restaurant and waited to be seated. After being ignored for 10 minutes we left. We even walked up to the bar and made eye contact with the bartender....nothing
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are so sorry that you felt the service was not up to par with the surroundings. We take great pride in the quality of service our staff provides to all of our guests and we apologize for this lack of service you experienced. Your comments will be shared with our team to help us improve upon any shortfalls or inconsistencies. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

Summary: My family enjoyed our stay at this hotel.  The pool and location were perfect but we did encounter some issues.  The mandatory $37/day valet parking was ridiculous and for the current rack rate we found the hotel to be a bit overpriced.  Normally for $209-309/night you would find a spotlessly clean and well manicured room.  Not the case at this location.  It is obvious that they get a premium price based purely on their location.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Planning to go back back again and again!
Summary: My wife and I booked a room on a Friday night last minute and we couldn't have been more pleased with our visit.  In fact, we plan to bring out kids on vacation here for a few days in late July.  Although this hotel is a bit on the high end, considering the location and amenities, it is a great deal.  $25 resort fee and $37 parking is standard at any high end resort.  We were greeted when we checked in at the valet and as we walked in the lobby.  A lovely women named Susan (front desk supervisor) couldn't have been more accommodating and upgraded our room to a partial ocean view, even though we booked from hotels.com.  She even sent a bottle of wine to our room, welcoming us to the resort.  I have never had such amazing service right out of the gate.  The room was pretty much
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Doug. We couldn't be happier that you and your wife booked a last minute stay with us and left wanting to visit us again. We cannot wait to welcome you and your entire family. We look forward to your next visit. See you all soon.

Summary Heading: Simply The Best Place to Stay While in Dana Point!
Summary: Just spent four nights at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort and Spa.  This property NEVER disappoints.  The ocean views, food and personal serviced are worth every penny!  Don't shy away from the breakfast buffet just because it is $24 some dollars per person.  It is fantastic and just count it as brunch!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Marriott has done a good job of quality control for their brand.  This hotel is no nonsense.  There are 2 pools one for families and one for couples or singles, although there were couples and singles at both pools.  The bar area located off the lobby is a huge space.  It is very comfortable to meet somewhere there.  The drinks are ok!  Get something simple and you won't be disappointed
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this Marriott over the 4th of July weekend and the service was outstanding. It is not uncommon to see the staff sprinting from one area to the next to ensure that you don't wait too long for whatever you might need.  All staff were top notch. The valet, bell hops, servers in both the restaurants and the pool, and the front desk staff all strived to ensure that our experience was excellent.   When confronted with noisy neighbors halfway through the stay, they greatfully moved us to a room with matching accommodations.  The only negative for us was that my wife lost a pillow that she travels with. Security never returned a phone call or even appeared to care the least. I'm sure that Marriott buys all of their pillows from the same source and not Nordstrom. How hard
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Josh. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed your 4th of July celebration with us. Your experience at the resort is our #1 concern and we are very pleased to hear that you not only enjoyed your stay with us but that your entire family did as well. We will follow up with our Loss Prevention team to see if they have found your wife's pillow. Thank you again for your review and we look forward to having you back.

Summary: My husband, 15 year old granddaughter, and I just spent 3 nights at this property over the 4th of July.  I prefer luxury hotels and have stayed at hundreds of properties and the Laguna Cliffs Marriott  Resort & Spa is absolutely the best.  It starts with the location in Dana Point with a break taking view overlooking the harbor.  The grounds are meticulously maintained and beautifully landscaped.  The lobby is attractively decorated and the front desk staff quite helpful.  We arrived early and valet parked our car and took the free Dana Point trolley thru town and looked around and had lunch.  This free trolley stops directly in front of the hotel and is worth checking out.  We were in room 4012 which gave us a perfect view of the harbor and the 4th of July Fireworks.  We had
Manager Response: none

Summary: Myself, my husband and 12-year old son just spent 4 days here over July 4th extended weekend.  I can tell you definitively that reviews for this resort that are negative are FALSE and spurred by some slight that leads a reviewer to  bash a hotel.  This property is absolutely GORGEOUS and FIRST RATE.  The  photos both on the website and posted by travelers DO NOT do it justice.  It's many notches better in all respects in person.  I'd most closely liken this property to the Montage in Laguna.  Rooms, common areas, restaurants, facilities and overall layout, vista and bones of the place are spectacular.  We got a 4th floor view room away from the pools, I suspect a 3rd floor room with a deck is the best.  The 4th floor rooms have bay windows instead of a deck. The service
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Jill! We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your 4th of July celebration and overnight stay with us. Thank you for taking the time to write a detailed review. We can not wait to welcome you back for another WOW experience!

Summary Heading: First Class and Oh What a View!
Summary: Everything about this place is just wonderful. The rooms, the pool, the service, the restaurant, the bar, the location, and that view of the ocean! My favorite thing is sitting on the patio having drinks and some snacks, enjoying the spectacular view.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel overlooking the harbor but with service lapses
Summary: The hotel and the rooms were clean and very comfortable.   I would have rated higher but I was put-off by the $40 mandatory valet parking which was not explained by the valet.   The service of the front desk was also slow and they neglected to provide us with any information about the hotel, a mini-bar key, breakfast locations, parking info, or provide us with the greeting gift bundle from the wedding we were attending even though they acknowledged we were listed as part of the wedding.   We only learned about the bundle later and was told that they were all gone (even though there should have been one for each guest).   Overall the service seemed to be well meaning but very lacking in professional guidance.   I would recommend the St. Regis nearby.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Jack. We were sorry to hear you were not aware of our parking fees as we inform guests in a few different areas regarding these fees.  On the confirmation you received for your guestroom our parking fee is noted under your room rate.  In addition, the parking fee is noted on our website under Guest Services. We wanted to take a moment to address your gift bundle. The Resort distributes as many gift bundles as the wedding party provides. If there were not enough gifts, then every person did not receive one and unfortunately, the resort cannot take responsibility for that. We apologize for the unsatisfactory service you received. Our job is not only to meet the guest‚Äôs expectations but to exceed them. We value your opinion and comments greatly and we take every review seriously.

Summary: Was there for 4th of July weekend. The property is clean and lovely. Location is great because it's a short walk to the harbor and restaurants. Kids enjoyed the pool and the staffs are friendly. Here are a couple of my minor complaints. There aren't towels to hang in the bathroom! With 4 of us, it was a major inconvenience. We just kept piling our towels on a shower bar. There was no draws in the bathroom to put things away either.  Then the housekeepers didn't come to clean our room even after 3pm so I had to call in for the service. Kids were cold and wanted to take warm shower after all day at the pool, and we couldn't take a shower because we had to wait around for the clean towels to come. Little things like that makes a big difference to me. Overall, it was a pleasant stay
Manager Response: none

Summary: We spent a week here with three different families. Hotel situated on a cliff and surrounded by a park  The view is spectacular. Amenities are very nice including the family pool which is a phenomenal view of the harbor.  If you don't feel like staying at the pool you can always go down to Doheny State Park or to the harbor with there's lots of Pacific ocean activities to do-900 feet down the hill. In the evening you can sit at the outdoor bar area with your family and friends.  I would recommend that you prepare to walk as the hotel situated on a cliff and your choices are going down 118 steps or down on 900 feet hill. It's easy going down but it can be tiresome coming up a couple times a day
Manager Response: none

Summary: We always enjoy our stay at this location.  Everyone is very helpful and the rooms are amazing.  The location of the hotel is central to everything we enjoy doing and the accommodations are wonderful.  We always enjoy returning!
Manager Response: none

Summary: In our room at the Marriott now and am shocked. Dated is an understatement; the condition is deplorable. Starting with the bathroom: the tile floor is cracked, the ceiling paint is peeling, the walls are dirty and the towels have been over-used to the point that they've become dingy gray, rough rags. The room itself is dated, feels dirty and is long overdue for new furnishings and a paint job. As for the rest of the hotel, well, pretty much the same - dated and feels like it's due for a major update - new paint and a deep cleaning at the very least. Some staff members have been helpful, while others have performed below minimum standards.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for all of that wonderful feedback. We listen to every piece of feedback our guests provide us. Our highest mission is to provide the exact service and facilities that our guests want, deserve, and expect. We value your opinion and comments greatly and we take every review seriously. I want you to know that we will be addressing your concerns with our team. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: We spent three days in the resort in February and had amazing time. The hotel was immaculate and the service at a very high level. Rooms were clean with a very good size. Restaurant serves good quality food. The only reason why I haven't given it 5 stars is because the bartender was not friendly at all.   We would return sometime in the future
Manager Response: none

Summary: Made a reservation for a girl's getaway weekend, and this was a perfect location.   The resort is in a great location with amazing views.   Our room was comfortable.   We enjoyed a cocktail in the lounge with appetizers both evenings.   Easy drive to Laguna Beach for shopping and taking in the sights.  Staff was fantastic.   Just know that there is Valet Only parking at $37 per night.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Marriott property is absolutely beautiful! The staff is extremely friendly and kind. Michael who checked us in and Wade who was our valet upon arrival really made a great first impression of the property and it only got better from there! The staff takes the time and puts in the effort to make you feel special and during our stay that was greatly appreciated.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We absolutely love Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort!   Perfect location, great staff and nice rooms!   We have stayed here now a few times and look forward to coming back!  We loved sitting on the patio for cocktails at sunset, breakfast was great too...from check in to check out, all of our visits couldn't be more perfect!
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you are a loyal guest of ours and we cannot wait to welcome you back again. We are happy to hear that your visit was perfect in every way. We hope to create new memories every time you visit. See you soon.

Summary: Cannot say enough great things about this hotel. Nice location, friendly staff, good rooms, good in room dining, nice bar. Just a very pleasant hotel, ideal for a few days or a long week visit to the area. Only thing worth mentioning is that you must valet your car and its $37/night which is pricey, plus theres a resort fee of $25/night. So even if the rate is "only" ~$200/night, it will end up closer to $300. But for the area thats typical and it is by far the nicest hotel I've used in Dana Point.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you are such a huge fan of ours and that we are the nicest hotel in Dana Point that you have stayed at. We are looking forward to welcoming you back to create new and memorable experiences. We appreciate your compliments and cannot wait to have you back.

Summary Heading: Okay for a weekend, good location
Summary: Room was clean and ready for our 1 hour early check in. The location is great, walking distance to a variety of different kinds of restaurants, park, and Doheny State Beach. The good: got a great AAA deal at $161 per night, I would not spend more than $300 per night. The bad: poolside food needs a lot of work, fruit plate was awful, chix sandwich was ask awful-don't know how they could've messed that up. We chose a late check out (out by 5pm), which cost $99. It was worth it for us and I also liked that the maid cleaned up our room. Pool is more adult friendly than child or small kid.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that we were able to accommodate your early check-in and late check-out. We appreciate your feedback and would like to inform you that we do have a pool that features a kid's splash zone. The children typically gravitate towards this pool as there are many water features that they can use. Thank you again for your feedback. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: My husband and I took our two children and our two children here for a weekend away from the heat of the San Fernando Valley and had a wonderful time. This Marriott has a great location on the hill overlooking Dana Point with beautiful views. The property is well taken care of but needs an update. The staff was very friendly and attentive, especially Chris at the pool area.This Marriott has a very welcoming attitude toward children. Free breakfast buffet for children and little gifts at check in and the restaurant. We stayed in a wing overlooking the children's pool and it was ideal for us. I highly recommend this hotel to families as well as single couples.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great location, beautiful views of the Pacific Ocean
Summary: Stayed at this hotel for a wedding. It is a nice hotel with beautiful views of the ocean. Great outdoor space (with heaters) for grabbing drinks. I didn't like having to valet the car as it took a while to get it, especially at peak times. The gym was nice as was both pools. One is designed more for children while the other is quieter with the bar near by. Enjoyed the Starbucks coffee set up in the lobby every morning. It was nice to walk the grounds and enjoy the views. Nice running / walking paths. Easily traveled to San Diego from this location. The highways are nearby. Did take advantage of the salon. Rather small but served its purpose. There is a spa too but didn't have time to book an appointment. The rooms were dated and dark. We didn't care about this as much we spent
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Excellent service, could use a bit of a makeover
Summary: Beautiful views and excellent resort amenities at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott.  The rooms could use a bit of a touch up, but very clean and comfortable.  The staff and service was top notch, very cordial and helpful.  Would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great resort Staff was amazing. Rooms were nice but as modern as I expected. Great views of the ocean and harbor. I would give 5 stars but there is not breakfast. Just a starbucks with some continental stuff. Overall I would go back
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Don. We appreciate your compliments and we look forward to having you return.

Summary: This location is gorgeous!  Lots of paths on the grounds to take in all of the amazing views.   Rooms were so clean, roomy and comfortable.  The patio with fire-pits was a great way to spend an evening after a long day of meetings!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We were back for our 3rd or 4th stay over the last few years, this last May, 2016. They
Summary: WE adore this resort & it has been wonderful for us the last 3 or 4 times we have stayed here.  The last trip was for an anniversary, the stay a week and the breakfast we had was more than a 5 star rating!   We enjoyed the incredible food, ambiance & being served in style, with class, is much better than folks fighting you for your chance to make a waffle like some places. The service was impecable, the fresh made omlet or oatmeal to my daily lox & bagle were plenty until dinner.  Our room was comfie, quiet in a corner on 3rd floor, the spa is amazng with a talented gal who was great at facials I had before, but the real bonus was Linda, the Conceirge, who had so many details, that helped with the choices of activities & even got the hubby to go along to a play she found us, he
Manager Response: WOW! Thank you for the detailed review of your stay. We are so honored to have you and your family as part of our family. We are grateful for your loyalty. We promise to continue to provide you with new, life-long memories. We can't wait for your next visit! Take good care in the meantime and we will see you soon.

Summary: I've been to this hotel on 4 different occasions now as well as a few others in the area and love this one as it has the freshest feeling and some really great views.   The food here is not great (and way overpriced) but it's a short walk to Jimmy's a decent restaurant/bar and an excellent breakfast place right behind that.  It is generally very comfortable and no smell of mildew like many ocean hotels.  Very friendly service and clean.   Some of the rooms seem a bit newer than others but I can't speak to it in great detail.  I will stay at this hotel every time I come to the area.
Manager Response: We can not wait to welcome you back for another WOW experience! We create WOW experiences for our guests every day! Thank you for your review and for your loyalty. We look forward to having you back.

Summary Heading: The best deal of the South O.C. Beach resorts
Summary: There are a plethora of beach resorts in the Laguna Beach/Dana Point vicinity.   While this is not the most upscale, it has everything most would want in a beach resort - spa, outdoor dining, fabulous views.  It's also the most walkable of the area resorts, close to Dana Point restaurants and the harbor.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check in was fast and simple, and we were able to check in before 3pm. You will pay $37.00 to valet your car. It is available any time in and out. Just be aware. The staff was great. Be sure to ask for a room with a view on the second floor. If Possible ask to not be by the pool. Our room on the second floor had a nice little balcony with chairs. We went to the pool and we were greeted by a staff member with towels and she asked us where we wanted to sit and she put towels down for us and offered water. They have full service at the pool. There is a bar and they have a light menu. The Grounds and views are wonderful. But do not be fooled. This hotel is not on the beach. You must walk or drive down the cliffs and across the street to get to the beach. The hotel itself is very
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel reminds me of a hotel you'd find in Mackinac Island. It has an old school, classic vibe. The location is superb with gorgeous views. The staff is awesome! We had the absolute sweetest person check us in - one of the most welcoming greetings I've experienced while traveling. My only complaint is the ridiculous valet fee ($37 really?!) and the resort fee. Just be prepared to add about $100 to whatever price you've locked in. That way you won't be shocked when you receive your bill.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Nicole. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that our staff was friendly and kind. Your experience is extremely importance to us and we couldn't be happier knowing you left with wonderful memories. We hope you visit us again soon.

Summary Heading: Needs a refresh but we got a good deal so a reasonable value
Summary: We spent this last weekend attending a wedding here. This place needs a refresh as the rooms and ballrooms look tired. You are on the cliffs overlooking the coast so not on the beach although there are shuttles to get there. The climb back up is steep and good for the fit. The ocean views from some of the gardens are very nice. So if the event is outside you get pretty views of the Pacific Coast. But most rooms don't have expansive ocean views. There is a $25 daily resort fee but that seems a lot unless you end up using some of the free stuff included ( beach gear etc) there are 2 swimming pools so young families can keep the kids occupied.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Stunning & amazing secluded harbor point resort
Summary: Tucked away in the hills with dramatic views of cape cod style resort. We stayed at the resort for 4 days with Kaiser's conference with waived resort, valet pakring & internet fees  Amazing experience: From Valet parking, check-in,staffs & service are top notch.  Beautiful ground, luxurious pool,  spa  & tennis court. Love & enjoyed the Dana Point scenery meals at their Vue restaurant Food very pricey Very please with the food renovation healthy blend..Hurray!!! Excellent & outstanding job (congrats to a chef & his/her team).  Of course everything with additional fees:  Resort fee ($25 per day) Valet parking ($37 per night)  Spa fee ($25 per day),  With the internet fee ($15 per day) nowadays it's should be included Expensive with all the additional fees.  Our rooms were
Manager Response: none

Summary: A very nice and luxurious Marriott Hotel, the rooms were no better than a Hampton Inn though the price of the room was very higher than Hampton Inns, the beds were very comfy though.  The services were nice but there was no main restaurant, we ate snack type of meals and of course, true to it being a Marriott the snacks and drinks were very pricey!  The biggest surprise was the $37 a day to park! Of course we didn't realize the valet parking cost until we went to check out, there was no other choice other than to park on the road coming up to the hotel. It was a nice experience but not one I will return for anytime soon.  We did get $50 in food vouchers but it didn't go far.  There was a resort fee so I don't think you can say it had free wifi though there was no extra cost for
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Ray. We appreciate your compliments regarding our luxurious hotel and the comfortable beds. We apologize if you were unaware of the valet only service and resort fees. For the guest‚Äôs convenience, we clearly state that we provide valet service only on our website. We also state all of the fees on our website as well as the confirmation e-mail. We hope that this did not pose an inconvenience to you in any way. Thank you again for your review. We hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary Heading: many hidden costs and very slow valet services, inconvenient many problems
Summary: For one thing, there were no elevators close to the room, had to walk forever. The bath tub dripped loudly all night long. My wedding night actually. Had to get a fan to attempt to block the noise but was unsuccessful. There was no self parking and it took between 20 to 30 minutes to get your car out of the parking structure and very frustrating. Hidden fees were outrageous. For instance, a resort fee, tax on the resort fee, for each car parked per night was $37.00 per car per night. Also, I nearly stuck my foot on tacks that were on the floor. I don't know, but it seemed like  nightmare. HORRIBLE
Manager Response: Thank you for your review and we apologize that you did not have a good experience staying this us. We deeply regret that we fell short of your standards. We apologize if you were unaware of the valet only service and resort fees. For the guest‚Äôs convenience, we clearly state that we provide valet service only on our website. We also state all of the fees on our website as well as the confirmation e-mail. We apologize for the inconvenience this may have caused. Your issues have been shared with the department heads and you experience is very important to us. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: Driving back from a day trip to San Diego I began to fall asleep, so I exited the freeway and searched online for the closest place to get a room until morning.  This place was where I picked and I am glad I did. It was a beautiful hotel and an easy check in experience. I woke up refreshed and with the use of the excellent shower soap amenities provided I got ready to leave and finished my drive back to los angeles. I will stay here again when I get the opportunity.  My room had a view of the harbor with an outdoor balcony with seating and was absolutely beautiful.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: What a great place with a great view!
Summary: What a great place with a great view!  The service was great, the facilities were great, but the view was even better.  The pool area was well designed for all ages and interests.  Just a stroll down to Dana Point and great shops and restaurants.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was in Dana Point on business for a few days and stayed at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott. I generally don't love Marriotts but this was one of their resorts and the property was terrific. Stunning location and superb staff who were very friendly and helpful. If you like working out, it's one of the better hotel gyms and is attached to their spa. It's also a place where you can easily dine solo at the bar which I tend to do when on business. I'd definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your business trip at our resort and that we were able to leave a great impression as a Marriott property for you. We couldn't be happier that you left with fond memories and we look forward to having you return. We hope to see you soon.

Summary: Excellent service, fair price, beautiful property and views. Dana Point is a beautiful place to see the water views are breath taking. As nice as more expensive hotels and a great value. Pays to stay at this hotel.... Chris P
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: The go to resort in Dana Point
Summary: Our family of 4 stayed here for the Orange County part of our SoCal getaway week.  The property is situated hilltop in the center of Dana Point, near the ocean, harbor and other attractions of the area.  The rooms were clean and comforable...ours with ground access to one of the two pool areas! The spa included a well-equipped fitness center.   Since it was still off-season and there was no convention activity early in the week, we pretty much had the resort to ourselves.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted that your family enjoyed their getaway at the resort. We appreciate your recommendation and we hope you and your family return for another visit.

Summary: The Laguna Cliffs hotel is situated up on a cliff/hill. It's got the Hotel Del Coronado look- white building with the red roof. The inside is up to date with gorgeous white marble floors and gray walls. The decor is beautiful. I had a balcony of the second floor that overlooked the pool and had ocean views. The hotel is large, but feels very quaint. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. The local beach is right across the street.  The meeting space was nice with lots of windows allowing light to come in. The service staff was very friendly and pleasant. My room was spacious with a loveseat, desk, and king size bed. The bed was comfortable with a lot of pillows. The bathroom had ample counter space although the bathroom as a whole was cramped. I was not
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Dana Point Harbor is just a few blocks from this Hotel
Summary: This is a beautiful Marriott property, located on a hilltop, looking down on Dana Point Harbor.  Nicely decorated Hotel, with many options for taking a stroll for just 5 minutes to the Harbor.  Stairs go directly from the Hotel down to the Harbor.  Many different shops there, as well as other food options.  Good for "people watching" too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Dont get me wrong.. that hotel was nice.. nice service.. it calls itself a "resort" the layout is a little weird.. the front desk and main bar is in a seperat building..  you walk out to get to your room.. the exterior feels a little like a condo complex. the pool is alright. the service was very good.. the room was clean.. but felt a little used.. my balcony sliding door facing the pool was not locking.. the soundproofing is not the best every morning I woke up hearing some guy on the floor above peeing straight in the toilet water then flush.. either he had a strong flow... or it was the accoustic...not much around, good thing I had a truck to get around...  I think for the money it should be a little better..
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your feedback and apologize that the noise coming from the surrounding guest rooms interrupted your stay with us. We understand how important a quiet environment is during your vacation. Thank you again for your feedback.

Summary: Just returned from a three night business related stay at this property.  Ours was a 150-175 person business group and this reviewer found that this property was overall well suited for our meeting.  Guest rooms, although not exceptional as might be found in a higher-end property, were Marriott clean and well apportioned, with none of the often found annoyances like a noisy AC unit, hot water that suddenly changed in temperature and the like.  The view from our room was fantastic and overlooked the Vue Pool and the Dana Point Harbor.  The thick terry robe hanging in the closet was a nice touch.  From check-in to a request for a later checkout to valet bag checking, all was friendly, efficient and pleasant when dealing with the front-end staff at this property.  To the person,
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is located in Dana Point, not sure why the place is call Laguna Cliffs.  But the hotel is awesome, it is clean and friendly.  Location was perfect for us, right off the highway, walking distance to a great breakfast place at the bottom of the stairs, walked to Dana Point Beach (Baby Beach) rented paddle boards/kayaks and just paddled around the Marina.  The Hotel Pool was awesome, it had a jaccuzi/hot tub, in the AM there was a Yoga Class with like 50 people doing yoga.  The views were awesome, I had a work conference call from an adirondack chair overlooking the ocean.  Went for a few runs in the AM, so many people being active.....Perfect getaway for me and my wife...thx!
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review and congratulations on your new baby. We are very delighted to hear that you and your wife enjoyed a getaway at the resort. We hope your wife was also able to experience the "Mother in Waiting" massages we offer at The Spa. We are happy that you were able to enjoy the resort's amenities and we hope to see you and your wife again soon.

Summary: This is a very pleasant well run resort spa that is businessman accessible to most of the south county yet still gives you a comfortable beachside holiday experience for you off time. The fitness center and spa are excellent, rooms with views very comfortable and knowledgeable staff are helpful. The food service is adequate but you may want to google some nearby highly rated restaurants for any special meal.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Customer service was abysmal and rude! You can't take pictures if you're in a wedding down, but if you have normal clothes on you can?  Also rooms are sub par for the price, they tack on a special tax per night, and charge for parking!  This isn't New York and you're not the Montage! Wake up Jim [--].
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We regret that you were not satisfied with your stay. We appreciate your feedback and would like you to know that we do allow photography of brides not getting married at the resort for a fee. We do give all brides and grooms who are having their wedding at the resort exclusivity to the grounds of the property. We do this so that we can ensure all brides and grooms have the ability to photograph anywhere at any time with no interference. For that reason we mention our photography fee upfront so there are no surprises. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: Incredible views of the lagoon and outstanding, as expected from Marriott although the hotel is a bit older.  Unfortunately the weather was a bit too chilly for the pool bit the restaurants, gym and hotel are beautiful
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and we hope you are able to visit us again when the sun is shining. See you soon!

Summary: Had a sales meeting to attend, and I actually look forward to the stay here. Rooms are always immaculate and the property is convenient to just about everything. Everything in Soutern California is expensive, but this area is my "Disneyland." Weather is awesome this time of year too!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We drove down from Santa Clarita Valley to meet a couple of friends from Arizona who were staying in San Juan Capistrano, for an afternoon of wine tasting and food.  The Laguna Cliffs Marriott presents itself well.  Not far to the harbor, but a steep climb back up. Room was over the top as we had booked a king partial ocean view and received a huge 2 room suite, with an ocean view. This perk was wasted on us, unfortunately, as we weren't in the room much.  The OverVue restaurant had good apps, chicken flatbread and jalape√±o chicken bites were excellent, and the warm chocolate cake dessert was yummy.  We didn't exercise the staff much, but overall service was great, from the front desk to the server at the restaurant.  Definitely will stay again when in the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Dale. We are delighted to hear that you had a wonderful visit with friends and a memorable stay with us. Thank you for all of your fine compliments. We hope you find it in your travels again to stay with us in the future.

Summary: I only have one complaint and it is that the bed i slept on was like a rock even with the pillow-top cover on it. That aside, the service was excellent and the food and view were amazing. Spa services were a great experience and I received an incredible massage. I will be returning here not just with my husband but the rest of my family.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are just delighted to hear that you and your husband had a wonderful spa experience. We appreciate your feedback and will certainly share your comments with our team. We look forward to having your entire family visit us. See you soon.

Summary: I went there with my husband and two kids... the hotel is beautiful with an amazing ocean view..You can see both sunshine and sunset at the same time :).. rooms are very clean and comfortable.... food was OK  (in average)....  There is a park in front of the hotel and there is a play area for kids there... I would love to go there again...
Manager Response: none

Summary: I held an event at the hotel and they charged me 25% "service charge" for the room.  The service they provided was less than adequate.  They were slow to respond to open the door after lunch.  They didn't give me the rooms as requested - said their rooms were booked and on the day of the event, they were empty - shoved us into the conference room instead.  So, I was very disappointed to say the least and highly recommend that you don't hold an event at this resort.  Parking is valet only and it took them over half an hour to get my car - apparently not all valet  attendants can drive a stick shift.   Watch out for HIDDEN CHARGES.  They are extortionists.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback Barbara. Your experience is extremely important to us. We are very disappointed that you did not have a good experience with planning your meeting with us. We regret having fallen short of your expectations, as well as our own. Our team prides itself on addressing the needs of each guest we encounter to ensure they have a pleasant stay. Your comments will be shared with our team to help us improve upon any shortfalls or inconsistencies. Our Resort is synonymous with providing an exceptional experience for our guests and creating successful meetings and we clearly missed the mark. We hope you know that this was definitely an exception and not the norm for the Resort. Thank you again for your review.

Summary Heading: Perfect blend of business and resort
Summary: The conference and dining facilities are good as you'd expect at any Marriott, but the special part is the location on a gently sloping hilltop above the water and marina in Dana Point, very accessible for a stroll or jog with beautiful scenery. The hotel is set inside a park with jogging paths and private homes nearby.  2 pools, one more for kids, the other more for adults.  The reataurant bar overlooks a beautoful visya where I watched the colors of the sunset (where the sun meets the actual horizon is not visible from here).  The marina below has lots of restaurants and scenic pathways.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us as you were on a business trip. We couldn't be more pleased that you were able to take some time away from your meeting to enjoy the scenery and the beautiful sunset. We look forward to having you return in the future.

Summary Heading: The property isn't well suited for a resort
Summary: As a hotel, it's fine.  But it's location does not rise to what you expect for the word "resort." It is not an easy walk to the beach or any other truly fine place. So basically you stay on the property, or you face the hassle of valet parking to retrieve your car and drive somewhere interesting and search for parking.   I wish they offered self parking and dropped the pretense of being a resort.  Breakfast buffet is expensive - it cost nearly my entire per diem for meals, for this business trip.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your feedback and regret that you didn't find the resort's proximity to the beach close enough. Most of our guests enjoy the  118 steps down to the marina/harbor and some even ride bikes (that we offer at the resort) to the beach. We value your opinion and will certainly share your comments with our team. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: I am 41 years old and have traveled a lot. I have never taken the time to write a review because I have 5 young kids and life is busy. But I had to leave a review for this hotel because it is truly our best hotel experience ever. The view is incredible and the hotel is beautiful, but the service is outstanding. They actually hand wrote a card and slipped it under our door the first night commenting on what we said at check in and wishing us a great stay. Then, when we had an issue with a dog barking incessantly next door to us as we were trying to go to sleep. Since this was a pet free property, they contacted the owners (who were not in their room with the dog) to come back so they could help them find another hotel that would accommodate pets. Because the dog would not stop
Manager Response: none

Summary: This place is so beautiful. The staff is the best. The bar food is great-- grab cocktail, some truffle fries and watch the sunset. The food is ok, and the property a little old, but the view is spectacular. Enjoy
Manager Response: none

Summary: Pay no attention to the negative reviews...if you had a bad experience at this place it was probably your own fault. This place is first class all the way. The location is outstanding and within walking distance of shops, restaurants, a marina, beach and more. Every staff member we encountered was pleasant and more than willing to help us make our stay memorable. Granted it's a little pricey so if you want to save money go to Motel 6...if you want a wonderful getaway stay here!
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review and wonderful compliments. We couldn't be more pleased that you enjoyed your stay with us and left with fond memories. We hope that you find it in your travels to visit us again in the future, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary Heading: Wife and I stayed here, room was cramped and the veu restuarant gave her food poisoning. Not a pleasant stay.
Summary: Beautiful on the outside. Be prepared to pay for lackluster customer service and a bunch of untrained individuals that think they own the place. Very disappointed. We will stay at the St. Regis next time.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your recent stay at our resort.  We are very sorry to hear that you were not feeling well after dining in our restaurant and hope you had a speedy recovery.  Upon reviewing your feedback with our Food & Beverage Director, he confirmed that we did not have any reported food/dining issues during the timeframe you stayed with us and regrets that something did not agree with you.  Please be assured we take these issues very seriously and appreciate you bringing your concerns to our attention.

Summary Heading: Supposed to be very nice and "resort-ie and spa-ie"
Summary: My friend found a "deal" for this place, she likes Marriott's, I stand true, "because it says marriott, you spend more and get less"  We were at a convention and came down to relax and enjoy our time here.  We knew even with our "deal" there would be a resort fee, valet parking and wifi charges (most included in our deal).  The rooms were just ok, not over the top clean, not special in any way, not even a fridge.  There was a stuffy musty smell and feel to the room.  There was just a full bathroom, so if someone was in the shower, or using the restroom, no one else could use a sink or get ready.  No fan in the bathroom, wow, the shower was no better then a motel 6, no joke, the shower barley had any pressure/flow, could not rinse my hair out, and I don't have thick or long hair.
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review. Your comments are very important to us and we have shared them with our management team. Please know that our AC units will keep the warm very cool and all you need to do is let it run with your windows closed to get the temperature down quickly. We have an engineering team on site for any repairs including the water pressure. We are here 24 hours a day to make your experience as wonderful as we can. Our At Your Service department is also available for any requests such as mini refrigerators, etc. We do thank you again for your review.

Summary: Just another quick weekend stay. Our room was even better than last time and we really enjoyed relaxing on our balcony. A nice ocean breeze does wonders for recovering from a demanding work week. Perhaps one day we will stay in a Dana Point suite?
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that your room was even better this time. We couldn't agree with you more, the ocean breeze and ocean views really does bring peace and tranquility. We cannot wait to welcome you back. We look forward to having you stay in one of our suites the next time you visit.

Summary: Why throw ur money away unless ur one of those yacht owners who can....save it and go to that Best Western just on the other side of PCH...JW quit hidding your parking fees in the fine print.....that will be the last time I get ripped off for $60 additional fee on top of our room charge...man at least give me a free meal with the room......lesson learned...TRAVELERS, Look for hotels that offer free breakfast and parking!
Manager Response: We apologize if you were unaware of the valet only service fees. For the guest‚Äôs convenience, we clearly state that we provide valet service only on our website. We also state all of the fees on our website as well as the confirmation e-mail. We hope that this did not pose an inconvenience to you in any way. Thank you again for your review. We hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: Though I love Marriott- I have complaints. The bikes we used, after paying a resort fee to use them were in horrible shape. The tires were flat and on one bike, off the rim with the back brake locked. They did give us different bikes but they were a mess/chains completely rusted/ hard to ride.  Also, $14 for a glass of Kendall Chardonnay is ridiculous.  Paying $6 for 10 minutes on the computer and a $1.00 a page to print in the business center is highway robbery
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Kathleen. We appreciate your feedback and are pleased to hear that our staff was able to quickly replace your complimentary bike rentals. Please know that we have quite a few so if you are ever dissatisfied, we can loan you another one. Your opinion is very important to us and we will share your comments with our team.

Summary: Price based travelers beware.   If you are using price as a part of your selection criteria when staying in Dana Point, don't stay here without adding $60.00 per day on your room rate.  You won't notice this unless you read fine print on your booking.  They charge a "Resort Fee" of $27.50 which won't show up in the rate and you can't self park so that's another $37.00 per day on valet charges.  The resort itself is lovely but they are being deceptive in their room charging practices which is beneath Marriott in my opinion.  Their front desk was absolutely unconcerned when I brought this to their attention.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. As you mentioned in your review, we clearly state all of our fees upfront so that our guests are aware before checking -in. Our fees are stated on our website and confirmation e-mail. We do regret that you were unhappy with these fees. Our goal is to make your stay as pleasurable as possible. Thank you for your feedback.

Summary: I highly recommend a visit to Dana Point. It is just a beautiful town. This hotel was beautiful, great service, great hotel rooms, good room service, The staff was very friendly and had a lot of knowledge of the town and things to do.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a Four-Star resort property with appropriate rooms to match -- nothing more, nothing less.  Though the grounds and views are nice (overlooking the marina), they are not spectacular unlike some other nearby properties. In order to get to my room, I had to exit the lobby and walk outside to the entrance.  Something that was not expected: the signature restaurant in the resort is open only on weekends -- in its stead you are directed to the Caf√©/Bar which has the views but a limited menu and overpriced wines by the glass. The staff however is friendly and helpful.  I was charged nearly $500 per night for the basic ground floor room, which definitely was not a value play. Most maddening however, is Marriott's habit of "nickeling and diming" guests by charging an additional
Manager Response: Thank you for your review George. We appreciate your compliments regarding our friendly and helpful staff.  We apologize if you were unaware of the valet only service and resort fees. For the guest‚Äôs convenience, we clearly state that we provide valet service only on our website. We also state all of the fees on our website as well as the confirmation e-mail. We hope that this did not pose an inconvenience to you in any way. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: My wife and I spent 2 days and nights at the resort. Our time there was fantastic! The property was beautiful! Our accommodations were first class. The most impressive aspect of our visit was the superior guest services by everyone on property. From the valet and bell staff to the guest services manager greeting us in the lobby to the front desk staff, everyone was very friendly and helpful. Even the room attendants would greet us as we would pass by the room they were cleaning. What struck me was everyone was genuinely warm. It's a refreshing level of service.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spectacular property overlooking ocean, on a bluff on Dana Point.  Rooms are well appointed, pools lovely.  Try to get a room overlooking the pool or the ocean, and with a balcony (on second or third floor).
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Sarah. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We couldn't be happier to hear that your stay was fantastic. We hope you visit us again soon.

Summary: A 5-star stay.  I felt that we received a 5-star experience, but was more affordable than the 5-stars at Laguna.  I had priced a few other locations in the area and am so pleased with this one.  It gave us exactly what we needed.  Distance from Dana Point to Laguna Beach is nothing to be concerned about.  You can't walk it, but a taxi or Uber would be a no-brainer.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It's hard to complain about this place, but I'm going to a little. Stayed 3 nights with the family. First off you are paying for location here as the location of the resort is great- beautiful views indeed. Staff-  fantastic.  Yes the valet (37) and resort (25) fees suck.    What didn't impress me was the room. It was dated (screen door fell off the track when I opened it) unimpressive and a little musty. Probably because there is no fan in the bathroom (whose idea was that?).  Hey on the bright side the beds we're comfy :).   Pools were okay especially for the kids and the fitness center was great. The restaurant is way too expensive and the food wasn't very good. There are lots of choices to eat in the area so unless you want to spend 100 bucks for a family of 4 to eat go
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your feedback and will certainly share your comments with our team. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you found the views to be beautiful. We hope that you do visit us again in the future.

Summary: This resort has everything we could have wanted and more. Unfortunately it was a weekend visit (in town for a friend's wedding), but I almost wish we could have skipped it and lazed around all weekend instead. From the friendly valets out in front of the well appointed lobby/restaurant area to the room worthy of the "Marriott" name overlooking the green landscaping and the Sparkling Dana Point Harbor, this spot perched above coastal Dana Point was relaxation embodied. Looking forward to coming back. Make sure you tip the service, because they take great care of you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Overlooking Dana Point Harbor is the Laguna Cliffs Marriott. Gently etched into the hillside, this hidden gem overlooks the Pacific and is cooled by the ocean breeze. It is a unique looking property that is built on the hill and grows to as high as three stories.   Entering the hotel, you enter into a large open space that may be cooled only by the ocean breezes if the doors are open.   There is a small park next to the hotel and you may be lucky enough to open the sliding door of your room to see a yoga class.   There is only one restaurant on the premise but a short walk down the hill will take you to the harbor and the shops surrounding it.  If you are looking for a relaxing get away, this is the spot.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Karl. We are delighted that you enjoyed your stay with us. We hope that your relaxing getaway was long enough for you, and if not, we hope you visit us again soon for another longer relaxation. We hope you visit our Spa the next time you are in the area. See you soon.

Summary: This was our first stay at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa. We could not have been more pleased with our stay at this property. We were fortunate enough to be upgraded to an ocean view room. The view from our balcony was breathtaking! There is a city-owned park in front of the property and it allows for unobstructed ocean views up and down the Orange County coastline. The valet and front desk were very courteous and welcoming. We were able to walk down to several nearby restaurants and the Dana Point harbor. The interior of the rooms are somewhat outdated and the beds were not as comfortable as we would have expected from a Marriott property. On the whole our family was pleased with the service and views of this beautiful property.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice modern hotel with the usual facilities you would expect. However on the negative side the cleaning service is terrible. Twice we had to get them to do an evening turn down service and get fresh towels. Another day they didn't hover and one day after dust was biuilding up om the surfaces we had to get management to get it done properly. The heating/air conditioning must be old as it was noisily cutting in and out all night but very loud. They food menu is restrictive and is used for lunch and supper with many items not available. There is no dining room so you have to freeze on the decking outside the bar or sit in the bar. Staff were all helpful but the lack off amenities nearby was a problem I'd you didn't have a car at $35 a. night to park. You feel trapped and cut off
Manager Response: Thank you for your review David. We want to apologize for the inconvenience you experienced during your stay with us. Please allow us to extend our sincere apologies for the unacceptable maintenance of your guestroom.  Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this guestroom with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future.  As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality.  We also want to take a moment to apologize for the inconvenience you experienced while dining with us. We understand that you wanted to sit in the dining room and it was closed. Please know that your opinion is very important to us and we will be sure to address this with our management team. Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm.  It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.

Summary: We simply loved this place even though we only stayed a night and a late check-in to boot. We were in town for a retirement ceremony and we spent a good deal of the afternoon and evening catching up with friends at a private home. The hotel enjoys a perfectly nice location overlooking the Pacific Ocean. Just before the evening chill snuck up on us, we saw the last glimmer of what was a warm, sunny day. The next morning, I indulged myself in the hotel‚Äôs top-of-the-line gym and took a walk on a very nice scenic path with my wife afterwards. We had our espressos on one of the outdoor lounges after a rushed walk-around the premises. The service from valet parking to restaurant to the room were excellent and professional in every way. Highly recommended. Can‚Äôt wait for our next visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Real nice stay! We pulled up and there was valet parking and the guys there that parked the vehicles were very nice and courteous. Check in was a breeze and we got to the room and it was okay. Nothing that stood out. The only thing I did not like was that our door didn't close by itself. You had to pull it closed or push it once inside to close. The room was clean. The beds were extra soft. I know some people do jot like that softness of matresses but that was not my issue. The room had a big enough TV in there to watch a movie. The balcony scenery was what I liked the most. You can see the park and the cliffs with the ocean behind it. It was real nice. I went to the park a couple of times to read and just enjoy the view of the cliffs and ocean. A lot of people brought their
Manager Response: Thank you for detailed review Reginald. We are delighted to hear about your stay and we couldn't be happier to hear that you enjoyed the balcony and the beautiful views of the park and the ocean from your guest room. We look forward to having you back. See you soon.

Summary: I stayed for two weeks on business at this Resort. I know this is an older built hotel so there is only so much updating that can be done. The hotel grounds were gorgeous. My room had a nice pool view. I was disappointed that my room the first week was a little stale. I tried turning on the air to get the stale smell out, but it did not help. My second week was in another room that did not have the smell. So that was a plus. I found that housekeeping did not replace the towels that they took so by the end of the week I was running short on towels. They even took the ones that I hung up to "conserve water". There was a business party one night in the pool area with live music. I enjoyed it, but I would imagine if you came for a relaxing time, the noise could have been a bother.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Anna. We appreciate your feedback as your opinion is very important to us. We have addressed your concerns with our Housekeeping team as this was definitely an oversight on our part and we want to apologize for it. We also want to take a moment to apologize if you were unaware of the valet only service fees. For the guest‚Äôs convenience, we clearly state that we provide valet service only on our website. We also state all of the fees on our website as well as the confirmation e-mail. We hope that this did not pose an inconvenience to you in any way. Thank you again for your review. We want to again thank you for your feedback and we hope to welcome you back soon.

Summary: This hotel is located on top of a hill with amazing views of the ocean from the bar deck.  The pool area is super nice and there is a open space area and walking path to the restaurants and shops close by.
