The other thing we loved was being able to open the window in the room to get a nice breeze flowing!  I'm only sorry we didn't stay longer!  Loved it!
Manager Response: none

Summary: When paying these kinds of prices, you expect a certain level of quality.  I usually stay at the Montage or Ritz, however they were all booked.  The rooms need updating.  We had housekeeping issues: trash not emptied, dirty glasses not removed from the room, toiletries not refreshed in the bathroom (only one of us were able to wash our hair the next day) and the bed only partially made (our pillows were on the couch?). The hallway had divits in the wallpaper where housekeeping carts had nicked them.  Silverware was scattered on the floor in the hallway as well.  Plus, the housekeeping carts were kept in a bunch at the entrance to the hallway the entire time. Just felt like a motel rather than a resort.  I made the front desk aware and was told ok, we will talk to them.    Yes,
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your constructive comments regarding your recent stay at our Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa.  Please allow us to extend our sincere apologies for the unacceptable maintenance of your guestroom.  Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this guestroom with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future.  As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality.  Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm.  It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.

Summary: This is a rather quaint hotel with excellent facilities that overlooks the Dana Point Marina. The staff are very professional and caring and ensure that you have an excellent experience whilst visiting the area. The rooms are quite nice however bathrooms that have shower curtains over the shower in a bath are things of another era and should be urgently upgraded.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When the hotel was built in mid 80's it rivaled the Beverly Hills hotel in ambience and service. Today, the buildings are a bit tired but the location and dining areas are awesome, the food is good, the spa is excellent, housekeeping keeps rooms very clean - other staff are mainly attentive but not pushy.  Chris H, the head bellman, will take care of your every request with much professionalism.  It's a short walk down to the harbor where you have to go to Turk's for the experience and good food.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review Dan. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the resort and all of the amenities, including the Spa. We hope that you find it in your travels to visit us again soon. We'd love to have you back.

Summary: First time at this hotel and it was impressive. The location can't be beat. There is valet parking which was included in our package or you can park down the hill and walk up to the hotel. It was efficient to text when we wanted our car and it was waiting for us. They have bikes and boards for your use which are fun. Bed was comfortable and room was lovely with a view. Lots of areas around the pool and grounds to lounge. We were surprised with a chocolate dessert delivered to us. The plate said Happy Birthday,but it was our anniversary. The nice card wished us happy anniversary  and wanted us to enjoy champagne and chocolate cake. Apparently the porter forgot the champagne and picked up the wrong plate. Can't complain too much since it was nothing we had asked for. It was a nice
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked this property for one night on the way to our honeymoon in San Diego. We arrived late to the hotel (we called ahead to let the hotel know). Upon arrival - at close to midnight - he parking valet greeted us and took care of our luggage and vehicle, and the front desk staff were extremely polite and welcoming. Our room was exactly as we had booked.  We ate breakfast the following morning on the property overlooking the marina. Everything was better than expected. We were a little disappointed that we had not chosen to stay longer, and we will definitely return should we make our way through southern California again
Manager Response: Congratulations on your recent wedding! We are so happy that you stayed with us during your stop over to San Diego. We couldn't be happier that your experience with us  made your night memorable. We hope that you visit us again soon for a longer stay. We'd love to have you both back. We hope you enjoyed your honeymoon in San Diego. See you soon.

Summary: Beautiful cliff top ocean view.   Location overlooking Dana Point harbor is its selling point.  All amenities and services one expects of a Marriott. Professional and courteous service staff from auto valet to housekeeping.  Nice up to date and comfortable rooms.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We couldn't be happier that you enjoyed your stay with us and were able to use the amenities of the resort. We appreciate your compliments and cannot wait to have you back. We hope you visit us again in the near future.

Summary: My wife and I stay at the Laguna Cliff's Marriott at least twice a year. This trip was about 8 days and we were delighted with the property, food service, and the attitude and service of the staff. The location is excellent with easy access to PCH (Pacific Coast Highway) and the newly renovated Dana Point shopping area. The restaurant serves a great breakfast buffet or you can have a light breakfast at the Overvue Lounge. There is a morning yoga class at the park in front of the property which my wife loves to join. The Marriott has yoga mats for use of the guests. Lastly, the Overvue Lounge is a great place to have a cocktail overlooking Dana Point Harbour and the Pacific Ocean. We strongly recommend this Marriott for any occasion.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted and so grateful to hear that you are a loyal vacationer of ours. We appreciate your compliments and we are so happy to hear that you had another wonderful stay. We look forward to your next visit.

Summary Heading: Front desk people are awesome- hotel needs a refresh.
Summary: We stayed here in August, so it was quite busy.  We wanted to stay two nights but could only get one, but that's not because the front desk didn't try their hardest to help us get a room!  They were amazing and friendly and so helpful.  The bellman were great and friendly, and the woman at the bar at night was super nice.   That being said, there were a few things to nitpick.  Our room faced the pool, so the view was nice; however, the music at the pool was on until very late.  We had to call the front desk to have them turn it off (I guess it was supposed to go off at a certain time).  I felt like there was a lack of amenities, and the rooms were just a bit dated.  I feel like the place just needs a bit of a refresher.  The location is wonderful, but it can't rest on it's
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Beautiful spot but not great service
Summary: This is a lovely resort. We had stayed at this Marriott several years ago and were anxious to return. Unfortunately the room service didn't support the cost of the room.  The staff did great the first day but we never got our coffee mugs cleaned or new soap or towels the second day. We called for some additional coffee and soap but never got new mugs or glasses. Disappointing and don't think we will return.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We deeply regret that the items you requested were not delivered to you or replenished. Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally speak with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future.   Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm.  It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.

Summary: Full Ocean view could actually mean: View of driveway and front lawn of the hotel. (with a 10% peak of the ocean). I'm 53 and have stayed here many times. First time I have had bad luck with the actual room...   But it didn't end there, there were no towels at the pool, the drain in the tub was slow, One of the two jacuzzis was cold and the other one was packed with screaming kids. If you are here with your kids and family.. ok, but if you want some peace and serenity, forget it.  Here is the worst part, when you actually try to speak with someone at the front desk, it is clear you are burdening them with your request for customer service. This place used to be the Dana point resort (not Marriott) and was well managed at that time. My memories deceived me as I recalled the great
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Mike. We want to take a moment an apologize for your experience at the resort. We understand how frustrating  it would be to walk into a hotel that you have had fond memories of only to leave with disappointment. For the guests convenience we do have two pools for our guests to enjoy and our "At Your Service" department is there to assist with any maintenance issues you may experience.  Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm.  It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.  We do hope you visit us again and give us another chance to restore your faith.

Summary Heading: Can't wait for our next stay
Summary: Beautiful setting and very friendly staff.  It is not close to the beach but sitting on the veranda of the cafe or on your balcony gives you a view of the beach and harbor.  Very restful and relaxing.  We will plan another stay here for sure!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your wonderful compliments. We can't want to have you back for another stay. See you soon.

Summary: Booked after a whale watching tour. Really close to marina and really pretty. Rooms a really good size and bed is so comfy. Service was great and staff friendly. Beautiful place to stay. Would definitely recommend if you are nearby and want to spoil yourself.
Manager Response: Thank you for your response Brad and Joanne. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your whale watching excursion with us. We hope you were able to see some whales during your tour. We hope you visit us again for a relaxing stay.

Summary: All staff went out of their way to ensure we had a perfect stay at The Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa. The hotel is immaculate, rooms are clean & the location is beautiful.  The Valet Parking service was excellent & we only had to wait a minute or two for our car to be brought to us. Well worth the fee as it made arriving and exiting hotel a breeze. Breakfast buffet was excellent with lots of choice & freshly made omelettes as a buffet choice in addition to hot selection.  Outside heaters on terrace a great idea & drinks/coffee under the stars along with lap blankets made for cosy evenings if you chose to. We had two rooms with great ocean views. If any slight criticism it would be beds were too soft (to the point of like sleeping in a hammock) but on speaking with
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review Tatiana. We are delighted that you had such a wonderful stay with us. Our goal is to make your stay as comfortable and pleasurable as we can and we cannot be more happier to hear that we created a memorable experience for you. We hope you visit us again soon.

Summary: This property is in a great location with beautiful views of the ocean and marina. Unfortunately the bed in our room 254 was terrible I believe this was a 1 off as the room itself was nice and comfortable.  We stayed in on our first night and had room service ordering the BLT and the Chicken Caesar Salad of course overpriced with room service but tasty. The gym was well equipped and very nice for both cardio and strength work-outs.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We had stayed here a few years ago and decided to return again recently. upon arrival, we were a little early and the front desk had our room ready and even gave us an upgrade. We were still very happy with the rooms and this hotel overall. The grounds are very well kept and beautiful. It's a great location, very well kept place. We enjoyed the bicycles the resort offers as well as the pool and hot tub. The staff was amazing everywhere at this resort.   My only complaint was my husband and I went down for a cocktail and were pretty shocked by the fee for a martini. By the time the added tax and tips we paid right around $40.00 for two drinks.   But we will definitely return the next time we are in this area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Our room was lovely but clearly had not been cleaned well
Summary: This hotel is in a great location!  Its beautiful.  This was our second trip and we did receive a small and nice spread of beer and crackers as a thank you.  Upon check in we had a great view but there was urine and toilet paper in the toilet and a spot wad in the bathroom sink.  The bathroom wasn't cleaned.  We did call the front desk, and they said we could move rooms but we had already unpacked.  My husband did write an email and they offered a room upgrade on our next stay.  Not sure I'd go back, for the price I expect a clean room and a higher level of service.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Elizabeth. As delighted as we are that you visited the resort for the second time, we are truly disappointed that your rooms was not at all to our regular standards. Please allow us to extend our sincere apologies for the unacceptable cleanliness of your guestroom.  Please be assured this incident has been addressed with our Director of Housekeeping so he can personally review this guestroom with his team and provide the appropriate training to ensure this does not happen again in the future.  As you can imagine, the upkeep of our guestrooms is of the utmost importance and we have a detailed maintenance program in place to ensure the quality and cleanliness of each guestroom is always of the highest quality.  Usually we receive many fine compliments from our guests and we hope you will look upon this as an isolated incident and not the norm.  It is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we regret these shortfalls put a damper on your visit to our resort.

Summary Heading: Visited for a meeting, hope to come back for leisure
Summary: I stayed here for a week long meeting and was pleased overall with the hotel.  The room was clean, amenities were more than acceptable.  Only negative on the room was that the bathroom needs a little attention - caulking around the tub looked to be cracking and wearing out and the shower head was a bit anemic.  I normally prefer a firm bed, so was a bit concerned when I sunk into the bed, but I was surprised with how comfortable it was and how well I slept.  Only had the chance to experience conference food but it was generally pretty good.   The bar service started out a bit spotty, but quickly became very good - with staff remembering names as we were on a tab.  Very enjoyable to have nice cold beer on the deck off the main lobby - especially during the warm weather.  Had a
Manager Response: none

Summary: Lovely hotel in Dana Point that over looks the beautiful Pacific Ocean. The rooms are very well decorated with nice little touches throughout. Great lighting. Plenty of outlets. Bathroom amenities were wonderful. It even had a vanity mirror which I loved. Equipped with robes and plenty of towel linens. Comfortable bed & linens. You pay for it :) Our room had a nice private walk out porch area with a lounge chair to sit & enjoy the California sun. For a fee they offered in room water & drinks. Great little romantic getaway... Valet only. Bring extra $$ for tipping. Restaurant on site. Other restaurants nearby but not walking distance.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your wonderful compliments regarding the resort's amenities and your comfortable room. We do hope you stay with us again in the future. We'd love to welcome you back.

Summary Heading: A Visit of Heaven and Solitary Ocean-View Peace!  Loving This Tript!!!
Summary: It has been a hard week, yes it has.  I booked last minute for a solo night in a lil' luxury before I return to the real world.  I arrived at 11 am.  11AM!!!  And they allowed me to check in AND I lucked out and got an upgrade to a beautiful two room suite with two separate balconies overlooking the ocean.  Quite beautiful!!  I am right now cuddled down in the cozy bedding after watching the glorious sunset from the high chairs on the balconies.  I am almost crying I feel so relaxed.  Susan at reception was wonderful.  I actually screwed up my reservation, but she fixed everything.  And now I am eating chocolates from turn-down in my lush robe having a glass of wine.  The pool is beautiful.  Next time I am bringing my husband!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We couldn't be happier that you were checked-in early and upgraded to a suite with an ocean-view. We are delighted to hear that you have finally relaxed and continue to enjoy your quick getaway with us. We couldn't be more happy. We hope you do visit us again soon and we cannot wait to welcome you and your husband.

Summary Heading: I am joining those who gave a 'poor' rating !
Summary: Before I booked this hotel I quickly looked at the website and their photographs, which lured me in!  I went with great expectations and came away disappointed.  As much as I would have liked to write a nice review I could not bring myself to do so and I have to be honest about it.  There is something about the hotels and properties that evoke a warm feeling. For some obscure reason this place did not do so. The warm feelings about the property are usually the sum total of all that is offered, starting with clarity in pricing, the facility, service, rooms, food and so on and so on.  At this hotel we got off with a wrong start.  As soon as we drove in, we found out that the car parking was valet only, no other way. (  the quote of $37 per night was a bit high and unsettling.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We truly regret that you did not get a warm feeling when you arrived to our resort. We apologize for that as we have every intention to not only make our environment warm and friendly but also to give you a feeling of comfort and relaxation from the moment you arrive to the day you depart. We apologize if you were unaware of the valet only service and resort fees. For the guest‚Äôs convenience, we clearly state that we provide valet service only on our website. We also state all of the fees on our website as well as the confirmation e-mail so that guests are aware of the fees prior to making to their reservation. We hope that this did not pose an inconvenience to you in any way. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: I have stayed at this location many times and it is always a favorite.  Spectacular location with a great outside bar/patio. The sea side rooms have great ambiance with views of the oceans which is walkable via the state park.  Beds are amazingly comfortable although the king in room we were in last night was sagging on one side.   Lots of great restaurants in Dana Point, not walkable....
Manager Response: none

Summary: I was here for a work conference in November 2015. The staff were helpful but the hotel itself was a little strange. Why was there no toothpaste in the bathroom? Or no kettles for tea?  Pools were beautiful but being on the ground floor balcony I could hear a lot of noise coming out of the pool.  Probably a reflection of the area more than the hotel, but the restaurant and bars were closed quite early and it was hard for us to find somewhere to eat after coming out of our meetings.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize that you experienced some noise from the pool during your stay with us. We never want our guests to experience any inconveniences during their stay with us. In regards to the toothpaste, should you forget your toothpaste our At Your Service department would be more than happy to provide you with some. We also have a gift shop that sells toothpaste. We do not have kettles for tea but we do provide the hot water that our coffee machines provide, should you want to make yourself a cup of tea. Our OverVue lounge is open throughout the evening as is our room service should you want a late snack. Thank you again for your review. Your opinion is extremely important to us and we will be sharing your comments with our team.

Summary: I haven't written a review in quite a while and even though I do a very high volume of travel (overnight trips every two weeks on average), I hardly ever do write reviews.  While I gain insight from the reviews, it seems that most of the time whatever I am thinking about a certain property would just be repeating other good reviews after Trip Advisor has now been around for so long as such a terrific resource with so many reviews of properties.  I figure only if I have something different or unique to offer should I put something forward.  This might qualify!  This morning as I prepared to take a shower in the tub/shower combo, I noticed that the drain stopper was lowered all the way.  In order to prevent the tub from filling up I lifted up the drain stopper--and look what I
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We want to start off by apologizing for your findings and we want you to know that we have shared your review with our management team in order to correct this situation right away. We appreciate you bringing this to our attention as our housekeeping department is very thorough and clean and room inspections are done on a daily basis. Please know that this was definitely an exception and not the rule for Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort and Spa. We have already addressed this issue. We apologize for the inconvenience you experienced.

Summary: This resort is very nice and everyone was very friendly. The room was big and clean. Overall just a little bit missing for Five stars. We enjoyed to go for a run on the pacific coast and end up climbing the steps to the hotel. Nice view from the terrace and pool...
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and found the rooms to be large and clean. We are happy that you were able to take advantage of the beautiful weather and proximity to the beach. We appreciate your compliments regarding our staff service and we do hope that you visit us again in the near future, we'd love to welcome you back.

Summary Heading: Wonderful place....if you don't have drunk idiots next to you.
Summary: On our date night, my husband and I decided to be spontaneous, get out of the snow and book a room at the Marriott.  Our package included breakfast at the buffet.  As the parents of two small children, we were looking forward to having a little time alone and a night of uninterrupted sleep and it is a pretty rare occasion that we get a chance to have time with just the two of us.     The location of this hotel is great. Everyone we came into contact with when we arrived was very polite and friendly.  The room was clean, we had a great view of the pool and partial coastal view. I immediately felt guilty for not bringing our kids because they kids pool play area is awesome! We walked down to the harbor and got some lunch at one of the restaurants.  After coming back from our
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review.  Please allow us to sincerely apologize for the noise issues you endured due to discourteous guests in the next guestroom.  As you can imagine, it is our daily intent to ensure each guest‚Äôs stay is enjoyable, relaxing and a memorable experience and we are truly sorry this put a damper on your stay.  Noise levels must always be kept at an acceptable level throughout our resort and as you mentioned our Security team will promptly address any concerns.  We are glad to hear that our staff was apologetic and waived your parking fee as a gesture of goodwill.  We hope you and your husband will look upon this issue as an isolated incident and not the norm at our resort.  We appreciate your feedback and will be sure to share your constructive comments with our team.

Summary: The location of this hotel is amazing. The rooms are clean, but honestly nothing special. Our room was on the top floor so there was only a tiny window. There are two pools which is nice, but cause quite a bit of noise for the rooms directly around them (why we moved to room with tiny window). The beach is across the street but because of the cliffs it is a bit of a hike.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review Becca. We appreciate your compliments regarding our clean rooms and beautiful location. The resort is situated on the cliffs and still within walking distance of the marina and harbor. We hope that you enjoyed the little hike back up to the resort. We apologize that you had to switch rooms and we hope that your 4th floor room was to your liking. Thank you again for your review.

Summary Heading: One of my all time favorite hotels to visit....
Summary: I have stayed here several times, both for business and pleasure, and the view, the outstanding service, the VUE cafe, the valet parking, and the friendliness of all the staff never fail to disappoint. Well done.  The massage at the Spa was excellent and a perfect complement to our stay.  While not uncommon for resorts, the resort fees, expensive valet parking (no self park), and pricey breakfast buffet are a bit on the expensive side in my opinion.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you are a frequent guest of ours. We appreciate your loyalty and we thank you for your kind complements. We look forward to having you visit again.

Summary: Laguna cliffs Marriott My husband and I attended an event at the Marriott and thought it would be fun to spend the night. We booked quite a long time ahead so we were able to get a pretty good rate. We had a king size bed and a peek a boo ocean view . It was a beautiful room with a small sofa and a coffee table. The hotel is beautiful it sits up on a hill above Dana point which is really nice. Even thou we were not very far from home it felt like we were on vacation. Tip for the coffee maker: One thing I want to point out that wasn‚Äôt obvious to me but my husband was aware. On the in room coffeemaker, tea maker the filter that slides into the coffee maker is actually in the package with the coffee. I looked to make my husband coffee and I said the filter is missing so I thought
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review. We appreciate your feedback and will most certainly share them with our team.  We couldn't be happier that you combined business and leisure and enjoyed every minute of your stay with us. We are delighted to hear that you found the service to be impeccable and the food to be great. We hope that you and your husband visit us again whether it be for business or pleasure. We look forward to welcoming you back.

Summary: I've stayed at the Cliff twice and this latest stay was just a disaster. For starters, I was there on business. Therefore, of keen interest to me was internet, which shall we say was slower than dial up AOL services of the early 90s. Painful, however, was the front desks solution, to have IT come to my room and fix my PC. When I tried showing them how easy it is to calculate the WIFI speed in their building and demonstrate to them that something is wrong with their signal, there was no interest in doing so. In addition, the website did not say it is under MASSIVE construction. Beware the price you will find, as I did, is lower than usual given this construction project. Overall, not a very good stay, would def. not recommend if you're there on business
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are very surprised to hear that our internet was slow during your visit with us. We want you to know that this was definitely a glitch as most of our guests are very impressed with the fast speed of our interent. We want to address your statement regarding our "massive" construction. We are not sure if you are writing a review on the correct hotel site as we are not in the middle of any kind of renovation or construction. We ask that you kindly correct the review if you in fact do have the wrong resort. This resort is not under and kind of construction. Thank you again for your review.

Summary: We've stayed at this beautifully-situated hotel several times, and have found the staff friendly, helpful and always available. The location is perfect, overlooking Dana Point Harbor, but for us, it was the ambiance and comfort of our rooms, and care and attention of the staff that made our visits great.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that this your hotel of choice when visiting Dana Point, CA. Thank you for your kind compliments. We will be sure to share them with our team. We know that our entire staff truly cares about each guest's experience and we are happy to hear that you witnessed this every time you stay with us. We hope you find it in your travels to come back again. We'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: Booked through my travel agent at AAA & had expected to at least have a relaxing experience. First night as we pulled in, found out that they ONLY offer valet parking, no self-park. OK....so we tipped the valet and went in to check in to our room... later found out they ALSO charge $35 a night to park your car. What was I tipping the valet for? & was my car being parked on a plot of gold or oil field?  Went up to our room on the 4th floor; No complimentary Wi-Fi, you have to pay $10 a night or $15 if you want faster speed‚Ä¶. Around 10 PM we heard pounding & sheet rock being pulled down in the room next door, the same wall our bed was up against.  I had to call down 3 times to finally get them to stop. On the third call, I was told that they were simply doing maintenance,
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We regret that you did not have a good experience during your visit with us. Your comfort is extremely important to us and our intention is to never inconvenience you in any way. We apologize for the noise you heard from our maintenance team, repairing the heater.  We apologize if you were unaware of the valet only service and resort fees. For the guest‚Äôs convenience, we clearly state that we provide valet service only on our website. We also state all of the fees on our website as well as the confirmation e-mail. We hope that this did not pose an inconvenience to you in any way. Thank you again for your review.

Summary Heading: A Wonderful Staff Can't Save a Dissapointing Place
Summary: We were hoping this would be our new go-to hotel in the Dana Point area.  Sadly...this will not be the case.  With our last hotel...the St. Regis, under construction (also needed) , we decided to try the Marriott.  The price point is different than the Ritz or St. Regis so we were not expecting it to be at the same level.  That being said.....with the expensive valet only parking and it seems from other reviewers...the hated resort fee...it was no bargain.  We think it ended up being very overpriced for what you get.  Being fair...we were also in an off-season period so we didn't get to enjoy the pools or some of the property.  But since the hotel still charges these fees all year....we had issues with several aspects of this Marriott resort.  Staff isn't one of them. The valet
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice place but the fees get you
Summary: I booked three nights via an internet hotel discounter as the Marriott website had fixed prices. I saved almost 50% booking thru a third party.  The hotel is in a beautiful location and is very well laid out. The checkin was quick and friendly.  Our room was in a wing facing the ocean, what a view and a nice thing to wake up to! The bed was possibly the nicest bed I have ever slept on! I stay at a lot of Marriotts and this bed was sublime! The hotel robes were also a nice treat and were so comfortable we just lounged around in them.  We ordered room service late one night as we did not want to go thru the valet parking hassle (more later) and it was delivered quickly and was delicious. We ordered the grilled chicken sandwich with avocados  and the spinach artichoke dip. Yum! The
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice, Quiet Place In a Convenient Location
Summary: I stayed here after I had a bad feeling about another place I had booked.  I just showed up and they were able to get me room no problem and the service was exceptional at the front desk; they were very nice and professional.    The rooms were clean and standard for a four-star hotel.  The place is very large, looks like they must do conferences here.  When I was there, right after Labor Day, it was very quiet which was nice, but I imagine it gets busier at other times of the year.  The area around the hotel is very quiet, it's kind of set up on it's own little hill above Dana Point.  Not much going on around there to be honest, this is more of a suburban area.  There was a bar/restaurant on site and a couple you could easily walk to but nothing to write home about.   The hotel
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your compliments and we hope that were able to relax and enjoy the serenity of the resort. We do hope you visit us again in the future. We'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: Affordable room specials! Convenience with luxury. Great for a night get away! Be prepared to spend $900 with room, 1 spa treatment, valet, dinner and breakfast. Relaxing and scenic. Great for the overworked couple needing rest and pampering.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We hope you left feeling well rested and pampered. We appreciate your compliments and we hope you visit us again soon.

Summary: The hotel staff were all very welcoming. The 35 dollar valet parking is a drawback, as well as the cost of wifi. The main restaurant was closed which was unfortunate but we were pleased with the bar food. I would return to the hotel on points again, but would not pay full price.  I wish information in regards to activities the hotel had to offer was more accessible or offered at initial check in, ie, bike rentals.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We appreciate your feedback and apologize that you did not receive the list of all the amenities the resort has to offer upon check-in. We will be sure to discuss this with our team as this was most likely an oversite on our part. Thank you again for your review and we hope you do visit us again in the future.

Summary: I never spend the time writing reviews but based on my experience I'm writing this review while waiting for the wife to get ready. Room was dirty, beds broken down, carpet dirty, kids even commented that the employee's that worked here were rude to them. Charge you for everything not even a complementary cup of coffee for the road....25 dollar resort fee, 35 dollar parking fee, added to the already overpriced mini room. Back to the Blue Lantern Inn for me....that's the only place to stay around here for this kind of money.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize that you did not have a pleasant stay at our resort. Your opinion is extremely important to us and we will be sure to share your comments with our management team. Thank you again.

Summary Heading: Really really poor hotel - surprised by Marriott's bad quality
Summary: Extremely disappointed: - Restaurant was closed, was stuck with limited menu at the bar - Shower was pitiful, extremely weak water flow - There was a nasty draft coming through the bottom of the balcony door - Had a voicemail from a previous guest, 2 weeks ago, that was not cleared, took 3 phone calls to operator to get in cleared - wasted 5 minutes to stop both phones flashing red - Internet costs money
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We deeply regret that you did not have a good experience at the Resort and we want to take a moment to apologize for any inconvenience you experienced. Our ultimate goal is to always make our guests have a comfortable and pleasant stay. We hope you give Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort & Spa another chance in the future to restore your faith.

Summary: From the moment we arrived we were made very welcome. The only issue was that the main restaurant was closed during the week. The concierge referred us to a restaurant by the Marina which was superb. Nice pool area and lovely grounds.
Manager Response: none

Summary: LaGuna Cliffs in Dana Point is a beautiful property with a fabulous view.  Not worth the money, the rooms are nice, but not to the level they were in the past.  We had problems with HVAC, plumbing and noise.  The staff was very helpful, but the problems persisted.  Hope they can fix these issues, we might stay there again, but were disappointed in this trip.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I actually was here Feb 2014, but never submitted a review. I went as a couple but he also had business in Anaheim. I'll remember this trip for years to come. This place is so beautiful. The staff were so accommodating, the room we booked wasn't ready and there was also a conference the same week. They put us in a room and made us comfortable. The very next morning they took care of all the arrangements and moved us to an even better room and were very apologetic. Bar is wonderful, nachos excellent. I was relaxing in the cabana near out room and the staff asked if I needed anything and brought me food right to my cabana. The resort has everything you need and has a beautiful view of the ocean. The spa is very nice and the gym is relatively spacious with towels, water bottles,
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you not only enjoyed your stay with us for the second time but that we created new memories for you and your husband. Thank you for the wonderful compliments. We look forward to having your back and we too are counting down.

Summary: We booked this hotel last minute on our California trip and I could not have been more pleased.  What a beautiful hotel and the view is incredible.  The hotel was very busy with people checking in for the Rose bowl but it didnt feel crowded.  The hotel was decorated beautifully for christmas, outside and inside.  The view of the water from the hotel is breathtaking.  It was the first chance on our trip we had to relax and it was a wonderful stay.  They charge a resort fee that includes games/bikes/etc, we took out the bikes for a ride along the water, it was really nice and the weather was perfect.  There are also different restaurants within walking distance which was very convenient.  The rooms were also very nice with a balcony overlooking the water.  Would definitely stay at
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us and that you found some time to relax. We couldn't agree with you more, the views are breathtaking and truly picturesque. We cannot wait to welcome you back.

Summary: Had a 4 night stay during the 2016 Rose Bowl. Nice place. Rooms were good and the staff was fantastic. Our first night there the Iowa Hawkeyes were playing Michigan State in Basketball and they were able to get the Big Ten TV Network and show the game. Very nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted that you were our guest during the Rose Bowl. We appreciate your compliments and we hope you visit us again in the future.

Summary: We stayed here for a week and overall I would prefer other places in the area. It is a hotel, not really what I would call a resort.   We got food poisoning from a hamburger the first day, which started things a bit rough.....and made us nervous to eat there again!  Rooms are relatively small, but beds are comfortable. The place is clean.   Views are very nice. The staff is pleasant.   Mandatory valet is a drawback and time constraint, especially when going in and out several times a day.  It is tough to walk anywhere from this resort.   Had a massage at the spa, which started 15 minutes after the scheduled time and ended up costing 110$ more than advertised...for less than stellar services. And a tip of 20% is included in the bill.....Would not recommend the spa at all.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your comments regarding your recent stay at our resort.  We are very sorry to hear that you were not feeling well after dining in our restaurant and hope you had a speedy recovery.  Upon reviewing your feedback with our Food & Beverage Director, he confirmed that we did not have any reported food/dining issues during the timeframe you stayed with us and regrets that something did not agree with you.  Please be assured we take these issues very seriously and appreciate you bringing your concerns to our attention.

Summary: We stayed here in July 2015 during our California vacation; this was the third hotel on our trip.  We LOVED this hotel.  The location was great, could walk to dinners and shops, the views were phenomenal and the pools were the perfect way for us to end our trip.  Thank you!
Manager Response: none

Summary: At first I was only 95% crazy about this hotel.  BUT THEN the last night we were there, there was a huge power outage all over Dana Point.  It was completely dark as far as you could see.  It was as though the hotel (and the city's) generators had also gone out.  Pitch black.  All the guests seemed to be trying to get to their cars at the same time to get out to find an area with power.  The staff at this hotel stepped up like you would not believe to help people feel safe and calm.  The valets were pulling cars around in an orderly fashion.  Staff gave all the children in the hotel glow sticks.  There were employees in the stairwells with huge flashlights helping people up and down the stairs.  The staff seemed to multiply by 20 when the power went out.  They were everywhere
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. Your safety is of our upmost importance and we are delighted that you recognized the staff and their urgency to assist and make you feel at ease during the city wide power outage. Thank you for your kind comments. We will definitely share this with our team.

Summary Heading: Fabulous, Even for My High Standards!!
Summary: My husband thinks my standards are unrealistic, but I disagree.  However, I will admit that I am not easy to please.  My minimum requirement is that I have the same luxuries on vacation, as I do at home.  While I admit the very reasonable rate originally concerned me, the great reviews ultimately led to us booking this resort.  I'd like to start by saying...do not hesitate in staying here!  It was wonderful in every way!  The resort is beautifully perched on top of a hill.  The drive up is lovely and you're greeted by helpful valet.  The front desk staff is friendly and attentive and the room and bath are large and luxurious.  The beds are plush and super comfortable!  Our view was spectacular!!!  Overlooking the pool, boat harbor and ocean (room type: "partial ocean view").
Manager Response: Wow! Thank you for your 5 star review. We are so delighted to hear that we not only met your expectations but we exceeded it. We are happy to hear that you experienced the wonderful service of our staff. We couldn't be more pleased that we left you with great memories. We cannot wait to welcome you back.

Summary: My daughter and I enjoyed our stay during the holidays! There were lovely decorations and friendly staff. We ordered room service several times, and it was prompt and delicious each time.  Accommodations were top notch, and we felt pampered the entire stay. Spa massages were amazing!!  We had a partial ocean view, but resort was further from the beach than we expected.
Manager Response: Thank you for choosing our resort for your holiday getaway!  We're delighted to hear that you and your daughter enjoyed our Christmas decor as well as the services and accommodations our team provided.  We truly appreciate your kind feedback and we'll look forward to welcoming you back to Dana Point soon!

Summary Heading: Beautiful rooms and the service is beyond amazing!
Summary: I was a little disappointed at first how far away the beach is (I originally wanted to stay at a beach front hotel, but got this hotel for one night instead), but I was pleasantly surprised at how beautiful the grounds and the rooms were. Next time I will definitely use the spa - I had a wonderful experience shopping there and they have amazing products; and the front desk employee (can't remember his name!) helped my friend out by finding lavender essential oil. The service was beyond amazing and everyone was incredibly helpful and accommodating. Keep in mind that you do have to pay a resort fee and valet parking is the only option, but honestly, it was kind of nice to be pampered for a couple days.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review.  We're sorry to hear you were disappointed due to our resort's distance from the beach.  We are located on a Cliff overlooking the Pacific Ocean and it is about a 5-minute walk to the beach.  However, we're thrilled to hear you were pleasantly surprised by our resort's grounds as well as our guestrooms.  Our Spa Laguna Cliffs is a wonderful treat and we hope you'll be able to take advantage of some of their services during your next stay with us.  Thank you again for your feedback.

Summary: We stayed here for a couple of days while our house was tented for termites. That staff was very accommodating and the room was very comfortable, with a great mattress and perfect down pillows (even though I brought my pillow from home, I didn't need it) we slept very well. Drinks in the bar were great as was room service.
Manager Response: Thank you for the wonderful compliment!  Our staff is happy to go the extra mile to make you feel right at home. We hope you'll visit with us again soon.

Summary: My family recently stayed at this hotel and we were very impressed.  You immediately relax when you enter the lobby.  Wide and open with ocean breezes.  Beautiful location, clean large rooms, great breakfast and dinner.  New chef.  Resort offers bikes, surf boards, yoga and matts, ping pong, etc.  Staff was wonderful and attentive across the hotel.  Bar and lounge are large, roomy and nice TVs for games.  The rate was affordable considering the hotel and location.  Families and kids running around.  Tough to beat.  We will go back.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for sharing your experience as well as your kind words about our staff! We are pleased to hear that you enjoyed many of our resort's amenities and will look forward to welcoming you back soon!

Summary: My husband and I wanted a night away to rest and rejuvenate and Laguna Cliffs Marriot was the PERFECT place.  From the moment you drive up to the hotel and check in with the valet service to the end of your stay at check out (and everything in between - room, view, pool, spa, etc.) was excellent!  Additionally, Marriot partners with Chart House restaurant for referrals, so if you make a reservation through the hotel the restaurant will give you a free appetizer or dessert.  Lastly, I am an Active Duty Naval Officer, and was blessed for my service by the Marriot staff by not being charged the resort fee or valet service.  I don't know if this is customary and I certainly am not encouraging this expectation by patrons but I personally appreciated the very generous gesture.  I
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you and your husband had a wonderful getaway at the resort. We are so happy that you left feeling rejuvinated and refreshed. We hope you visit us again in the future. We'd love to welcome you back.

Summary: Convenient, but in a secluded location, in the heart of Dana Point, the Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort was a great find on a recent visit. Up on a hill, it has an expansive view overlooking the Pacific Ocean. From our balcony, we could see the coastline toward San Clemente. In the evening, we took a walk on the grounds of the resort, admiring the colorful rays of the sun as it set into the ocean. The room was spacious and comfortable with well chosen art on the walls. We also enjoyed drinks followed by dinner in the OverVue Lounge (the Vue Restaurant was closed). All in all a very enjoyable and relaxing stay. We look forward to our next visit!
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review and all the wonderful compliments. We are delighted that we made your trip a memorable one. We hope you visit us in the future for another enjoyable and relaxing stay. See you soon.

Summary: We stayed there as a family and enjoyed every moment of our time spent there. The room are nice and spacious, beds are extremely confortable. The bar has an amazing view on the ocean and is perfect to watch a sunset. We also liked the pool and its view on the ocean. The hotel is at a walkable distance from the beach and from other restaurants. I hope to go back in this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the comfortable beds and spacious guest rooms. We appreciate all of your wonderful compliments and we hope you do visit us again in the future. We'd love to have you back.

Summary: it's well worth the money, the staff and valet workers made the experience awesome.  They found out we had a bday girl turning 9 and decorated the room as a surprise for her. The facilities were incredible and everyone was absolutely friendly and helpful.  I am going back for sure with family was there 6 nights and staff made it feel like we were staying with family in a great way
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We are happy that we were able to create a wonderful and memorable birthday and experience for you and your guests. We are happy to hear that we could become your home away from home. We look forward to having you all back.

Summary: After reading reviews about the cost of rooms at the hotel, i was pleasantly surprised to find that the cost was comparable to other hotels in the area. It is also one of the few hotels where the resort fee actually gave you something. i cannot remember everything but know that it included 2 bikes for 2 hours, day long use of a surfboard, day long use of a boogie board and bocce ball. The only negative i would have is that you do not really have a choice when parking. it costs.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This resort perched on the cliffs above Dana Point Harbor is just okay. The whole resort appears slightly dated. The rooms need some updating. Parking is valet only at a whopping $35 per day. The food at the restaurant is just okay. It is very difficult to walk down to the beach/harbor or to any nearby restaurants. On the plus side, the rooms are big and so are the bathrooms. The bar area is really nice with nice outdoor seating with great views. The resort staff are very friendly and helpful and the Wi-Fi is good.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the resort views and guest rooms. We appreciate your compliments regarding our friendly staff. We want to thank you for your feedback as your review and opinion is extremely important to us. We will be sure to share your comments with our team.

Summary Heading: Nice location, rooms are ok, busy place
Summary: Hotel is large with big events almost every night. Good location to walk to harbor for dinner or to jog/walks. Lovely pool, always empty when we were there. Fitness room is good. Coastal view rooms are nice but some are a bit angled and not direct. Be aware you will pay for parking, resort fee and wifi. This can add up to $75. Onto your nightly price!  Employees are very helpful and friendly. Valet parking worked smoothly car was there when  we asked.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel was very pretty. Walking around was nice. Expensive but nice breakfast buffet. Lovely to eat breakfast outside.  Nice walk at the top. If you stay there, spend time leisurely walking around and enjoying the views. Hotel is expensive. Ask for an upgrade when you get there.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing Views, Gorgeous Lobby, Excellent Staff!!!
Summary: I am so excited to write about this property! We stayed over mother's day weekend and the staff was courteous and friendly from the beginning!  At check in I was told of the resort fee and parking fee (which I had read about before booking the room).  I was okay with both.  I never had to worry about finding a parking spot because valet was always available to park my car for me! I also didn't have to go wait in line at some rental place to rent bicycles because the bellman were able to easily check them out to me!  We even got to brush up on our tennis skills at their full size tennis courts!  The bar is gorgeous, with full ocean views.  Both of the pools on property also have full ocean views!!  Overall our stay was amazing! Thank you to all the staff for all of your wonderful
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here for a one night conference (Fri night).  Entrance to the resort is a little confusing, but once at the entrance, there is an individual that directs you to check-in.  Valet service was not in line with higher end resorts, i.e. Ritz Carlton - the young valet personnel drove away when my trunk was opened and I was trying to retrieve something.  Check-in was a breeze - the hotel lobby/bar/check - in area were beautiful.  We had a room on the same level as the lobby and nearby the ballrooms - The walls are very thin, so check to be sure that there are no events going on or get a room on a higher level.  We could hear everyone walking up and down the hallway.  The room was average.  Bed was comfortable, but there was some sort of mattress pad on the bed - perhaps the bed
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We want to apologize that your valet experience was not up to your standards. Please know this was definitely an exception and not the norm for the resort.  We do want to inform you that we have many children activities including complimentary rental of bikes, boogie boards, surf boards, board games, etc. that are all included in the resort fee. During the summer months we also have an extensive children's program, including a Kid's Club and complimentary movie nights. As for couples we definitely would recommend trying the couple's massage at our spa. Again, we appreciate your feedback and we hope you visit us again in the future.

Summary: Came down to play at a wedding at the Dana Point Yacht Club. Decided to spend the night at this hotel. Great location, walking distance to the harbour, and very close to many of the restaurants in town. Grounds, pool, and amenities are great, but the best feature of this resort is the staff. Everyone we met was courteous, kind, friendly and warm. Will definitely come back!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you stayed with us after a wedding you attended. We can't wait to welcome you back.

Summary: I stayed there a few days over Halloween weekend.  But before arriving, I tried to email the hotel to get some information with no reply.  They do not offer any transportation options from LAX and did not reply about my request for an early check in either.    The property is beautifully located, but if you don't drive, there is really no way to get around.  We got a room on the ground floor with pool views.  However, the music they played at the pool was really loud and did not turn off until we called to request them to turn it off after midnight.  Overall, the hotel is beautiful, but needs to improve its service.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize that you e-mailed us and no one replied. If you could be so kind and let us know where you sent the e-mail we could look into this and be sure that this oversight does not happen again. Our staff is extremely attentive and we want you to know that this was definitely an oversight on our end. We are happy to hear that you found the location to be beautiful and we do hope you find it in your travels to stay with us again in the future.

Summary Heading: Best location for views and sight-seeing on the ocean!! A+++++
Summary: I stayed here on business, it is easily walkable to the local CVS and grocery store 3 blocks (up hill) away.  I came without a car, and check-in was a breeze!  The room had a lovely ocean view, and was your classic/comfy Marriott.  I appreciate that the rooms are wonderful/stocked/crisp sheets with newer room/d√©cor.  The staff was friendly, the convenience store was pleasantly full of goodies and snacks, and they have a restaurant with expansive views!  I ate outside at the restaurant, I had a lovely meal, wine, watched the GORGEOUS view and all the yogi's (100 of them!) doing Pilates/yoga on the (public) lawn out front at dusk.  I took a long walk the first night to the East, down near the marina.  There is a beautiful boardwalk. (There's several restaurants to choose from by
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We appreciate your detailed review and we couldn't be more happier to hear how lovely your stay was at Laguna Cliffs. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Ocean Views From Most Rooms
Summary: Stayed here for 1 night in November 2015 for a business meeting. The rooms are large with really comfortable beds.  The only parking option is to valet or park out on the city street at the bottom of their driveway.  The bar next to the reception area is great with a large outdoor seating area with views of the ocean.  There are numerous seafood restaurants near the hotel at the bottom of the hill in the marina area.  Our group of 50 people had a very nice catered lunch on the large grass (artificial) in front of the hotel. The 3 story hotel has 2 swimming pools that go with each wing of the hotel.  There are numerous meeting rooms that many different groups were using.  Overall this is a very nice hotel for business or pleasure.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a wonderful resort with fantastic views of the pacific ocean! Driving up the hill to the hotel you notice that the resort looks like it was modeled after the famous Hotel del Coronado in San Diego. My room was very cosy with a mini-bar and nice partial Oceanview. I will say that my room was a long walk from the main lobby. We had a cocktail and a bite to eat at the hotel bar/lounge with it's amazing views of the ocean from the patio. I had a decadent burger and my friend enjoyed a delicious rib-eye steak on a bed of fries. One thing to note is that hotel is in Dana Point and not even close to Laguna beach which is about 9 miles away, a little confusing. Across from the hotel is a great marina area with lots of shops and restaurants. Room service breakfast was
Manager Response: none

Summary: A couple of weeks ago, I attended a conference at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort and Spa.  We couldn't have asked for a better location.  The view from the deck was stunning while looking out over the Pacific.  I had originally thought we would were going to be very remote, but luckily, we could walk down to the Harbor area easily.  They had lots of great restaurants with seafood available.  The meeting space was spacious and fit our group nicely.  And the rooms were not that far away from the conference room, which was an excellent plus.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you found a winning conference hotel for your meeting! We are happy to hear that everything ran smoothly and that your meeting was a success. We appreciate your compliments and look forward to your next arrival.

Summary: Just love the location of this resort, my husband and I have stayed here several times over the years. Lovely rooms with great views if you get an ocean view and a balcony, nice clean well equipped rooms. You can walk down to Dana Point Harbor via a large number of steps where you will find a pretty harbor with restaurants and shops. Grounds are nice, hotel has two wings with an outdoor pool in each wing. Good reataurant with lovely outside patio. The only drawback I see are the resort and parking fees which if you are staying for a few days can really add to your final bill, there is nowhere else to park so if you have a car you cannot avoid these fees.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. Thank you for your compliments and we do hope you and your husband visit us again in the future.

Summary: Thisplace is perched atop a cliff in Dana Point. Gorgeous views and nice clean rooms. You can also ride their nice bikes around Dana Point if you can make it back up the steep hill. They need to redo their pricing, as $60 in daily fees and parking is exhorbant.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice property - rooms quiet and large
Summary: This is a fine representative of the Marriott brand - the everyone was helpful and friendly.  Valet parking is easy and fast.  The checkin was great.  The room was nice sized with ample electrical outlets for the electronics I brought for work.  The sleep quality was very good and the room was quiet.  I ordered room service for dinner and it arrived quickly and just as I ordered it. Bathroom clean and nicely appointed.  I was here for a meeting so it was a fine location.  The pool looked terrific but there was no time for that on my business trip - we had two lunches catered by the hotel and both were really fantastic - the meeting room help was efficient and accessible.  Good choice.
Manager Response: We appreciate your compliments and thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed the catered lunches and we hope your business meeting was a success. We look forward to welcoming you back for business and/or pleasure.

Summary Heading: Pay attention to the hidden fees!
Summary: The quality of this hotel and spa is undermined by its approach to mandatory fees which are not spelled out at the time of booking.  Upon check-in I was informed of the mandatory "resort fee" of $25.00 per day and presented a list of what it included.  This list is as follows:  High Speed wireless internet, Yoga Mats, Surfboards, Boogie Boards, Table Tennis, Bocce Ball, Frisbee, 2 Bicycles for up to two hours, Shoe Shine service, Tennis and Board Games.  No matter if you do not intend to use any of these, you are charged just the same. And most of these items would be provided free to the guest at most hotels I have stayed in.  One may ask why "lobby access" isn't on the list but then one would be probably be told, "Oh that comes with the regular room rate!"  In addition, the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We do notify all of our guests of both our resort fee and parking fees prior to booking on all of our websites and confirmation e-mail. Your opinion is very important to us and we make sure we clearly communicate all fees to our guests so there are no surprises. We regret that you did not read these fees on the sites.

Summary: It all started with the check in. Three of us had booked one night here while on a golf trip around the area. Checked in at about 4pm and were leaving the next morning at 7:30. The receptionist informed us of a "resort fee" of $25 which we kindly denied as it was not mentioned when we booked the rooms and , in fact, we would not be using any services (the list of resort services includes bicycles and board games!). We argued the charge but finally had to surrender.  In the morning I found another charge on my bill for $35 valet parking. I understood but thought the $35 was a bit high for Dana Point. When I asked where the Self park was the receptionist told me they "don't have a self parking area but I was welcome to park in the street, around the block or down by the port and
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We notify all of our guests of both our resort fee and parking fees on all of our websites and confirmation e-mail. Your opinion is very important to us and we make sure we clearly communicate all fees to our guests so there are no surprises. We also state that we are a valet only resort. We do have tennis courts on our property, a spa, two outdoor pools and nearby golfing. We also are within walking distance of the beach and we hope you were able to take advantage of these activities during your stay with us.

Summary: I booked this hotel at a $179 nightly rate. I admit the fine print mentioned there was a resort fee, but I didn't notice it. When I checked in, I learned that the resort fee was $25 and it was not optional. Also not optional was the $35 valet parking fee. Both are charged for each night's stay. So, my $179 room was actually a $239 room. Had I known, I would have stayed elsewhere.Complaints to the front desk fell on deaf ears. Simple honesty would be a big improvement over this devious policy.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. As you mentioned in your comments, we do notify all of our guests of both our resort fee and parking fees. We clearly state these fees on our website and confirmation e-mail so our guests are aware of all the fees prior to booking. Your opinion is very important to us and we make sure we clearly communicate all fees to our guests so there are no surprises.

Summary: This hotel is well-kept and in a great spot overlooking the harbor in Dana Point. The rooms are comfortable and what you expect from a Marriott property. The pool is what we enjoyed the most. It seemed secluded and quiet despite the location between hotel wings. The food was the only thing that didn't impress. It was good but not great. Overall a perfect hotel for the price.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The good: - Absolutely beautiful setting  - convenient location to restaurants, shops, interstate, etc - Friendly front desk and valet staff - Very nice room and upgrade (Platinum status)  The bad: - Lobby area and bar were so warm we couldn't stay.  Not sure if the A/C was broken, but it was very uncomfortable   - No pool service on Sunday or weekdays.   We enjoyed the pool area on Saturday and Grant took great care of us.  Was surprised on Sunday when there was a small sign at the pool bar saying to call in room service orders.   This would have been helpful to know before loading up 3 kids for lunch at the pool!  I don't appreciate paying service charges and delivery fees each time we want a drink, kids smoothie, etc  - We switched rooms after night 1, since they were able to
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We do appreciate your compliments regarding our friendly staff and beautiful resort. We do want to take a moment and apologize for the inconvenience you experienced during your stay with us. We want our guests to always feel comfortable when staying with us and we believe that we didn't provide that for you during your stay. Meetings do take place at this hotel and all guests are aware that the resort has families and business travelers that stay with us. We apologize that you found it awkward to walk through the hallway to get to your room.  We wanted to also address the pool service during your stay. Our in-room dining team is available for your convenience while you are visiting our pools. You can purchase anything from the menu and the will be happy to deliver it to you.  Your opinion is very important to us and we will be sure to address your comments with our team. We do hope that you and your family visit us again in the future.

Summary: We were travelling with another couple and celebrating a birthday so wanted something special. Both rooms were booked using Marriott points.  Our friends had been upgraded to an ocean view but the room had no balcony. Our room was ground floor, near one of the pools and had a lovely tucked away patio with chairs and water feature so we thought much better.  Our room was huge and very comfortable. We do notice though there was nothing to sit on apart from the bed.  We had drinks and dinner on the terrace which was very nice. There was also live music.  Breakfast was excellent and a delight to sit out on the terrace. One of the best hotel breakfasts I've had. We also were given complimentary vouchers on check in which made it even better.  We spent some time by the pool before
Manager Response: We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your compliments and we look forward to having you back in the future.

Summary: This was our first time at the hotel and we have been to the Ritz in Dana Point.  Given the price, this is a much better value.  Our room was nicely sized with a king bed and we were able to get a room with a partial view of the ocean (would have preferred an ocean view room but it was fine).  The room and bathroom were very clean.  I would suggest that they change the unadjustable shower nozzle.  It was extremely hot over the weekend so we used the A.C to the max and the room was very comfortable.  The pool area is very nice and there is a separate pool area for children.  We really liked the patio outside the bar- the drinks were delicious. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly - especially the valets and the pool attendant (forgot to get his name but he was so
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your first stay with us. We appreciate your compliments regarding our staff service and we will also share your feedback with our team. The complimentary WiFi is included in the resort fee. We hope you visit us again the next time you visit Orange County.

Summary: This is a great place to stay.  The rooms are really nice and you can open the windows for a sea breeze.   You can do a walk down the cliff via a walkway and get a nice work out just doing that both ways.  It overlooks a marina with some really good seafood restaurants.   My only complaint is having to leave!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Quality Family Hotel With Lots to Offer
Summary: The hotel and staff were great.  You pay a reasonable price for the location, amenities, and accomodations. The hotel was renovated four years ago but everything still holds up. The staff was flexible with us changing rooms. We stayed with our two children and they enjoyed the bocci ball, tennis, kids pool, and large open space to run around between the hotel and the beach.  I enjoyed being able to use their surf boards and boogie boards. I would recommend not going to Doheny but going a bit down the road to the Strand - which is beautiful, not crowded and has free parking.
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review. We are dlighted that you and your family enjoyed your stay with us. We couldn't be happier to hear that everyone in the family participated in an activity at or near the resort. We appreciate your compliments and do hope that you visit us again in the future. We'd love to welcome you all back.

Summary: I have been a loyal Marriott customer for 15 years staying at their properties for both business and pleasure. Over the last fives I have noticed a horrible trend that they learned from the airlines. You want to park? $35 dollars a night. You want to stay on the property? $25 resort fee. You want to use the internet? $15.  It is ridiculous how little the staff cares about the customer at this location. I booked a two night get away weekend for my wife and I only to wait in line for 20 minutes to get checked in. I had to chase a valet down even though I was paying him $35 a night to park. Bell hops were no where to be found. After getting into the room we learned that we were staying in the adjoining room to the "wedding suite." We learned this fact first hand at 6 a.m. when 15
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback and apologize for the inconvenience of waiting for your vehicle to arrive. During a sold out weekend, our valet staff works very efficiently to try and retrieve the vehicles in a timely manner but we appreciate your patience as on occasion there is a wait time. Unfortunately, we cannot predict if the guests next door to you will be loud and we definitely respect the noise level and will address it when brought to our attention. Our goal is to provide a pleasant and quiet experience for all of our guests. If occupancy permitted, we would have been more than happy to have switched your room for you. We appreciate your feedback regarding our parking and resort fee rates and will certainly take your comments under review.  In recent parking and resort fee surveys we‚Äôve conducted with our fellow resorts located on the coastline, we have found our parking and resort fee rates to be in line and are actually the most economical.

Summary Heading: The Best Vacation of My Life
Summary: My wife and I wanted a special place to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary.  After scheduling a trip to Florida and then seeing that it would be raining for our whole vacation, I made a last minute switch and booked a 4 night stay at Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort and Spa.   That decision was among the best I have ever made.  I am a frequent business traveler and we often stay in hotels together; none have come close to the quality and service we received at Laguna Cliffs.  The food in their casual restaurant was spectacular.  Their more formal (but still casual) restaurant was superb.  Every morning we got our coffee prepared in the informal bar area by Eduardo - he remembered our favorites and our names quickly.  The view from the outdoor patio is breathtaking -- sweeping
Manager Response: Thank you for your 5 star review and for celebrating your 15th anniversary with us! We couldn't be more delighted to hear that we made you feel right at home and that our staff was able to make your trip special. We apprecite all of your compliments and look forward to welcoming you both back. We are happy that your last minute decision created a memorable 15th anniversary for you and your wife. We look forward to having you both back.

Summary: Nice facilities. Staff is welcoming. Restaurant menu is a little disappointing. Limited choices and items are prepared ok. The rooms are large, clean and nice. View from bar is beautiful. The lobby is pretty cool.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay with us. We appreciate your feedback and will certainly share your comments with our team. We hope to see you again in the future.

Summary: Spent 3 days at a conference at this hotel.  Great Staff and the food was done very well.  Location provides a great overlook of the ocean with shopping and restraunts within a short walking distance.  There are two pools but you can also walk to the beach which is close.Good level of security.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We are delighted to hear that you enjoyed your stay wtih us. We hope your business trip was successful. We look forward to having you back for business or pleasure the next time you are in Orange County.

Summary Heading: Beware of 3rd Floor rooms, no balconies, only small windows
Summary: I wish I had read some of the other reviews more carefully. My Marriott profile has my preference set as "high" floor and we booked a partial ocean view. So like other reviewers we were on the 3rd with small windows that look at the ocean. I can't believe I paid for THAT. In addition, it was a corner room which was SOOOO small. I actually starting crying when I walked in. The next day was my 50th birthday and I was so disappointed that this was what I was going to wake up to, but we were only going to be there 1 night and were rushing to make our dinner reservations so we just dealt with it. I've never booked a room with ocean view and not had a patio that you sit out to enjoy the ocean view.   Other than that, the staff was very nice, the food was great, the bar/restaurant is
Manager Response: Thank you for your review. We apologize that your room was not to your liking. We never want our guests to leave dissapointed or unhappy and we hope that you attempted to switch rooms. If we have availability, our staff would be more than happy to change your guest room. We appreciate your compliments regarding our staff and food and we do hope that you give us another chance in the future.

Summary: I stayed at this property in May with a friend and loved it so much, that I brought my husband back for a long weekend. The views are just beautiful looking out over Dana Point Harbor and the hotel itself is very nice, but we found the staff to be awesome. From the valets, bellmen to the roo service staff and front desk, we were met with smiles and great hospitality at every turn! We will definitely be back!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great views - just average resort - AC didn't work properly
Summary: I have read through past reviews and while there are a number of positive reviews, there are also a number of negative ones and I think it all comes down to past travel experience and expectations. I think if you don't travel a lot and/or usually stay at budget to mid-range accommodations you will think this place is great. If, however, you travel a lot, frequently stay at higher end properties and/or are a Marriott Gold member who has stayed at some of their nicer properties - other than the views - you will not be impressed. We fall into that category.   First - the location is atop a cliff with gorgeous views of the ocean. It's also set right next to a park and a short 5-minute walk from the Dana Point marina with some shops and restaurants, and where you can catch the boat
Manager Response: Thank you for your detailed review. We appreciate your feedback and we truly apologize for the inconvenience you experienced with your AC. Our goal is to provide a comfortable, home away from home experience and we apologize that we did not. We will definitely share your comments with our management team.
