Our goal is to make every guest leave with a lasting impression.   The location is perfect for taking walks or hikes with views of the Pacific Ocean. The harbor is a great place to just relax and breathe in the fresh air or to browse the little shops and restaurants along the water.   We are thrilled that you were able to lounge by the pool in one of our cabanas and enjoy the poolside service we extend to all of our guests.   Thank you for taking the time to share the details of your stay and we look forward to welcoming you back on your next visit to our great city!

Summary: love this hotel cant say enough about  the staff they bent over backwards to make our stay great, planned a last minute birthday getaway for my husband & the hotel tookcare of all the details.
Manager Response: We are very excited that we could make your husband‚Äôs birthday memorable. Our staff does an amazing job at making every guest feel welcomed. We are at your service any time of day. We hope you come back to visit.

Summary Heading: Amazing hotel and you get what you pay for.
Summary: What an excellent, excellent experience.  My wife and I checked in on Christmas Eve and when we got to our room, they had the radio in the room set to the station playing Christmas Music.  We enjoyed almost every moment at the resort.  We got an upgrade to an ocean view room with a balcony for being Marriott Rewards members, and got to enjoy sunsets from our balcony on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day.  Wow. The breakfast and room service selections were excellent and decently priced.  If given the chance, I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Wow! Thank you for the wonderful comments. We are very happy to hear that you and your wife had a wonderful time staying at our resort on Christmas Eve. We are thrilled that you both were able to upgrade to an ocean view room. I know the views are breathtaking. We are delighted that you were able to taste the wonderful selection of breakfast items at the Vue Restaurant. We hope to see you both again real soon.

Summary: I stayed in this hotel on a Friday. When we arrived at Noon, we were upgraded and we were given a room right then with no waiting. Katie at the front desk was extremely nice. She gave us an upgrade because of my husband's Marriott gold status. We were given a room with an ocean view. We also had a view of the Vue bar. After checking in, we walked down to the wharf and looked at all of the beautiful boats. After our walk we went to the wind and sea restaurant and enjoyed their Hawaiian happy hour and delicious drinks. The Hawaiian happy hour was great because you can sit outside by the fire pit from 4:00 pm to 7:00 pm and enjoy their happy hour prices. After happy hour, we walked back to the hotel and listened  to live music in the Vue bar. It was cozy. When it was time for bed,
Manager Response: none

Summary: My boyfriend and i have stayed here a couple times and we had an absolute blast. The property sits on a cliff overlooking the ocean- doesn't get better than that!
Manager Response: We are so glad that you and your boyfriend enjoyed your time at the resort. We hope to see you again very soon.

Summary: Nice clean room overlooking the water.  This property offers a friendly staff and clean rooms.  Nothing out of the ordinary - you know what to expect with Marriott.  What could have been better is if the staff did something to make the experience just a little bit different.    All in all grounds are kept well, rooms are clean, staff is helpful - food was marginal.  Business trip - would stay again.  Just nothing that made this trip any different than any other one.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We regret we did not "Wow" you on your stay. Our job is to give exceptional service and make your stay as enjoyable as we can. We hope that on your next visit we can provide you with the "out of the ordinary" experience you are looking for.

Summary: This is a great resort on the cliffs above the Marina in Laguna Beach.  We were able to get the room for $110 a night on priceline and with a family of 5 we recieved a complimentary roll-away bed which was very comfortable.  Our stay was in late October and we had the resort almost entirely to ourselves.  My 2 youngest and I spent about 6 hours a day at the pool and only had company for maybe 1 hour each day.  Everything you could possibly need is within walking distance including a supermarket just down the street.  The service and staff were very good and the views from the pool area and restaurant/bar were incredible. The only real draw back was parking at $29 each day...  Having the car running and ready everytime you walk down to go somewhwere was a nic benefit.
Manager Response: Wow...thank you for your wonderful compliments. We are so happy that we were able to create a memorable trip for you and your family. We hope your children were able to experience our new Kid's Splash Zone during your stay and in the summer months we have a great kid's club for children too. We are looking forward in seeing all of you soon!

Summary Heading: Okay but Beware the Valet Parking
Summary: I've stayed here twice on business and it is certainly a nice hotel with comfortable rooms and good amenities.  But the first time I stayed, parking was free, and now they have mandatory valet parking for $29 a day!  It just seems to me to be an unnecessary ripoff that spoiled an otherwise pleasant stay.  Our conference room on the most recent stay was excellent with fixed curved tables in a tiered arrangement, focusing on the presenter.  But another meeting next door had a rock band playing in the afternoon and the sound easily penetrated two walls to become an annoyance during our presentations and discussions.  One last item is that the TV in the room had only a limited number of cable channels, something I don't expect for this level hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments. We are very happy to hear that you enjoyed the comfort of our guest rooms and the amenities our resort has to offer. We are glad that the set- up of the meeting room was to your liking. We are very pleased to hear that.    We apologize for any noise that disrupted your meeting. Please feel free to alert a staff member whenever you have these issues. We will be more than happy to assist you.  We appreciate your feedback regarding our parking fees. In recent parking surveys we‚Äôve conducted with our fellow resorts located on the coastline, we have found our parking rates to be in line and are actually the most economical.    You also mentioned the limited number of cable channels. We provide over 70 cable channels and we hope that you were able to view all of these channels. Again, please do not hesitate to contact our "At Your Service" department for any issues you may experience during your stay.   Thank you again for your comments.

Summary Heading: Fantastic Visit from start to finish
Summary: I cannot say enough about this property-- everything about my visit last week was wonderful, especially the staff.  Everyone from the bellman to the front desk to the restaurant staff went out of their way to make my stay great. Rooms are comfortable and large, views are unbelievable, and restaurants and bars are perfect for unwinding and relaxing.  I recommend talking with the bellman and renting a bike for $10/hr from the hotel.  The area around the resort is breathtaking and it is worth taking an hour to ride down the hill to the beach and harbor.    Other notes: -Great workout room with plenty of equipment and cardio area -Breakfast buffet in VUE was wonderful -Good concierge staff.. gave us great dining advice
Manager Response: We are pleased to hear that you had such a wonderful stay at the resort. We are very excited that you were able to enjoy the newly renovated fitness center and that you were able to rent a bike and ride it along the beach and Dana Point Harbor. The resort is just walking distance from the beach and we do have a view that allows you to watch the beautiful sunsets right from you room.   Thank you for your comments. We hope to see you back real soon.

Summary Heading: I wanted to stay here for my wedding
Summary: This is the first time I have ever written a review. I have stayed at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott five times for corporate events. This resort had a special place in my heart because I had my first date at the with my husband to be at a Christmas party for his company. The hotel is beautiful, the location is breathtaking, the customer service was luke warm, but am not one to complain. I have always considered this location for my very large group of family and friends to stay for our wedding festivities. The wedding planner said to stay away from the Laguna Cliffs Marriott, but I had my mind set.Over the course of our engagement I made numerous attempts to meet with someone in person to check out the suites and block a number of rooms for our event. Each person I spoke to gave me
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback. We apologize for the unsatisfactory service you received. Our job is not only to meet the guest‚Äôs expectations but to exceed them. We value your opinion and comments greatly and we take every review seriously. I want you to know that we will be addressing your concerns with our team.   We thank you for your loyalty to our property and we recognize that this resort held a special place in your heart. We want to continue to create those beautiful memories for you and your fianc√©.   We do give all brides and grooms who are having their wedding at the resort exclusivity to the grounds of the property. We do this so that we can ensure all brides and grooms have the ability to photograph anywhere at any time with no interference. For that reason we mention our photography fee upfront so there are no surprises.   As far as reserving all rooms on one level, we always provide the room types that are requested (i.e., pool view, ocean view, etc.) for our guests but we cannot guarantee the same floor due to the unknown factors of  our other guests staying at the resort (i.e., extending their stay).   Thank you again for your feedback.

Summary Heading: Beautiful surroundings, but bring a fan!
Summary: This is our 4th stay at this hotel.  We love the grounds, view, and the harbor below for morning walks and our coffee and breakfast bagel outside in the sun.  You couldn't ask for a more beautiful setting.  However, since the renovation a few things have changed.  One is the valet parking which costs $29/day. Everytime you want to take your car out for sightseeing or to go to dinner you must wait for your car to be brought to you (and tip the poor guys who run like crazy to accommodate you).  In the past, you could walk to the garage to retrieve your car and check out at the booth at the entrance to the garage.   The other change since the renovation is the air conditioning system.  In the past, we have been able to turn the heat down at night and sleep comfortably in a cool
Manager Response: Thank you for your wonderful feedback. We take every review seriously and we wanted to apologize for any inconvenience the temperature in the room may have brought to you. We are very happy that you have stayed with us multiple times and we'd like to see you again in the future. Please feel free to contact "At Your Service" anytime you need anything. They are available 24 hours a day and will be more than happy to provide a fan for you if the temperature in your room is not to your liking.    Thank you again for taking the time to share your comments. We hope to see you again on your next vacation.

Summary Heading: Great spot on your way to Catalina.
Summary: Our room was clean, well appointed and we had a balcony overlooking the bay. The personnel  were very accommodating - especially the driver at guest services who took us up and down the hill a dozen times, suggested great restaurants and told us about local lore during our short drive. There is an old "Woody" station wagon sitting in the courtyard - very cool. Breakfast was very good with the usual omelet station and excellent baked goods. I can't tell you how the hotel dinner fare is as we went to the marina every evening for dinner. The hotel is well located for excursions to Capistrano and San Clemente. We enjoyed our stay and if I am on my way to Catalina in the future I would certainly return.
Manager Response: We can not wait to welcome you back for another WOW experience! We create WOW experiences for our guests every day! Thank you for your review.

Summary: We stayed at this Hotel the last week of December 2011, what a way to end the year!  We have stayed in Dana Point many times before but never at this location and we now know what we‚Äôve been missing‚Ä¶. The location is absolutely perfect, the beach and marina are close enough to walk to (there are some stairs but you get a great view of the harbor) as for the Hotel, the grounds a perfectly manicured, the lobby is clean and modern, the rooms are nicely appointed and spacious, beds were awesomely comfortable!. We only ate once at the Hotel, breakfast on our last day, kids ordered off the menu and adults did the buffet, both were good but nothing to rave about‚Ä¶ its breakfast hard to make it real exciting!   Every staff member we encountered was professional and accommodating, all
Manager Response: Thank you for the lovely post! We love creating memorable getaways for our guests.  We are thrilled that you found us!  We hope that you are able to visit us this summer with your kids so they can experience our Kid's Splash Zone and the Kahuna Laguna Kid's Club.  We hope to see you soon!

Summary Heading: Beautiful rooms and grounds, great spa, great service!
Summary: We had a wonderful stay! The rooms were spacious and clean, the spa was lively and my massage amazing, Sunday brunch was superb!
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your wonderful comments. We hope to see you again real soon!

Summary: I spent a week end in this hotel recently and I had a wonderful relaxing experience. First class-plus bedrooms. Beautiful ocean view. Personel especially kind. Surrondings: so, so nice.
Manager Response: Thank you for the lovely post! We love creating memorable getaways for our guests. We hope you relax with us again soon.

Summary Heading: If you love service, a view, and a wonderful room....this is the place for you
Summary: We spent two nights at the Resort and loved every minute of it. From the greeting and attentiveness of the valet parkers to the wonderful experience of the front desk, this is one of the finest resort properties we have ever stayed at. The room, an upgraded suite, was magnificent with an ocean view. The balcony had two high chairs to look over the railing at beautiful sunsets. With two widescreen HD tv's even lolling around the room was enjoyable.   The bedding was typical of the Marriott program with their signature comfort. Housekeeping did an impeccable job at keeping the room clean and freshly toweled. Wonderful chocolates paired with turn-down service extended service well into the evening.  The bar is a welcome place to spend the time right before sunset. With fair priced
Manager Response: WOW! Thank you for the detailed review of your stay. We are very delighted that you had a memorable experience at the resort. We value our staff very much and we take pride in the level of service every member brings to our guests. I am delighted to hear that you were able to experience this level of service upon arrival at our resort.   We are very happy that you were able to enjoy an ocean view room and take in the beautiful sunsets of Dana Point. With our newly remodeled guest rooms, we have provided our guests with 250 thread count Frette Linen Beds that are extremely comfortable.   We hope you come back to experience our new Happy Hour in our OverVue Lounge. We also have added new items to our OverVue Lounge menu.   We regret that you were unaware of the parking charges as we inform guests in a few different areas regarding these fees.  On the confirmation you received for your guestroom our parking fee is noted under your room rate.  In addition, the parking fee is noted on our website under Guest Services.    We look  forward in seeing you again soon.

Summary: I have stayed at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott at least once a year for the past 7 years.  This time around (January 2012), they had remodled parts of the property, including the lobby and some rooms in the Del Mar Wing (perhaps others too).    It is a spectacular property, one of my favorites in S. Cal.  The views from most rooms are amazing. Some rooms are more accessible to the traffic noise than others, so be mindful of that.  I have stayed there on business and with the family, either way is great.   Love the breakfast buffet, especially enjoying it outside when the weather is nice.  Great workout room too. Great proximity to Lantern Bay park, the Marina, and the beach. Walking distance to several restaurants.  Very friendly and helpful staff.    Downsides:  parking fee, no
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your wonderful comments. We are so happy that you came back this year to experience our newly remodeled resort and fitness center.   Our location is breathtaking with spectacular views of the harbor and Pacific Ocean.   We are delighted that you were able to enjoy the breakfast buffet our Vue Restaurant has to offer. We provide a variety of delicious breakfast choices to satisfy everyone's needs.   We're looking forward in seeing you again next year!

Summary: I am writing this review late, our stay was from last January 2011. My Wife and I stayed here for a quick weekend get away from the snow back home.  We were looking forward to using the spa but was quite offended when we asked if we could see the spa facilities and the staff on duty acted as if we put them out, snobbish would be a great way to describe the experience.  You will pay to have someone park your car which is silly in this resort, they are really trying to be a 4 star hotel but it is far from that. I think that what really turned me off was that the overall vibe of the hotel was that of a three star hotel that really in their head think they are a five.  If you want attitude, a room that is a notch above a Best Western then by all means.... book this hotel.
Manager Response: On behalf of our entire staff, we are sorry that you were disappointed with our 4-Diamond resort. We take every review seriously and we will address your concerns with our team. We are ranked as being one of the top Marriott hotels for guest satisfaction and we regret that you left the resort not completely satisfied. Thank you again for addressing your concerns.

Summary Heading: A lovely break away, with a few quirks ..
Summary: Stayed there over the weekend.  The hotel is really pretty, and when we checked in, we were asked if we wanted 3 types of room upgrades (costing $30, $60 or $90).  I voted for the $30 upgrade with a view of the pool; in retrospect, I should have complained, when the bathtub drain took almost an hour to drain out, so if there are two of you, you are stepping into someone's dirty water (yuck) and we almost flooded the bathroom everytime we had a shower, the curtain does not cover the bathtub correctly, so the water poured onto the floor.  Nothing a couple of towels didn't fix though .... so it was fine.  The room was LOVELY; the beds were so comfortable, with clean linens, feathertop mattresses, and feather pillows; SOOOO comfortable!  The room was a little on the small side, but
Manager Response: We are very happy to hear that you were upgraded to a pool view room and you enjoyed the comfort of our feather top mattresses and pillows. We apologize for the inconvenience you experienced with the drain. Please note we encourage all guests to call the front desk with any concerns that they may have with their room. We have engineers on site 24 hours a day that will assist you with anything. It is our job to make your stay pleasurable.  We are very delighted that you enjoyed dinner at the Vue Restaurant and that you were able to experience the tranquility of our spa.   We are looking forward to seeing you again real soon.

Summary Heading: Nice facilities, good staff but add in wifi, food & not good value
Summary: My wife and I stayed here one weekend as a short "escape" for a belated birthday weekend for me. We live about an hour away.  Got a good deal (about $200 per night) for non-view room on the web. On check-in upgraded to coast view (highest category) for the equivalent of a partial coast view (they weren't busy). The facilities are nice--right above a public walking and picnic park with great harbor and ocean views that leads down to the harbor and (fairly mediocre) fish and other restaurants.Rooms were quite nice and had the promised coastal view. The staff is very friendly (everyone one we even passed in the halls smiled and said "hello") and well-trained, including restaurant staff. But they hit you for every little extra for a big wallop! Parking is only by valet and is $29.
Manager Response: Happy belated birthday. Thank you for sharing your recent experience with us. We are very pleased that you were upgraded to an ocean view room that you enjoyed. Our resort is in a great location with ocean views and just walking distance from the Dana Point Harbor. Our guests are very elated that we have walking and running trails so close to our facility.   We are delighted that you were able to experience the service of our well-trained staff in all of our outlets. We take great pride in the level of service we provide to all of our guests. It is very important to us to be ‚Äúat your service‚Äù at all times.   In reference to our parking cost, in recent parking surveys we‚Äôve conducted with our fellow resorts located on the coastline, we have found our parking rates to be in line and are actually the most economical.    We regret that our breakfast was not satisfactory to your liking. We thank you for your feedback and we will address your suggestions to our food and beverage staff. We want to be sure that every guest leaves our Vue restaurant satisfied.   We do hope you return to our hotel on your next visit to Dana Point. We value your opinion and business and would like to share with you all the improvements we‚Äôve made on your future visit.

Summary: Stayed at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott for three days during a business trip in december 2011. Arrived with a car, and the only available parking service was valet parking for $20 per night, this might be a little expensive. The staf at check-in was both helpful and friendly, and our room was upgraded to a room with sea view. The room it self was nice and clean, the temperature of the air-condition was sometimes acting up, but it helped to turn it on and off. We were staying at the hotel in december, this is a low season, so not all restaurants were open, and this gave us limited options for food. Fitness center at the hotel was large and newly renovated. Overall a very good hotel!
Manager Response: We are pleased that you had a "very good stay" at the resort. We are delighted that you were upgraded to an ocean view room. The views of the Pacific Ocean are quite spectacular. You mentioned that the room was nice and clean. We trust that you left with a sense of renewal.   Our entire staff is extremely well trained and their priority is giving our guests the highest level of service.   We regret that you had limited dining options. Our OverVue Lounge is a great place for tapas and we have a great in-room dining menu should you choose to have us deliver food to your room. Our guests also have the option of walking to the restaurants in beautiful Dana Point Harbor.   We are very glad you were able to enjoy the newly renovated fitness center with our brand new state of the art equipment.   We hope you come by and visit us again soon.

Summary: We stayed here for 1 night, 2 adjoining rooms for us and our kids.  The property is beautiful.  The rooms are updated, clean and very comfortable.  The pool area is really nice with a play area for the kids.  We loved the cabana style seating around the courtyard.  We ate breakfast and it was a great buffet.  The workout room had everything needed to get a good workout after the buffet!  The staff was friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.  The overall Dana Point area is very laid back and friendly.  We would have loved to stay longer but we had other plans in San Diego.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive comments. We are so happy that you were able to experience our newly renovated resort. The cabana's are truly an added bonus when you are relaxing by the pool. Our fitness center was just remodeled a few weeks ago with state of the art equipment. We are glad that you were able to work out and try the new facility.  We hope you are able to come again and stay longer on your next visit.

Summary: From the time of our arrival we were taken care of by the valets at the entrance, however there was a mix up with our rooms and I took about 20 min to get us checked in.  I absolutely loved the room!  The beds were very comfortable and the room was spacious and we did not feel cramped at all.  The rooms all have nice balconies and ours opened on to the pool with a view of the ocean.  We went to the spa and the treatments were fantasic, the staff was courteous and once they found out I was "recouperating" from my night out they suggested some great treatments to help me feel better!  The resort has 2 pools (one for the kids and one for the adults) and we enjoyed the service from the staff that works out by the pool.  Overall it was great, we spent an evening on their rooftop bar
Manager Response: We are delighted that you and your friends had a great time on your bachelorette party. Our beds are very comfortable and spacious and we are very happy that you were able to experience both pool and ocean view guest rooms. Our full service spa is truly a great place to unwind and rejuvenate.  We have many weddings at our resort and we make sure that every bride and groom receives the privacy they need. We hope you visit again soon.

Summary: My husband and I stayed at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resprt and Spa for 2 nights for our wedding.  We booked two separate rooms for each of us and our respective bridal parties.  It was a good stay overall but I was a little upset when I heard that someone stopped our photographer from taking pre-wedding pictures of our bridal party.  It was communicated that because we did not pay to have a wedding on hotel grounds, we were not permitted to take pictures on the hotel premises without paying an additional fee.  I suppose it makes sense and I probably should have done my own research on this but just wanted to share.  Happy vacationing!
Manager Response: We are very pleased that you had a good stay and we regret that your photographer was stopped from taking pictures. We do give all couples who are having their wedding at the resort  exclusive rights to the property.  We are very thankful that you understand the reasoning and we hope that this did not inconvenience you in any way.

Summary Heading: Peace and solitude to ring in the new year
Summary: I booked a room at this hotel at the last minute for a quiet New Year's Eve and wasn't disappointed. I relaxed by the pool, had an early sunset dinner in the restaurant, and spent a quiet evening reading. At midnight, I opened my window to look out over the distant water and listen to fireworks and people cheering in the new year. Despite the occasion, it wasn't at all loud in the room. In the morning, I walked down to the harbor and walked along the beach...a perfect way to ring out a difficult year and ring in 2012. I was on the third floor, and was disappointed that the windows were so small and high off the ground (and no balcony), but my pool view room also looked out over the ocean, which was unexpected and nice. The beds/linens are very comfortable, and I even took a hot
Manager Response: Happy New Year! Thank you so much for your wonderful feedback. We are delighted that we met your all of your expectations. It sounds like you had a wonderful start to your New Year. We are very happy that you were able to take a stroll along the harbor and beach. The weather was quite spectacular and having a resort so close to the beach allows our guests to take a nice walk and soak in the sun.  We appreciate your feedback regarding our parking fees and will certainly take your comments under review.  In recent parking surveys we‚Äôve conducted with our fellow resorts located on the coastline, we have found our parking rates to be in line and are actually the most economical.   We hope to see you again in the new year.

Summary: We spent one night; Christmas Eve, here, and we really enjoyed it. My husband and I walked around the streets of Dana Point and then enjoyed the sunset in the coctail lounge. We appreciated the layout of the hotel, and we LOVED the fact that our room had french doors that OPENED on to a little balcony with an ocean view of the harbor. I will always stay at hotels where I can open the windows and get fresh air!  The next morning, our room rate included the breakfast buffet for my husband and I, and our daughter and grandkids joined us for a delicious, beautiful buffet. The grandkid who is 3 years old ate for free. The buffet had everything including omelets and all kinds of beautiful fresh fruit. All of the restaurant staff was really accomodating and friendly.  We ran out of
Manager Response: none

Summary: Booked 3 rooms at this hotel for us an visiting family.  For starters, the restaurant is only open on the weekends.  Fine, we'll eat in the lounge.  At 2am, the fire alarm went off, repeatedly, for over a half hour.  The staff, untrained in how to operate the Alarm PA system, tried several times to tell us that it was a false alarm, only to be cut off by the system.  It went off again at 7:30am for another 15 minutes.  Needless to say we didn't get much sleep.  One of the 3 rooms had a broken heater, causing my sister to keep the balcony door open all night.  At checkout, we were told they were not compensating anyone for the alarms, that all equipment was "working exactly as it should," even though it went off twice at 5 hour intervals.  No compensation -- not even a snack --
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in Laguna Cliffs resort from 26th Dec- 28th Dec, 2011. On the 27th night, around 1.30am, the fire alarms in the hotel malfunctioned and kept going on and on for the entire night, making us unable to sleep. The kids had to be taken outside the hotel in dead of winter due to fire scare, only to find out the alarms had malfunctioned. Only at approx 9am next morning the alarms were fixed.  As a result of negligence of the hotel, we all couldn't sleep the entire night of 27th Dec, and had to make a long drive back home to San Jose. The hotel refused any compensation for the night and were very rude to us.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Spend two days in this charming resort. We were looking for a quiet retreat and it was just what we were looking for. Some dining options at walking distance, lovely view.
Manager Response: We're very glad that we made your two days enjoyable. Our views are breathtaking and we hope you visit again on your next retreat.

Summary: Let me start by saying that it is a very nice place. There are some cool lawn chair canopy things on the lawns, very pretty architecture etc. But based on the website I was expecting the hotel to be on a cliff right above the ocean and rather dramatic. This is not the case. In front of the hotel there is a public park and then a hill (with 116 stairs - good for running) and then through a parking lot to reach the marina.  The lobby and bar area are quite nice, the staff is super friendly, the breakfast buffet is very good. Food actually better than expected after reading the reviews. Try and get the deals that include breakfast (buffet is $20-$30) and include valet parking ($30/day) those are the best. The beds are THE most comfortable I have ever slept on. They have these
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments and suggestions. We are happy that you enjoyed the amenities of the hotel and the proximity of the resort to the harbor. It is a great location for taking a stroll along the beach or marina.  Our new bedding is a hit with all of our guests and we are so happy that you were able to enjoy the comfort that it has to offer.  We hope that on your next visit, you are able to stay in a room with the views you prefer.

Summary: This hotel has the wow factor for me.  Great views onto the sea especially from the breakfast area - great breakfast too. A lovely atmosphere in the hotel and cosy fire in the bar area.  The rooms are very comfortable and good beds.  Overall staff were very good although if you are travelling on business and need itemized receipts for all your meals make sure you ask while you're eating because I asked at the end and they literally had to search through all of the last week's receipts.  However, this hotel does come at quite a high price and the food is not cheap either. But if you have money to spare you'll have a great stay.  I also hate that you have to have valet parking at more than $20 per night and then you're expected to tip the valet boy too - but I guess that's the
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We try and "wow" every guest and we are very happy that you were able to experience it. The views of the Pacific Ocean are quite spectacular and we are glad that you were able to enjoy your breakfast while taking in the scenery.   We apologize if you were inconvenienced by waiting for your reciepts to be itemized. We hope to see you again on your next business trip.

Summary: The property is beautiful and the staff is friendly and helpful. Rooms and bathrooms are very nice.  Vue restaurant in the hotel has great food! They also have a great bar on the lobby level that opens up to a deck with great sunset views. They have heaters and blankets outside for when its cold. Nice touch!
Manager Response: none

Summary: The property is in a beautiful location and the hotel is well kept.  The rooms are a bit small but the views and nice pools are great.  We stayed over the weekend and we could hear the family above us the entire night.  I spoke with the front desk and they said this isn't usual to hear others but we sure did.  In the restroom when I was brushing my teeth I could hear the person in the room next door coughing.  The walls are way too thin and thus I wouldn't stay at this hotel again.
Manager Response: We sincerely regret the disturbance of the people above you and any inconvenience the noise  may have brought to you.

Summary Heading: Do NOT eat the room service.....
Summary: I really wish I had noticed the bad reviews for this hotel and booked at the Regis.    My family and were looking for somewhere local to spend Thanksgiving.  The buffet here was about $30 less per person than the Regis and I ALWAYS love getting Marriott points, so we choose to go here.  The hotel is in a great location.  I was a liitle disappointed that my oceanview room was one of the few at the hotel without a balcony, but we made the best of it - spending time at the pool and walking the cliffs overlooking the ocean.  The Thanksgiving Buffet was good -- but at ~$250 for the three of us (two adults and a child) -- I am not sure we were able to eat enough to make it worth it.   The WORSTpart was that late that night (we had the buffet at 1 pm) we got hungry and ordered room
Manager Response: I am very sorry to hear about your son not feeling well. Thank you for your comments. We take every review seriously and I will be sure to address your concerns with the appropriate staff members.

Summary: Year after year we enjoy a luxurious experience at this property - the staff fom Valet to General Managers are accomodating and welcoming. We travel globally and stay here at least once a year. The property provides numerous amentities-spa, kids camp, beach toys etc.. We even love the Room Service and family movie night is not to be missed!
Manager Response: We are so pleased to hear that you had another great experience with your family this visit. We have an exceptional staff and we try to accommodate every guest by providing an array of amenities. We hope to see you again real soon.

Summary: My wife and I met at this hotel back in 1990 when it was the Dana Point Resort.  The upgrades that Marriott has introduced are phenomenal.  The d√©cor of the restaurants is much improved.  I love the historic photos around every corner.  The rooms are great and the beds the best I have ever slept in.  My only complaint was that Wi-Fi, which is free at most hotels, is a steep $12.50 per day. Proximity to Dana Point Harbor is a big plus.  Everyone should check on the Ocean Institute and the historic ships they have there.
Manager Response: Wow, your story is so touching. We are so happy that you came back to visit with your wife after the renovation. We have changed all the bedding and furniture in all of the guest rooms and we have heard wonderful comments about the comfort of the beds. We are happy that you had a chance to explore the resort and see all the additions including the historical pictures placed around the hotel. We hope you and your wife come back and visit.

Summary Heading: Really Impressed with the Service Here
Summary: Stayed for 2 nights for business at the end of November. From the minute I arrived, there were numerous persons who provided such excellent service, it has left an impression on me. There is only valet parking there, at 29.00 per night. The car is brought immediately after a quick phone call with an offer of a water bottle "for the road". Room was remodeled, it was extremely clean and modern, with a very comfortable bed, and wonderful amenities in the bathroom. Turn down service offered every night - a nice touch. The tub is the old school tub shower combo, with a curtain, but that did not detract from my overall experience however much I may prefer the walk in shower. I had a pool/coast view with a balcony. Quite lovely and I recommend that. The pool area has a hot tub, nice
Manager Response: We want to thank you for your time in writing this great review. We are so pleased to hear that we went above and beyond your expectations and that we were able to make your stay so pleasurable. We have a wonderful team of staff members that take pride in making every guest's stay memorable and enjoyable. We are very proud of the amenities our resort has to offer and we are pleased to hear that you were able to experience most of them. We hope to see you again real soon.

Summary: We really enjoyed this hotel! Impeccable customer service, very nice and quite hotel, modern room and extremely comfy bed, Kids club, splash zone, very nice and clean pool + kids pool! Simply LOVE IT!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. The splash zone and Kahuna Laguna Kid's Club is such a hit for both the kids and parents. We are so happy that your family was able to experience both. We are so pleased you enjoyed the beds. We have had many great compliments about the comfort of our new beds. We hope to see you all again very soon.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous Hotel with great jacuzzi and location to surf spots
Summary: Can't say enough great things about this hotel.  Great surf vibe.  Great food.  Great hotel that opened onto the pool deck.   Great location to several renowned surf spots.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I came here for a convention.  This is a pleasant spa-type hotel with nice amenities.  They had a room ready for me at 12:30 p.m. on the day I arrived, and were able to give me a quiet room which I had requested.  The beds were extremely comfortable.  On the plus side, high quality wireless Internet was available free of charge.  On the minus side, valet parking was $29/day (discounted somewhat because of my convention) and there was no self-parking.
Manager Response: Your comfort is very important to us and we are happy that we were able to accommodate your needs. We hope that we can be of great service again to you and your colleagues. We hope to see you soon.

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel and you will enjoy the stay
Summary: Great service and a great location. You cannot go wrong with this place.
Manager Response: Thank you very much for your compliments. We value your opinion and hope to see you back real soon.

Summary Heading: I'm a repeat guest....excellent location and service
Summary: I have stayed at Laguna Cliffs several times, and they truly provide 5-star service each time.  The rooms (and the beds!) are great, location is awesome, and the breakfast buffet can't be beat.  The front desk, valet and concierge are friendly, responsive and are on top of their game.  Highly recommended.
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments. We are so happy that you had a comfortable stay at our ocean view resort. We take great pride in our staff and the quality of service they provide to each and every guest. We take great joy in providing a "Wow" experience and we hope to have you here again soon.

Summary: Beautiful hotel with excellent service.  Its a big hotel, but beginning with check-in we felt special.  My husband & I celebrated our anniversary here and received complimentary champagne & strawberries with a handwritten note from management.  We;ve returned twice since and enjoy our stay each time.  If you're not going anywhere, self-parking is fine.  We loved just hanging out on our balcony, going for swims, walks in the park and down to the beach.  Close to the Marina if you're into sailing or whale watching.  Hotel restaurants are pretty good and lots of great choices a few minutes drive away.
Manager Response: We are delighted that you and your husband chose to stay with us on your anniversary. We are very happy that you had a great stay and that you were able to take advantage of the short walk to the park and beach. We hope to see you both again real soon.

Summary: The Marriott Laguna Cliffs is one of our favorite hotels we have been there on numerous occasions. The grounds,pools and rooms are very nice and well kept up. The hotel  restaurant the Vue is amazing, if you get the buffet its all you can eat from ever thing from salmon capers to fruit. If you go to the restaurant sit outside on the patio. Our room was one of the smaller ones and was on about the 3 or 4th floor and said we had a resort view but we could see down the San Clemente coast from  our balcony. They have 2 different pools one is more kid family oriented and the other more adult oriented. The parking is valet only i believe and kinda pricey. The location is about a 10 min walk from down town Dana Point and about a 5 min walk from the Dana Point Harbor. I have stayed at
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here twice last November. We went on a whim in the beginning of the month and liked it so much that we returned 2 weeks later. The property is gorgeous. The building is in the style of the famous Hotel Del Coronado with striking red gabled rooftops and beautiful park and ocean views. The rooms were very nice and comfortable and clean. It was too cold to swim, but the pool looked very inviting. The only negative is the very high overnight parking charge you are forced to pay since there is no alternative street parking near-by. You have to drive to get anywhere but the location is worth it. We used Priceline and got a very good deal so we were thrilled.
Manager Response: We are very glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay at the resort. Our culinary team does a great job in providing exceptional food options and we are delighted that you were able to experience it. We hope to see you again soon.

Summary: This hotel is an awesome place to stay in Dana Point.  Went for a birthday weekend, and it was great.  There are plenty of places to go around it, and the pool is great.  However, be prepared to pay the parking (a ridiculous rate for guests).
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed at the Dana Point Marriott mid October - wonderful property - great views, took beautiful pictures of the sunset from the pool patio area, upgraded to a suite which was spectacular and the bed was the best hotel bed I have ever slept in.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice hotel with many dining option nearby
Summary: Upon pulling into the driveway this hotel isnt all that great looking.  It has a Cape Cod style. When you step into the lobby the style changes into a very chic and modern hotel. The lobby bar area is great for drinks but the food was not up to par especially for the price. We sat in the lobby a couple of times for an after dinner drink. It's very comfortable with couches and a fireplace. We picked a seat furthest from the bar and sat with our kids for a while by the fire (it was chilly) They also have outside seating with lots of stand up heaters. We had connecting rooms one with a king size bed and the other with 2 doubles. It was very nicely decorated. We had a view of the pool which had a spray area for children. My kids loved it and had a great time despite the cool
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for a family get away.  At a corporate rate of $199 per night, this was a great value.  The grounds were beautiful with awesome trees that provided plenty of shade along with deep green grass that added a park like feeling to the resort.  We were also upgraded to an ocean view harbor view which was very nice.  The room was comfortable, the beds very nice with good furnishings.  The staff was also great with valley parking at $29 per night (no self-parking).  The food is expensive, yet there are plenty of restaurants nearby.  Last, there was a short walk to the beach that offered a marina as well as plenty of room to enjoy the sandy shore.  The entry into the ocean is quite rocky, so be prepared accordingly.  Overall, great value for the money!
Manager Response: We are so happy that you enjoyed your stay and were able to take advantage of the harbor and beach nearby. We hope that you and your family visit again soon.

Summary Heading: Very poor service for a four star resort
Summary: Our room was very dirty.  One of the headboards is falling off the wall and  there was chewing gum left on the patio which I stepped in with bare feet. I had complimentary breakfast yet the restaurant either didnot have or didnot give me the tea bags/ tea early morning ( I was going in for breakfast later as I had a meeting there) ;  so I had to go down to cafe and buy a cup of tea after standing in a queue. The beds a re divine. There are only a few things that are not so great. Bathrooms need updating, parking is valet only, and the AC doesn't work too well. I love that is a little off the normal path as it allows it to sit a top a hill and seems more peaceful than being in town.  Mandatory valet but it was included in our rate as was breakfast.  Check in was easy and the staff very helpful.  They let us know that we could rent a laundry list of items including, chairs, umbrella, surfboard, etc for a fee of $30 a day which included a shuttle to the beach.  Room was beautiful and had a quaint balcony.  Pool was very nice and staff there were very attentive as well.  There is a wonderful park with a running trail and great views right in front of the hotel.  I would stay here again without a second

Summary: We spent five nights here for our ninth anniversary and we were upgraded to an executive suite because of my Platinum Premier status.  This property faces a park and the marina. The maid did an excellent job and the staff was very accommodating. The pool looked nice although I didn't spend any time there.  We stayed here instead of the Ritz Carlton because it took less Marriott points and there was no additional resort fee. Summary Heading: Lovely place. Will go again and recommend to others.

Then we got to our room it faced the area where the band was playing and it was LOUD in the room as well. That was the only complaint we had. The next day there was a wedding on the lawn outside of our room. It was very sweet. But again the music was loud and we could not open our patio door to enjoy the ocean breezes and sunset. The DJ played great music! We just wanted a little less noise and little more privacy in our room. The staff was outstanding. They made sure we were taken care of.

Summary: stayed at the Laguna Cliffs from 4th July for one week.  We booked on line and got the bes and breakfast package which was excellent value. Taxi service was very poor from the Amtrak station in SJC and after waiting over 30 minutes for a taxi, I finally called the hotel and they were willing to send one of their cars to pick us up from the train station.  Check-in was very efficient and we were in our room within 5 minutes.  The bellman was very helpful and informed us that a complimentary shuttle was available to take us to the harbor for dining.  The room was an adequate size with a patio and views of the park and the water.  The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was an average size.  There is no bar fridge

Summary: We were looking forward to here but I have to say that it was a bit of a disappointment! The room we were given was dull and then we found that the bath was slow draining and after the "handyman" sorted it black stuff started to come up the drain. They moved us to another room but lost stuff on the way and it took ages to get everything and I ended up sorting it all myself. I really wanted to park it myself as the car park is across the entrance and it would have been much quicker to get it. Summary Heading: Trust Trip Advisor Reviews and Ratings

We wanted a getaway weekend but didn't want to go to San Diego for the 100th time.  I did a little research and boy was this place a hit!  We flew into John Wayne to avoid the LA crush....it's only a 15 minute drive (depending on time of day) so that was a great start.  We arrived and the pictures don't do this place justice.  It really is beautiful and reminded us of driving up to the Del Coronado.  Valet was prompt (5 guys out there) and we were in the beautiful lobby in no time. Summary Heading: Sprawling lawns on the bluffs over the Pacific evoke a bygone romantic era.
Summary: Although this is owned by Marriot don't let this dissuade you from experiencing the romance of a period property. This elegant resort of a bygone romantic era is perched on the Laguna Cliffs made famous by Richard Dana in his book, "Two Years Before the Mast". Its location and the grand layout of its sprawling lawns reminded me of the Nantucket, Cape Cod and Hamptons compounds of the wealthy. It is clean, fresh and newly renovated. The service is incomparable. Everyone is anxious to help without getting in the way. The rooms are impeccable! And the beds.... the bedding is the most comfortable you can imagine. Summary: Excellent, brand new facility.  I stay in many Marriotts and this is definitely among the top of them.   This was a family trip with two very young boys.  Pros -  Great location (not on the beach, but nearby at the bottom of the hill.  Close to whale watching boats too) -  Great for families with young children (has separate special pool area for young children, also hotel arranged for a babysitter for a reasonable fee to help us out during the day) -  Great breakfast buffet (ours was included) -  Spacious suites (I think there are 8 of them or so, definitely needed if you have a family since there are two rooms) -  Wonderful staff - very pleasant and professional - hotel provided an arrival gift (champagne, nuts, strawberries)  Cons -  Parking is very expensive and mandatory if

Summary Heading: Absolutely beautiful resort with extremely accommodating staff
Summary: This was a special reunion for four sisters who had not 'all' been together for six years. I expressed this to the front desk when checking into our room.  We were treated in such a welcoming manner with several extras added for our enjoyment.  All of us were more than pleased with the hotel setting, amenities, & the extremely friendly people Marriott hired to work for them.  Any special request was met with a quick response & graciousness.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an upscale place on the beach for a reasonable price [if you don't require an ocean view from your room & can compromise on the room size]. Oh yes, the real surprise is that finally a hotel has started putting decent coffee in the rooms.  Great Frech Roast.  Thanks Marriott!

Summary Heading: This resort is a secret gem!
Summary: My family and I really enjoyed our stay here.  Everything about the resort is well done - the views of the ocean are lovely, the service is flawless, the food was very good and presented beautifully, pools are fun, the rooms are spacious, and the overall ambiance is relaxing and luxurious.  My 3 year old son loved the shallow pool and playful water features.  I enjoyed the pool side service with good drinks and food.  My wife said her spa experience was perfectly relaxing.  I also really enjoyed sitting outside to enjoy the breakfast buffet.  During our vacation we took a short drive up to Laguna Beach for the day and on another day went down to Dana Point Harbor for dinner.  The hotel is right off PCH just one minute off I-5. Summary: I have stayed at Laguna Cliffs Marriott several times for both business and pleasure, and each time the visit has been great!  The service is awesome, the staff extra friendly, the rooms (and beds) perfect, and it has a great view of the ocean.  This is one of my favorite places to stay on the west coast.  Highly recommended.

Summary: This hotel is a delightful hotel. Very comfortable and the refurbishment is very tastefully done indeed. Although we didn't have a balcolny most of rooms in the hotel have beautiful balcolnies which we were told go very fast indeed. However, our room was lovely and the bed oh so comfy. We had a view of the ocean from our room along with the road that ran past the hotel. It was quite strange when we drew up to check in as my husband had to ask if it was a Marriott for fear we had the wrong place. There are no Marriott signs as it retains its original name which was the Laguna Cliffs Resort and Spa and the valets, porters, concierge and people who check you in don't wear any Marriott badges - in fact there is nothing Marriott to be seen apart from a small book in your bedside

Summary: Overall, a really nice hotel, friendly staff, incredible views. I expected though to be able to walk to the shops and restaurants, but you have to either walk down a steep flight of 119 steps or walk down the steep driveway which was even worse.  Not good for someone with bad knees so I drove down. Not a big deal though as there's lots to see in the neighboring towns as well.  Also, there's very little to choose from in the restaurant which was a bit disappointing.  As a treat to myself, I splurged and did the Invigorating Ritual ( mud wrap/massage) at the spa which was wonderful!  I would definitely go back.

Summary: My husband and I, in our 60's, stayed at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott Resort and Spa for 3 nights to celebrate my birthday. Summary Heading: Decent place to be in; but everything on top of your room is charged.

Summary: On a birthday trip for my wife's birthday, we stayed at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott. The hotel is nice and seems to be recently renovated. We received a pleasant surprise from the hotel when we were brought champagne and strawberries. I wasn't expecting that and it was well received, especially after a long flight from the east coast.  Breakfast at the hotel was delicious and better if you order from the menu as there are more options.   The property is beautiful as it overlooks a cliff, hence the name, and seems to be a popular event destination. It's minutes away from the shops at Laguna Beach and a nice 20-25 minute drive to Newport Beach.   Great stay and definitely recommended if you're considering a nice hotel in the area!

Summary: Stayed at Laguna Cliffs for 4-nights on business/pleasure trip.  Had conference in Anaheim but wanted to get some ocean in.  This was a little further than I wanted, but got great value on Priceline and love the Dana Point area.  Overall very satisfied.  The hotel is in an awesome location on a bluff overlooking Dana harbor and the Pacific ocean.  From just about anywhere at the hotel you can catch a glimpse of water and majestic seascapes.  You are high enough up that you can see the entire marina and up the coast for miles.  If you book right (which I didnt through Priceline), your room can look out over the coast.    Getting to the hotel is very easy off of the 5.  The hotel has its own entrance off the harbor drive that it shares with a great little park on the cul de sac.

Summary: Other reviewers have reported on the many positive aspects of this facility..I will only mention 2 irritants...the absurd mandatory parking (and fees)  and the disruption to the smooth operation of a quality place caused by the ongoing construction. Summary: I am not a big tripadvisor participant, but i wanted to set the record straight based on all the comments reagarding construction.  This place is obviously a business oriented destination resort undergoing a huge renovation, therefore at least 2/3 of the place is closed.  Guests stay in newly redone rooms.  I paid $159 per night including breakfast--this is a very good rate, however, the place is not worth a penny more.    Dana Point is a far less attractive site than further north to Laguna or the Beaches south.  All the service was excellent--the place was empty--it is very, very adequate accomidations if you get this at the right price.  You should not be put off by the construction if your concern is for accomidations, but this is not a destination spa location.

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay, nice big clean rooms, beautiful resort
Summary: My three friends and I stayed here for a girl's night out. The resort is in a beautiful location. We had a ground floor garden room with a lovely roomy patio.   The room was spacious. The room was big enough to accomodate my three friends and I no problem.   After a night out, we all slept like babies in the comfy beds that Marriott Resorts are known for. The next morning we ordered room service which was great. The pool area was really nice, clean, and relaxing.  The grounds were beautiful, I wish we had more time to walk around.  The only thing we didn't like about this resort was the $27 valet parking. Self parking was $25 so who would self park?

The hotel is non-smoking, however, our room smelled heavily of cigarettes.  When we notified the desk they offered to come spray air freshener!?!  We declined. At 5:30 a.m. I was awakened by someone on the grounds w/ a loud walkie-talkie discussing the preparation of breakfasts for the guests ( I did leave the balcony door open...). Summary: I booked this hotel for my parents for it's amazing views and location.  My parents are in their 80's, so I was very specific about what i wanted: a room near the elevator, a balcony and ocean view.  My confirmation receipt confirmed this.  My parents arrived to be given a room way at the end of a hallway, no balcony and very high windows (my mom is tiny and couldn't see out).  The confirmed requests were completely ignored! I wasn't with them and they are way too kind to raise a fuss.  I found out after the weekend and called to complain.  The first 2 people I talked to were very rude and said my parents should have spoken up if they were not safisfied.  After I emailed the Marriott corp. I received a call from Eric, who was very nice.  It still did not make up for my folks.

Summary: My husband and I spent the weekend at this resort to celebrate our anniversary.  Every single staff member we came in to contact with was friendly and attentive.  The hotel is under renovation, but we were not disturbed in any way by the renovation.  The breakfast buffet in the VUE restaurant was delicious and offered a wide variety of breakfast foods.  The pool and jacuzzi were packed with children and since there was only one pool open, it was a little crowded and loud, but we still found a place to lounge and relax.  The concierge staff provided great restaurant recommendations and the front desk staff accommodated every request with genuine interest and a smile.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I'm not sure if this resort is tailored for bringing your kids, but it was mayhem around every turn with little kids running, screaming, and crying everywhere.  Don't get me wrong, the hotel itself is very clean, the pools & spa are nice, and the service staff is surprisingly helpful and polite.  The location is actually up on a hill, so don't let the pictures on the website deceive you into thinking it's "on the beach".  You have to take a car down the hill, and even then you're at Dana Point Harbor (not beach), but Doheny is just down the road.  We stayed for brunch on Sunday, and the food was great.  There was a wedding the night before, and most of the wedding party and guests were in the restaurant (packed), but it didn't seem to affect the prompt and very friendly service.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Amazing Service and Staff and Gorgeous Views
Summary: I have to say that Laguna Cliffs Marriott is hands-down one of the best Marriott resorts at which I have stayed when it comes to superior customer service and a fantastic and helpful staff.  I have been a platinum member with Marriott hotels for the past four years, and I have definitely seen my fair share of Marriott properties.  While this particular property isn't the most modern in the world (e.g., the lobby and restaurant music is stuck in the 80s and the decor could definitely use some revamping), the overall friendliness and extreme helpfulness of EVERY staff member eclipses anywhere that the outdated style and smaller sized rooms may lack.  This is a fantastic property and the view is absolutely breathtaking.  I would definitely come back here just to experience it all

At the pool the come around with fresh fruit and cold water ala Four Seasons but without the cost. Food and beverage service at the pool as well. The pier is within walking distance of the hotel, but the hotel is on a cliff.  No problem to walk down to the pier but bring the shuttle number from the hotel for them to come and pick you up; the hike back up the cliff is steep (118 steps). If you make eye contact with anyone that works there they will ask you if you're having a good stay or how you're doing.  I was impressed.  The attention to detail is wonderful...fresh juice and water with strawberries floating are available in the lobby during the day.    The hotel is a five minute walk down hill from the harbor. There are also some good seafood restaurants at the bottom of the hill.  However, the area is not highly walkable unless you are a dedicated walker.  We are, but we still took the car everywhere. Summary: This hotel worked out fine for our family of three.  It was clean and roomy. Summary Heading: New Year's Eve at Laguna Cliffs
Summary: Me and my husband stayed here during New Year's Eve weekend 2006 and we really enjoyed our stay. Our room was very nice and comfortable,  and with a nice view, as well.  We did not eat at the hotel nor did we use the pool.  We walked around the hotel a bit, and we could tell that it was definitely nowhere near to being sold out.  It was very quiet and there were no events taking place.  On a side note, some of the meeting rooms had patios, so this would definitely be a nice place to book a meeting.  I would definitely stay here again.

Summary: Recently stayed at this hotel for  the weekend.   I would not recommend the site to anyone.   First problem is the amazing noise and crowds from all the weddings going on. The staff reply was this was just the way things were. Second the location is not great.  Quite a walk to get to the harbor or beach.  Again not well explained when you get a room. For the price you can do much better.   Dana Point itself was great.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Best experience in a Resort by far.

Summary Heading: Not bad, but nothing special either
Summary: Just came back from a weekend stay. To me this hotel is nice enough, but not at all exceptional, so it is important to go in with the proper expectations or you'll risk being disappointed.   For starters the view is not as nice as you might expect given it overlooks the water, as it is actually set back further than it appears in the marketing materials. The beds are comfy but the rooms aren't anything special either.   The room service food fits the same bill, not bad but not great either. Something else to be aware of is that it isn't cheap if you bring a car, I think it cost us $22/day to park, supposedly the same rate if you valet or self-park. Summary Heading: Not a Resort, but not a bad 3*
Summary: We spent one night at this Marriott on our way from a late night departure from Disneyland to San Diego. It has a great location, near I-5 and on the beach. Upon check-in, I was offered a smoking room, but after pressing for a few minutes, the manager came in and switched me to a room with two double beds, non-smoking. It had a coastal view (from a distance), but I was not charged for the upgrade. No resort fee either. The room and beds were high quality and clean. The resort seemed to have excellent facilities. Unfortunately, we only stayed one night and did not get to check out all it had to offer.   The $22 parking fee is ridiculous. Summary: This pretty property perched on a hill overlooking the dana point harbor sets expectations too high.  Rooms were average and very noisy as they are situated around the pool or overlooking driveways.  There is not enough staff to service the hotel-- painters in the elevator on a Saturday so a stroller can't even fit in, and almost non-existant maid service.  We left our room for 6 hours and it still wasn't cleaned.  Quite disappointing...even though the company paid.  The only plus was that it is a short walk to community parks, the harbor, and the ocean beach.  Don't pay full rates!

Summary: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay here. Beautiful grounds, small but well appointed rooms;view was terrific from our room. Even the elevator had a good view! The staff is attentive and friendly. I felt safe there and the grounds were well kept and very clean. The hotel is situated on a hill by a nice park and close to great walking areas, the state beach and town. The fee for parking is ridiculous so if you don't mind the short walk, park on the street and save $22/night. The fitness center is one of the better facilities I've seen for a hotel/resort. Manager Response: none

Summary: I've stayed at this location on two separate occasions, both due to business.  The room size and appearance is good; however, the noise level is horrible.  The walls must be very thin as I heard ALL activities by my neighbors.  When I requested a room change, I met much resistance and was told there were no rooms available.  After further research on the Internet, I returned to the desk to note my findings and was then relocated to another room, which was not much better.    The second visit, I again met with much resistance (from the manager) when I requested a room change due to the activity in the pool during late hours.    Customer service at this resort is terrible. I have stayed at many resorts, including several Marriott locations, and this is a total disappointment.

Summary: Recently stayed here for a work meeting.  The hotel is nice, but not as nice as shown on the website. Summary: An almost perfect three nights were spent in this hotel.  The food was absolutely delicious, the service quite good and the accomodations, comfy and deluxe. The hotel is also walking distance from Dana Point Harbor and a short hop in the car to Laguna.

Summary Heading: Not Quite "4 Star" But Solid At The Right Price
Summary: Beautiful venue, rooms were nicely decorated and bedding was appropriately luxurious.  They put us in a "smoking optional" wing without our knoweledge but corrected the problem promtly by moving us to another.  Didn't get a chance to check out the food service. Not quite a "4 star" but for the right price we would stay there again.   As for Doheny beach, be warned that the shoreline is a little rocky and not good for the little ones wading around in. It's a surfers area not a good "lay out in the sand" beach. The park itself, although, is pleasant and of course Dana Harbour is full of opportunities.

Summary: This property is situated in such a way that your breath will be taken! Summary: My 18 year old son and I were guests at the Laguna Cliffs Marriott last November over Thanksgiving week. We flew to Newport because a friend was very ill. The staff were wonderful to us. Being far from home on the holiday was made easier by the kindness the staff extended to us. Friends and family joined us a few times for coffee, etc., in the lobby and the service was great. Summary: We stayed here for 2 nights and found the property to be more of a hotel than a resort.  The room was small but very bright and overlooking the pool.  If you turned your head to the right we did have an ocean view (a very pretty one) and the hotel is walking distance from Doheny Beach Park which has a great beach and playground for the kids.  The sauna and steam room at the gym were closed both days which was annoying since the hotel is not cheap.  The staff was very accomodating and full of great suggestions for restaurants, etc.  Aside from a couple of gripes it was a pleasant stay.

Summary Heading: Nothing going for it, stay elsewhere
Summary: Relatively expensive, huge building with small rooms. OK view sliced out for the majority of rooms, but not worth it considering the cookie cutter interior and complete lack of charm in the immediate area and especially the hotel.  I stayed in Laguna Beach on a subsequent night at La Casa del Camino based stricly on a quick web search. Though the room was just as small, the area was better, they didn't nail you for $20 to park, and the whole design didn't have the cheap veneer of the Marriott.

Summary: This hotel not RESORT has a beautiful view & grounds. However, we were very disappointed that this hotel classified itself as a RESORT.
